Cover crock pot. Cook on low for 5 hours. Add onion soup mix. Cook an additional 1 hour. Transfer beef to serving platter. Pour sauce from crock pot over top of roast. Serve with rice or potatoes.

Cream together the butter, sugars and vanilla. Beat eggs into the creamed mixture and combine with flour, baking soda and salt. Fold chocolate chips and nuts into the batter. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Makes 16-20 cookies.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Beat 2 eggs until thick. Add 2 tablespoons of sugar and a pinch of salt to eggs and beat again. Add 1 banana and beat again. Add potato flour and beat again. Pour batter into a greased and floured loaf pan and bake for 50 minutes. Serve warm.

Spread cheese spread into the bottom of the slow cooker. Add cream cheese and stir to combine. Add smoked sausage and stir to combine. Add Rotel and stir to combine. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a large skillet over medium heat saute garlic in olive oil until fragrant. Add beet greens. Saute until wilted. Add wine and cook until absorbed. Add bacon bits and saute until heated through. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Place graham cracker pie crust into 9-inch pie plate. In microwaveable dish combine caramel topping and 1 cup (235 mL) milkmicrowave on HIGH 5 minutes or until caramel is melted and mixture is bubbly. Add 1/2 cup (125 mL) of remaining caramel toppingmicrowave 2 minutes more or until caramel is melted and mixture is bubbly. In large bowl whisk together caramel mixture and 4 cups (1 L) milkwhisk until smooth. Stir in vanilla pudding mix and cool whipfold in chocolate-covered english toffee bars. Pour caramel mixture into prepared graham cracker pie crusttop with toffee bar crunch mixture and chocolate shavings to coverchill 2 hours or until set. Let stand 15 minutes before slicing and serving.

Preheat grill or grill pan to medium heat. Drizzle vegetable oil onto a plate. Dip each chicken strip into the oil so the breading will stick. Place the strips in the prepared pan or grill. Brush each side of the strips with the juice mixture. Fry strips in the oil for 4 to 6 minutes or until golden brown. Place strips onto a baking sheet. Bake in a preheated 375 degrees F oven for 8 to 10 minutes or until heated through. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Bring 2 cups of water to boil in a small saucepan. Add 1 cup of barley. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain barley in a sieve. Place barley in a large bowl. Add remaining ingredients. Toss gently to coat. Refrigerate for at least an hour.
Cook beef in crock pot in beef broth 3 hours. Add onion, brown mustard, sauce. Cook 2 hours more. Add bourbon. Cook 2 hours more. Add brown sugar. Cook 1 hour more.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Lightly coat two baking sheets with cooking spray. In a large bowl, toss together oats, walnuts, raisins, flax seed, brown sugar, olive oil, honey and cinnamon. In a separate bowl, whisk together flour and salt. Add flour mixture to oat mixturemix well. Spread mixture evenly onto prepared baking sheets. Bake 50 minutes to 1 hour or until golden brown. Let cool completely. In a small bowl, combine granola mixture with the vanilla.

Combine flour and powdered sugar in a bowl. Cut in margarine with a pastry blender. Combine eggs and sugar in a bowl and beat until light and fluffy. Add flour and margarine mixture. Stir in lemon juice. Turn batter into an ungreased 9 x 13 inch pan. Sprinkle with coconut. Bake at 350 until lightly brown.

In bread machine, add blueberries, sugar, dry pectin, lime juice and zestselect bread setting (use water for liquid)press Start buttonwhen cycle is complete, remove dough from bread machine. Place dough on floured surfaceknead until smooth (about 2-3 minutes). Shape dough into a 9x5x2 1/2-inch loafplace in 9x5x2-inch loaf pan (with greased sides)cover with plastic wraplet rest for 20 minutesuncover and let rise until doubled (about 40-50 minutes). Bake in 350f oven for 35-40 minutesremove from ovenlet cool on wire rack for 5 minutesremove from bread panlet cool for 10 minutes before slicing.

Wash and dry strawberries. Using your hands, stuff each berry with cheese. Place berries in 8oz. microwave safe dish. Top with walnuts. Pour in splenda. Microwave for 2 minutes or until bubbly. Allow to cool completely. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours or overnight.

In large pot, brown ground beef and onion over medium heat. Add green bell pepper and garlic. Mix in 2 1/2 cups Rotel tomatoes and 1 1/2 cups tomato sauce. Add 4 1/2 cups of cooked cabbage. Combine thoroughly. Pour into prepared crock pot. Add 1 1/2 cups butter. Cook on low heat for 7 hours. Serve with French bread.

Place all the marinade ingredients in a blender and process until smooth. Place in a large bowl. Add chicken and toss to coat. Marinate in refrigerator for 2 to 4 hours. Drain and discard marinade. Grill or broil until desired doneness.
Toss together all the salad ingredients in a large salad bowl. Mix in the dressing. Toss well. Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.

Melt the butter and sautee the onion and ginger in the olive oil for about 5 minutes or until translucent. Add the broth and stir to deglaze the pan. Add the carrots and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for about 10 minutes or until the carrots are tender when pierced with the tip of a knife. Add the honey and salt and pepper to taste and puree with an immersion blender or in batches in a blender or food processor. If the soup is too thick, add more broth to thin it out. Serve hot or cold and top with grated or slivered almonds or chopped herbs, if desired.
Cut squash in half and scoop out seeds. Place squash cut side down in a 13 x 9 pan. Pour butter and brown sugar over squash. Bake for 1 hour. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.

In a large skillet, melt the butter. Saute the beef until brown on all sides. Pour the beef stock over the beef. Add the mustard and bring to boil. Cover the skillet with aluminum foil. Simmer for 25 minutes. Add the tomatoes, mushrooms and onion. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add bacon. Cook until browned, about 5 minutes. Transfer bacon to paper towels to drain. In the same skillet heat 1 tbsp. Butter over medium heat until lightly foamed. Stir in flour until smooth. Cook for 1 minute stirring constantly. Gradually whisk in the milk until smooth. Cook until thickened slightly, about 1 minute stirring constantly. Stir in remaining butter, the cheeses, oregano and bacon. Season with salt and white pepper to taste. Place the chicken breasts on the prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle with the salt and white pepper to taste. Brush the tops of the chicken with the cheese mixture. Bake until the tops are lightly golden brown about 15 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before slicing.

Heat butter in skillet over medium heat. Add celery and green onions. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add rice and cook for another 5 minutes. Add orange juice, salt and orange. Cook for 20 minutes over medium heat. Sprinkle with slivered almonds.

Cook the macaroni noodles according to package directions and drain the noodles in a colander when finished cooking. While the noodles are cooking, brown the ground beef in a skillet and then drain the meat in a colander as well. In a large bowl combine the beef, sweet corn, tomato soup, taco seasoning, onions, macaroni noodles, cheese, black olives, and green pepper. Mix well to combine all the ingredients together. Transfer the mixture to a 9 x 13 inch baking dish or a similar sized pan. Bake the mixture in the oven until the cheese has melted and the mixture is bubbly. Serve hot with fresh salsa if desired!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 13x9 baking dish with 2 inches of greaseproof paper. Beat butter and 1 1/2 cups sugar with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time until thoroughly combined. Stir together flour and baking powder and add to sugar mixture alternating with milk. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 40 minutes. Remove cake from oven and invert onto a wire rack to cool completely.

Remove stems from the mushrooms and discard. Rinse the mushrooms under cold water and pat dry. Remove the hardened ends from the shallots and cut the shallots into slices. Put the mushrooms and shallots in a small bowl and toss with 3 tablespoons olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and thyme and toss well to coat. Transfer to a glass or ceramic baking dish and marinate at room temperature for 2 hours or in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

Cook garlic cloves whole in olive oil until soft. Add tuna (with juice) and heat through. Add chicken broth and parsley. Cook for 3 minutes then add linguine. Cook to al dente then drain. Combine pasta with sauce and sprinkle with cayenne to taste. Serve immediately.

Cut cucumber into thin slices. Cut cherry tomatoes into 4ths. Place in small bowl. Add lemon juice and apple cider vinegar. Whisk together. Add in dill and diced garlic. Pour over cucumbers and tomatoes. Stir. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Add in olive oil and flax seed oil. Stir. Taste and adjust seasoning. Serve with crackers or toast.
Place all ingredients in blender except ice cubes and blend until smooth. Serve in tall glasses or mugs. Add 2-3 ice cubes per serving if desired.

Combine all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in a mixing bowl. Add milk and egg. Stir until smooth. Fold in fresh strawberries and rhubarb. Pour mixture into 12 ungreased paper-lined muffin cups. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Makes 12 servings.

In 8 1/2 x 4 1/2 x 2 1/2-inch baking dish combine bread cubes and cheddar cheese. In medium bowl beat eggs until foamy. Add milk, dry mustard and pepperbeat well. Pour egg mixture over bread mixturestir until evenly coated. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes or until a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Let stand for 15 minutes before servingsprinkle with paprika.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x13 inch pan. Mix together stuffing mix, cheese, butter and garlic. Spoon into pan. Place chicken breast halves in pan. Season with salt and pepper. Pour mixture over the top of the breast halves. Bake in preheated oven for 45 to 60 minutes or until the stuffing is done and the breast halves are done. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Combine the marjoram and thyme. Sift together the celery seed and salt. In a bowl combine the marjoram and thyme. Drizzle the marinade over the fish fillets. Cover and refrigerate 20 minutes. Drain and discard the marinade. Drizzle the fish fillets with the Miracle Whip. Sprinkle the celery seed mixture over the fish. Broil in a preheated 450 degree F (230 degree C) broiler for 12 to 15 minutes or until done. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Slice the top of the pears so they are flat (this makes it easy for the pears to sit upright in the pan). Place the pears in a large pan or baking dish. Sprinkle the butter over the pears and the spices as well. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the pears are tender when pierced with a fork. Sprinkle with the almonds just before serving if desired.

Peel sweet potatoes and cut into wedges. Place in baking pan and toss with oil. Bake at 400 for 40 minutes. While potatoes are baking cut sausage into pieces. Saute in oil until browned. Add apples and sausage to potatoes. Add remaining ingredients and stir well. Bake at 350 for another 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375f. Place salmon fillets on a lightly greased baking pan. Top each fillet with a half of a slice of tomato. Sprinkle with sliced mushrooms. Top each fillet with 1/4 cup of Italian dressing. Place in oven and cook for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with green onions. Serve.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook shrimp 2-3 minutes until pink. Drain. Add olive oil to a large skillet. Add garlic to pan. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Add shrimp and parsley. Cook 2 minutes more. Add lemon juice. Cook 2 minutes more. Stir in green onions. Stir in salt. Add parmesan cheese. Cook until cheese has melted. Serve over cooked pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spread butter in a shallow baking dish. Peel leeks and cut into quarters lengthwise. Thinly slice crosswise. In a small bowl, combine eggs, flour, nutmeg, paprika salt and pepper. Dip leeks in mixture, drain well. Arrange leeks in a single layer in baking dish. Pour milk over leeks. Sprinkle with remaining flour mixture. Bake uncovered for 30-45 minutes or until golden brown and leeks are tender. Serve immediately.

Wash and trim ginger root. Slice 1 inch off top of each section to expose the white part. Cut ginger into 1/4 inch slices. In a small saucepan bring sugar, vinegar, and water to a boil. Pour over ginger. Let cool and store in a glass jar.

Soak the dates in 1/2 cup of water for 1/2 hour, drain well. Place the dates, brown sugar, crystallized ginger and the butter in a food processor, and blitz to a smooth paste. Mix in the bicarbonate of soda and the flour and blitz again until well combined. Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition until you have a smooth batter. Pour the batter into a greased loaf tin and bake in a moderate oven for 1 hour 10 minutes. Leave to cool in the tin for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely before wrapping. Wrap the cake in plastic wrap then cover with a double layer of foil. Store in an air tight container for up to 2 weeks. This makes a good fruit cake for the Christmas season or as a wedding cake.

Bring water to a boil. Add rice and cook 25 minutes. Add the butter and oil to a large saucepan or Dutch oven and cook over medium heat. Saute mushrooms for 4 minutes or until softened and tender. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add remaining vegetables and cook for 5 minutes or until tender, stirring often. Add the rice and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Stir in condensed chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed. Season with garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste.

Boil spinach for 5 minutes or until softened but still bright green in color. Drain in a colander and cool completely under cold water. Combine spinach, bacon and brown sugar in food processor or blender. Pulse to a coarse consistency. Add onion, jalapenos and apple cider vinegar. Process until smooth. Add salt and black pepper to taste.

Bring a pot of water to boil. Add 1 teaspoon of salt and stir to dissolve. Add brussels sprouts and cook for 10 minutes or just until tender. Drain well. Heat the oil and butter together over medium heat. Add the sprouts and season with the balsamic vinegar and pepper. Stir well and cook for 3-5 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley and serve warm.
Put seeds in food processor. Process until it is chunky. Add oil. Process until smooth. Add sugar. Process until mixed. Add sea salt. Process until blended. Store in jar in fridge.

Pop your microwave popcorn according to the package directions and place it on a plate lined with a paper towel. Slice up the nuts and put them into a large bowl. Set aside. Put the butter in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment and cream it for a minute or two. Add the vanilla and cream until smooth. Add the corn syrup and sugar and beat until all the sugar is dissolved. Add the popcorn and nuts and stir everything together well with a spatula or your hands until the nuts are coated with caramel and the mixture is evenly blended. Pour the mixture into a buttered pan and spread it out evenly with a spatula until it fills the pan. Sprinkle with the extra nuts and bake for about an hour or until the caramel is golden brown and the nuts are cooked through and toasted. Let the caramel cool a little bit before you serve it.

Combine 1 1/2 cups milk, eggs and flour in saucepan until well blended. Add 1 pound cooked ham, chopped coarsely with 4 cups shar cheese until blended well. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until knife inserted comes out clean.
Combine cranberry juice cocktail and orange juice concentrate. Add lime juice and vodka. Place in blender container. Cover and blend until smooth. Serve over ice in a glass.

Preheat oven to 375. Combine the oil, sugar, eggs, vanilla extract and cinnamon in a large mixing bowl. Stir in the beans and oats. Whisk together the baking powder, flour and salt in another bowl. Add to the sugar mixture and beat until incorporated. Spoon batter into a greased baking sheet. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Drizzle the blondies with additional oil while still warm. Sprinkle with the mini semi-sweet chocolate chips.

Heat a skillet over medium heat. Sprinkle cutlets on both sides with seasoned flour. Add olive oil to skillet. Add cutlets and brown on both sides. Transfer cutlets to a baking pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare a herb crust for the cutlets. Place apricot jam, bread crumbs, parsley, and butter in a food processor. Process until well blended. Spread herb mixture on cutlets. Add cutlets to baking pan. Pour broth into skillet. Bring to a simmer. Cook cutlets for 5 minutes. Sprinkle cutlets with corn. Bake for 30 minutes.

In a large stockpot over medium-high heat, combine chicken broth with cumin and coriander seeds, stirring to blend. Stir in pumpkin, dark brown sugar, chili powder, salt and pepper until sugar dissolvesbring to a boil. Stir in cream until incorporatedreduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in nutmeg and cilantroladle soup into bowls and serve. Top with shredded cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place tortillas on a cookie sheet and brush with oilsprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake 10 to 15 minutes or until tortillas are lightly browned on both sidescool on wire rack 15 minutes. Place 1/2 cup sour cream and 1/4 cup cream cheese in food processorprocess 30 seconds or until smooth. Add chicken and pulse 5 times to chop. Place chicken mixture on tortillastop with cheese and remaining sour cream mixture. Bake 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and mixture is hot. Top with onion and pepperserve with salsa.

Beat egg substitute in a large bowl until smooth. In a small bowl or measuring cup, mix cereal with 1 cup of milk for each cup of cereal used. Stir cereal mixture into egg substitute and whisk until smooth. Dip bread into egg mixturelet stand for 20 seconds. Dip into cereal mixturelet stand for 20 seconds. Dip into cereal mixturelet stand for 20 seconds. Turn bread over and dip into cereal mixturelet stand for 20 seconds. Turn bread over again and dip into cereal mixturelet stand for 20 seconds. Repeat process until all the bread has been dipped into the egg mixture and then the cereal mixture twice each. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Fry the bread until golden brown on both sides. Serve with butter or margarine and maple syrup (or substitute).

Open olives and remove pits. Scoop out olives. Place olives in small bowl. Mix cream cheese spread with italian dressing. Stir dressing into olives. Stir in parsley. Add olives to jars. Refrigerate for 24 hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl combine graham cracker crumbs with 2 tbsp. flour. In a large bowl combine condensed milk with butter. Add crumb mixture to milk mixture. Stir in vanilla extract. Stir in egg. Add remaining 2 tbsp. flour. Stir in raisins and coconut. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pan. Makes 25 cookies.

Marinate steaks in mixture of oil and garlic-pepper seasoning. Cook meat until done. Slice meat thinly. Assemble sandwich by placing bottom roll halves cut side down on a plate. Spread bottom halves evenly with mayonnaise. Add a layer of meat and then cheese. Layer with remaining roll halves. Serve.

Put peppers in boiling water and cook for 3 minutes. Drain and pat dry. Heat oil in a large skillet. Add the meat and cook until done. Add the peppers and cook for 3-4 minutes. Add the tabasco sauce and cook for 1 minute. Add the breadcrumbs and stir in the cheese. Stir the mixture until the cheese is melted. Pour the mixture into a greased baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden.

Heat vegetable oil in a wok or saucepan and stir-fry beans until softened. Add curry paste and stir-fry for 1 minute, then stir in shrimp and pork and cook until pork is brown and cooked through. Add chicken stock, fish sauce and palm sugar and bring to boil. Simmer until liquid has reduced by about one-third. Add lime leaves and serve with steamed rice and fresh herbs.

Slice chicken breast in half horizontally. Mix cream cheese, bacon and cheddar together. Spread filling on bottom half of breast. Roll up breast. Tie closed with butcher s twine. Sprinkle garlic salt over chicken. Grill on medium heat for about 20 minutes. Serve.
Combine frozen lemonade and limeade concentrates. Add orange extract to taste. Add water to bring to desired consistency. Add tequila to taste.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Roll the pie crusts out to about 1/8-1/4 inch thick. Use a pastry wheel to cut 2 inch rounds out of each. Lay 1 crust on a cookie sheet. Add 1 tablespoon of butter to each crust. Put 1/2 cup of broccoli in a small bowl. Add 1 teaspoon of water to the broccoli. Mix well. Add the mixture to each crust. Top with 1/2 cup of swiss cheese. In another small bowl, add 1 egg to 1 tablespoon of whipping cream. Whip until smooth. Add 1 tablespoon of dried dill weed and 1 teaspoon of red cayenne pepper to the egg mixture. Spoon the egg mixture over the broccoli. Top each with 1 tablespoon of chopped chives. Place another crust over each pie. Bake at 425 degrees for 25 minutes. Reduce heat to 375 degrees. Cook an additional 10 minutes. C

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease baking sheet. Place cream cheese and vanilla into a medium bowl and beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Add eggs and beat well. Gradually add milk to cream cheese mixture. In a small bowl, beat together sugar and cinnamon. Stir cinnamon mixture into cream cheese mixture. Spread half of cream cheese mixture onto bread. Arrange fruit on top of cream cheese layer. Cut remaining cream cheese mixture into small pieces. Press small pieces of cheese into top of fruit. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes. Let cool and serve.

Combine butter, lemon juice, parsley, garlic and pepper flakes in small bowl. Mash with fork until butter is well blended. Set aside. In small bowl, mix crushed red pepper with 1/2 teaspoon water. Set aside. Clean shrimp under running waterpat dry with paper towels. Brush shrimp with oil and season with pepper. Broil shrimp 3 to 4 inches from the heat source 4 to 6 minutes or until opaque and cooked through. Dip shrimp in the butter mixture and then in the spicy butter.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Roll out pastry to fit a 9-inch pie pan. Line crust with plastic wrap and fill with beans or pie weights. Bake crust 25 minutes until golden brown. Remove pastry and weights. Place raspberries in bottom of pie crust. In a medium-size bowl combine 2 cups sugar with the tapioca. Stir together with 1/2 cup lemon juice and cinnamon until mixture thickens slightly. Fold in sour cream and pour over raspberries. Bake for 10 minutes or until topping is set. Let pie cool to room temperature before serving.

Place the butter and golden syrup in a pan over a low heat and stir until the butter has melted and the golden syrup is dissolved. Remove from the heat and stir in the condensed milk until well mixed. Allow to cool. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 160c/gas mark 3. Grease a 20cm square tin and line with baking parchment. Roll out the pastry to fit the tin and line the base with it, allowing overhang for the pastry lid. Spoon the filling mixture into the base of the tin and cover with the pastry lid. Trim the excess pastry away from the edges with a sharp knife and press the lid down gently to seal. Mark the top of the tin with a cross of a knife and make a small slit in the top of each point. Brush the top of the pastry with the egg white and sprinkle with the slivered almonds. Bake in the oven for about 45 minutes or until the pastry is golden-brown. Remove the slice from the tin while still warm and allow it to cool completely before cutting into slices to

Mix the zucchini and onions in a large bowl. In a smaller bowl mix the eggs, mayonnaise, seasonings and bread crumbs. Add the zucchini mixture to the egg mixture and mix well. Form the zucchini mixture into small patties and coat with bread crumbs. Fry in hot oil until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine the flour and salt in a small bowl. Cream butter and sugar in a large bowl. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Stir in dry ingredients. Mix in the orange zest and juice. Bake in a 1 1/2-quart baking dish 25 to 30 minutes or until done. In a small saucepan combine orange juice and water. Mix in the cocoa powder. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Serve the pudding hot topped with the sauce.

Cream butter, granulated sugar, milk, cocoa powder, and quick-cooking rolled oats together well with an electric mixer at high speed until fluffy. Stir in the coconut, walnuts, salt, and vanilla until combined. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 f for about 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racksremove from pans by lifting edges of cookies with a spoon.

Preheat the oven to 180 C and lightly grease the baking tray. Sift together the flours, bicarbonate of soda and spices. Cream the butter and the sugars together until light and fluffy. Add the eggs and beat until well combined. Beat in the flour mixture until it is just combined. Spoon the mixture onto the tray and bake for around 20 mins. Check that the gingerbread is cooked with a skewer. Cool completely before decorating.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large bowl, toss corn with 2 tbsp salt and 1/2 tsp pepper. Spread corn on a rimmed baking sheet in an even layer. Bake corn until golden brown and tender, 20-25 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until tender, 3-5 minutes. In a medium bowl, combine corn with 1/3 cup milk, 1/4 cup cheese, onions, garlic and 1 tbsp salt and 1/2 tsp pepper. Transfer mixture to a greased 9-inch square baking dish. In a medium bowl, whisk together remaining 1 1/2 cups milk and egg. Pour milk mixture over corn mixture and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Bake until set and golden brown, 35-40 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Put the vegetables in a large saucepan. Cover with water by about 1 inch (2cm). Bring to the boil and cook over moderate heat until tender but firm (the carrot will be firmest), about 10 minutes for cauliflower florets20 minutes for carrots15 minutes for red onion15 minutes for mushrooms. Drain the vegetables in a colanderpat them dry with paper towels. Place them in a large serving bowl. Stir together the margarine, lemon juice, basil, marjoram, salt, and black pepper until the margarine is meltedpour the mixture over the vegetables. Serve at once, or refrigerate for up to 3 days. Makes 4 servings.

Melt 2/3 cup of butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add brown sugar, honey, and gingerrootcook for 5 minutes or until thickened. Stir in creamcook for 5 minutes or until thickened further. Transfer to a bowl, stir in egg yolksset aside until cool. Whisk together milk & creamchill overnight or until cold. Whisk yolk mixture into cream mixturefreeze according to manufacturer’s instructions. Transfer to a plastic freezer containerfreeze until firm.

Combine milk, sugar and honey in saucepan and heat to boiling over medium heat. Add ginger, cloves and red pepper and boil 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add cocoa and vanilla. Stir until dissolved. Pour into 2 cups. Top each cup with 1 Tbsp. Whipped cream.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a skillet cook the mushrooms in the butter until tenderstir in the soup and parsley and heat through. In a casserole dish layer half of the spaghetti and sprinkle with half of the mushroom mixture. Repeat with the remaining spaghetti and mushrooms and soup mixture. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and dot with butter. Cover the dish with foil and bake for 1 hour. Sprinkle with sour cream and parsley and serve.

Melt vegetable oil over medium heat. Add parmesan cheese and garlic powder and stir until cheese is melted and smooth. Remove from heat and add crispix cereal and spaghetti sauce mix. Stir until well combined. Spoon onto wax paper and cool completely before eating. Makes about 6 cups of snack mix.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Season pork with salt and pepper to taste. Cook pork 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until done. Remove pork to a plate and keep warm. Drain grease from skillet. Add 1/4 cup oil to skillet over medium heat. Add onion soup mix and brown for about 1 minute. Add water to cover vegetables by about 1/2 inch. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cook until vegetables are tender. Drain off any excess liquid from vegetables. Stir rice into vegetables. Add broth to rice and stir to moisten completely. Stir in onion soup mix mixture with reserved pork. Pour into a 3-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown on top. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Sautee butter and oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and saute for 2 minutes. Add garlic and saute for 30 seconds. Stir in chives and salt and pepper to taste. Mushrooms should be tender. Serve immediately.
Blend all ingredient together with a blender. Serve.

Heat the butter or oil in a pan and gently fry the onion and the garlic in it until soft. Add the curry powder and the green cardamom seeds and fry until they begin to turn golden. Add the passata and the turmeric powder and fry until everything is well mixed. Add the water and simmer until the gravy is thick and creamy. Season with salt.

In a large pot saute butter, shallot and paprika. Add tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat about 10 minutes or until thick. Add chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cook about 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Drain. Mash potatoes. Stir in sour cream. Serve.

Place 4-5 flour tortillas on a foil-lined cookie sheet (or you can use a large glass casserole dish) brush tortillas with refried beans and onion. Pour about a cup of enchilada sauce over each tortilla. Roll up tortillas like burritos and place seam side down on cookie sheet. Cover with aluminum foil or plastic wrap and bake at 350 degrees for 30-40 minutes or until tender. Serve with extra enchilada sauce.

Blanch broccoli in a pot of boiling salted water for 1 minute. Drain and set aside. In a wok or large frying pan over medium high heat, add 2 tablespoons of oil and stir fry garlic for 15 seconds. Add the broccoli and stir fry for 2 minutes. Add dark soy sauce and stir fry for 30 seconds. Drizzle 1 tablespoon of oil and add red chilli pepper and stir fry for 1 minute. Turn off the heat and serve immediately.

Place chicken breasts on bottom of 9 x 13 pan. Sprinkle with garlic salt and paprika. Pour cream of chicken soup over chicken. Place sliced mushrooms around chicken. Bake at 350 for 45 to 55 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve chicken over mashed potatoes.
Beat the cream to soft peaks and set aside. Beat the cream cheese to a creamy consistency and fold into the cream. Add the lemon juice and lemon zest and fold to combine. Serve immediately.

Place scallops in a large shallow baking dish. Sprinkle scallops with salt and pepper. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add scallions and garlic cloves. Cook and stir until tender. Pour in wine and simmer for 2 minutes. Add scallops and cook until opaque and flaky. Turn and cook for a few minutes longer. Stir in parsley and cream and simmer for a few minutes. Serve over cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare the cake mix as directed on the package for 9 x 13 pan. Mix the vanilla extract, neufchatel cheese, egg, butter together in a separate bowl until well mixed. Pour half of the cake batter into the pan. Spoon half of the cheese mixture over the cake batter. Pour the remaining cake batter over the cheese mixture. Spoon the remaining cheese mixture over the cake batter. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Let the cookies rest for 10 minutes before removing from the pan to the wire rack to cool completely.

Rinse and dry tomatoes. Slice tomatoes into 1/4 inch thick discs. Heat butter in a skillet. Place tomato discs in skillet. Sprinkle tomatoes with breadcrumbs. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and dried herbs. Cook for 5 minutes on each side until the breadcrumbs are golden brown. Serve with a side of tomato sauce.

To prepare the banana split salad, mix the sour cream, flaked coconut & maraschino cherries together. Fill the lettuce leafs with the mixture. Place the pineapple & mandarin oranges on top of the lettuce. Place the banana on top of the mandarin oranges. Sprinkle the mini marshmallows over the salad.

Brown meat in hot oil. Add soy sauce, pepper, ginger. Cook for 1 minute. Add chicken broth. Simmer for 10 minutes or until meat is tender. Add cabbage. Cook for 5 minutes. Add noodles. Cook until noodles are tender. Serve hot.

Cook the onion and garlic in the oil for a few minutes until soft. Add the spinach and cook for a couple of minutes until soft. Drain away any excess water and add the creme fraiche and feta. Season the dip with salt and pepper and serve warm. You can use the dip as a dip for bread or use as a side dish.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Rinse chickens and pat dry. Place onion halves in each chicken cavity. Place seasoned crumbs in a shallow dish. Dip each chicken in melted butter. Roll in seasoned crumbs. Place chickens in a roasting pan. Bake for 1 1/2 hours. Remove from oven. Place chicken on a platter. Garnish with parsley sprigs. Serve with rice.
In large bowl combine pasta, cheese and olives. Pour dressing over salad. Add ham. Stir well. Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours. Before serving, stir well. Top with more cheese.

Slice white bread in half lengthwise with crust on. Brush one side of each slice with margarine or butter. Sprinkle with onion salt and garlic salt. Broil until lightly golden brown on the buttered side for about 1 minute. Sprinkle with corn flakes and parmesan cheese. Broil until corn flakes are crisp and parmesan is melted. Cut each slice diagonally to make strips.

Beat eggs with a hand mixer for 1 minute. Add maple syrup and mix until combined. Slowly add the milk while constantly beating. In a separate bowl mix together the flour and salt. Gradually add the flour mixture to the eggs while still beating. Add the nutmeg. Pour into a 3 quart baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve warm. Serves 6.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook ground beef, green pepper, and mushrooms until meat is no longer pinkdrain. Stir in ketchup, relish, prepared mustard and salt. Add meat mixture and cheese. Spoon into hot dog buns.

Saute garlic and green onions in oil until onions are softened. Stir in pork and cook until meat is no longer pink. Add hoisin sauce and soy sauce. Mix well. Fold in wonton wrappers and stir until evenly coated. Place on waxed paper to form into patties. In nonstick pan heat oil over medium high heat. Brown patties on both sides. Serve with steamed rice and green onions.

Slice chicken breast halves into strips about 1/2-inch thick and 1/2-inch wide. Mix soy sauce, vinegar and sugar together and coat chicken pieces with mixtureset aside and marinate for at least 20 minutes (can marinate for up to 2 hours). Heat oil in a deep frying pan and fry chicken for about 10 minutes or until it turns golden and it reaches an internal temperature of 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Set aside and keep warm. Meanwhile, blend together cheese and green chilies and set aside. To assemble sandwiches, spread cheese mixture on bottom half of each kaiser roll and place chicken on top. Roll sandwiches up and serve with chips and salsa.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan. Add the garlic and cook until light brown. Add the flour stirring constantly for 3 minutes. Gradually add the milk whisking constantly until thickened. Stir in the chicken. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add the parsley flakes. Season with salt and pepper. Add the parmesan cheese. Cook until melted. Cook the penne according to package directions. Drain and toss with the sauce.

Saute onion and garlic in a large skillet until tender. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Drain bacon and reserve drippings in skillet. Add reserved bacon drippings and cayenne pepper to bacon and stir to coat. Transfer to a baking dish. Place oysters in skillet. Cover and cook on medium-high heat until liquid is reduced and oysters are just cooked through. Place a single oyster on each piece of bread. Sprinkle each with cheese and place under broiler until melted and bread is golden brown. Serve. Serves 4.

Melt butter in a saucepan. Add onions and flour and cook over moderate heat until mixture is golden brown. Stir in broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer. Add mace. Whisk in egg yolks and whisk until blended. Add salt and pepper to taste and stir in parsley. Serve immediately.

Melt 8 tablespoons of the butter over medium heat in a large skillet. Add the orange rind and orange liqueur. Cook until the liqueur has been reduced to half its volume, 8 to 10 minutes. Add the pecans, stirring constantly so that they don't burn. Continue to cook for about 5 minutes more until the liqueur is almost completely evaporated. Add 1/2 teaspoon of the salt to the skillet and stir until dissolved. Stir in the remaining 8 tablespoons of the butter. Stir in the pecans until the pecans are coated with the liqueur mixture. Set aside to cool before serving with cheese and crackers.

Mix together all the marinade ingredients. Pour half the marinade over the pork and mix well. Let stand for 2 to 4 hours. Preheat the grill to medium high heat. Brush the pork lightly with the remaining marinade. Grill the pork for 10 to 12 minutes per side or until done. Serve hot.

Melt margarine in skillet over medium heat. Add tomatoes and peppers. Cook and stir 5 minutes. Add olives and cook and stir 1 minute longer. Place 1 slice of bread on bottom half of a 9x13 inch pan. Add half the tomato mixture. Top with Swiss cheese. Place remaining bread slice on top. Cover and cook 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and mixture is hot. Slice and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel and dice carrots. Cook until soft. Drain. In a large skillet saute onions until tender and lightly golden. Add carrots and flour and cook 1 minute longer. Stir in milk and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in dry mustard and fresh ground pepper. Cover with breadcrumbs and grated swiss cheese. Bake until lightly browned and cheese is bubbly. Serve hot.

Rub chicken liberally with salt, pepper and garlic powder. In a separate bowl mix all other seasonings together to make a dipping sauce. Grill chicken until cooked through, basting with sauce every few minutes. Place chicken on a baking sheet to rest for 5 minutes before carving. Serve warm with extra sauce on the side.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a large bowl, mix beef and pork sausage together. Add the breadcrumbs. Stir in the eggs, basil, oregano, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper. Using your hands, form meatballs. Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 400f for 20 minutes or till meatballs are browned.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Clean pheasant and dry with paper towels. Mix 2 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp ground black pepper with 1/4 tsp garlic powder. Mix thyme and tarragon with honey. Stuff cavity of pheasant with herbs and seasonings. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Dip pheasant in egg whites. Dip pheasant in flour and shake to remove excess. Dip pheasant in egg whites again. Place pheasant in hot oil. Cook until golden brown. Transfer pheasant to a large roasting pan and bake until cooked through, 15 to 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Heat the butter and olive oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add the edamame and corn and cook until heated through and tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in the red onion and cook until tender, about 2 minutes more. Add the sherry and stir until absorbed. Season with salt and pepper, and toss with the basil leaves. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Mix plums and water in a large saucepan over medium-high heatcook 15 minutes or until plums are tender. Drain plumsdiscard liquid. Return plums to panadd sugar and gingercook 10 minutes or until plums are tender and mixture is thick and spreadable. Stir in lemon juice and lemon rindcook 5 minutes or until lemon rind is tender and mixture thickens more. Transfer to a jarcool completely. Makes 2 cups.

Place butter in a 2-qt. Pyrex bowl or a 9x13-inch baking pan. Cook over low heat until melted. Stir in peanut butter chips and peanuts. Stir in sweetened condensed milk. Stir in marshmallows and pour into pan. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares.

Mix egg white and 2 tsp. seasoning salt together. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Roll nuts in mixture and spread on baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Turn and bake for another 5-10 minutes or until nuts are crisp. Let cool. Store in airtight container.

Chicken is cut into pieces and placed in water. Cook for about 20 minutes. Then add carrots and cook for another 20 minutes. Add milk and sour cream and bring to boil. Cook for another 20 minutes. Add water if necessary. Serve and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease a 9 by 13-inch baking dish with cooking spray or shortening. Beat eggs until well blended with 1/2 cup of milk. Stir together flour, baking powder and brown sugar in a bowlgradually stir into egg mixture. Stir in coconut flakes, cherries and remaining milk until well blended. Pour into greased baking dish. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack. Cut into squares. Makes 36 squares.
Stuff poblano peppers with cheese mixture. Pour enchilada sauce on baking dish. Bake at 425 for 12 minutes or until heated through and cheese melts.

Melt 2 tbsp. of the unsalted butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Add 1 tbsp. of the dry white wine. Add 1 tbsp. of the remaining unsalted butter to mushrooms. Stir in 2 tbsp. of the heavy cream. Season with salt & pepper. Cook over medium heat for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Set aside. Preheat oven to 375 F. Season salmon fillet with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Place fillet skin side up in a 10-inch saute pan. Drizzle remaining 2 tbsp. of dry white wine over salmon. Cover with a piece of parchment paper. Poach salmon for 10 minutes. Place salmon in a 10-inch saute pan. Pour mushroom mixture over salmon. Season with salt & pepper. Place salmon in 400 degree F. oven for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Top salmon with tarragon leaves.

Peel and dice potatoes and onionsplace in slow cooker. In large saucepan melt margarine over medium heatadd soupstirring constantlycook for 1 minute stirring constantly. Pour soup mixture into slow cookeradd potatoesstirring until well blendedadd cheesestirring until cheese is meltedadd pimientostirring wellserve hot.

Cream butter and sugar. Beat in eggs one at a time. Stir in flour and baking powder. Stir in almonds. Bake in a greased and floured 10 x 15 pan at 350 f until golden brown. Frost with a mixture of strawberry preserves and heavy cream.

Bake potatoes in a 350f oven until tender. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Cut potato into small slices and lay out flat on ungreased cookie sheet. Sauté onion and green pepper until softened. Stir in onion soup mix and add mixture to potatoes. Drizzle with margarine and bake at 350f for an additional 15 minutes or until lightly brown on top and potatoes are heated through. Serve with salad or rolls and butter.
Cook the onion in butter until tender. Blend in the pimiento. Add the eggs when the onion is done. Add the mayonnaise and peas. Stir well. Season with salt & pepper. Chill well before serving.

Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 1/2 cup each of the soup and milk. Cook and stir until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes or until thickened. Add remaining butter and remaining soup. Cook and stir 5 minutes longer. Stir in remaining soup and milk. Heat through. Stir in remaining soup and milk. Cook and stir 5 minutes longer. Add remaining soup and milk. Cook and stir 5 minutes longer. Stir in remaining soup and milk. Cook and stir 5 minutes longer. Stir in remaining soup and milk. Cook and stir 5 minutes longer. Stir in cream cheese and sherry. Cook and stir until cheese melts and mixture is smooth. Stir in crabmeat. Cook and stir 5 minutes longer. Stir in half-and-half. Cook and stir 5 minutes longer. Serve with remaining cream and remaining butter. Makes 8 servings.

Wash pomegranate with warm water. Remove outer skin of pomegranate by gently pulling it apart with fingers. Scrape pomegranate out of skin with a spoon. Add pomegranate to a bowl with orange juice, sugar and lemon juice. Mix thoroughly, add mint leaf to taste. Serve with strawberry slices on side.
Stir whiskey and lime juice over ice. Garnish with a lime wedge.

In a saucepan, boil the mint leaves with the vinegar for 15 minutes. Strain the liquid through a fine mesh strainer, discarding the mint leaves. In a saucepan, melt the sugar in the vinegar until it is dissolved completely. Pour the vinegar/sugar mixture over the mint leaves and rosemary. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes.

In a medium saucepan on medium heat, melt butter, add mild green chilies, onion powder, salt and pepper to tastecook for about 2 minutes until onions are softened. Remove from heat. Add eggs and stir until combined, then add cheese until melted. Spoon into greased 2 quart baking dishtop with hamburgers. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes or until set.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease an 8 by 12 by 2-inch baking pan. In medium bowl, stir together flour and salt. In another medium bowl, beat together butter and granulated sugar until light. Add the eggs one at a time until well incorporated. Stir in orange extract and zest. Add flour mixture and stir until blended. Spread batter into pan. Bake for about 35 minutes or until golden brown. Cool. In medium bowl beat together the cream cheese and powdered sugar until light. Stir in the orange juice until blended. Spread over brownies. Refrigerate for about 2 hours before serving. Sift powdered sugar over top.

Boil a whole tomato (or cut into halves) in water until soft (about an hour). Blend to a puree with a little water (to help blend). In a separate pan cook an onion until soft, then add to tomato puree with a little sugar and salt and pepper to taste. In a large bowl mix self raising flour with olive oil until smooth. Add tomato puree to flour mix and stir with a wooden spoon until smooth. Shape into patties with a tablespoon or so of flour to keep them from sticking together, then fry in a little olive oil until golden brown on both sides. Serve with a sprig of fresh mint.

In a large skillet, saute the shrimp in the olive oil over medium heat for about 5 to 7 minutes. Add the rosemary and thyme and cook until the shrimp are just pink. Add the red pepper flakes and black pepper. Simmer for one more minute. Serve over rice.

Add the carrots to a saucepan filled with water. Cook until just tender. Drain. Melt butter in a saucepan. Add the carrots and toss with the butter. Add brown sugar and bourbon. Stir until blended. Sprinkle with salt. Serve immediately.

Cut prosciutto slices in half crosswise. Lay cheese slice on cutting board. Top with prosciutto. Drizzle mozzarella slice with 1/2 teaspoon of olive oil. Season with black pepper. Fold cheese slice lengthwise in half. Roll up cheese slice tightly around prosciutto slice. Place each cheese-wrapped prosciutto on toothpick. Bring pan of simmering water to boil. Carefully dip cheese-wrapped prosciutto into boiling water until prosciutto is softened. Transfer to plate to cool. Serve with mixed salad green, balsamic vinegar and cranberry sauce.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Clean cauliflower, trimming off the rough leaves. Break cauliflower into florets and place in a glass baking dish. Combine margarine with italian seasoned breadcrumbs. Sprinkle over cauliflower. Drizzle with garlic powder and dried basil. Sprinkle with oregano. Bake for 30 minutes or until cauliflower is tender. Makes 4 servings.

Wash radishes, yellow bell peppers and carrots. Grate carrots into a medium bowl. Add radishes and yellow bell peppers. Combine oil, vinegar, sugar and dill in a small bowl. Whisk in the mustard oil. Pour dressing over carrots. Toss to coat. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Taste for seasoning. Top with a little more dill if desired.

In a large saute pan over medium heat, saute onion and carrot in oil until tender. Stir in sausage and Italian seasoning. Cook until sausage is no longer pink. Add broth. Bring to a simmer. Add kale. Cook until tender. Add cooked pasta. Add Parmesan Cheese and stir until melted. Serve with additional Parmesan Cheese on top.

Add pine nuts to large pan over a moderate heat until golden brown. Remove pine nuts from pan and set aside to cool. Heat oil in a large saucepan over a moderate heat for 1 minute. Add cumin seeds to oil, stirring constantly for 1 minute or until seeds just start to color. Pour in 2 tsp stock. Mix in couscous. Bring to boil for 3 minutes over a moderate heat stirring occasionally. Pour in stock until it just covers couscous. Return to boil for 1 minute then remove from heat. Remove from heat to cool for 5 minutes. Transfer couscous to a large bowl. Stir in onion and cooked chicken. Mix in apricots, sultanas, mint and remaining 1 cup stock. Serve in warmed bowls. Stir through couscous with French dressing to taste.
Rub water over fillets. Sprinkle lemon juice over fillets. Coat with mushroom. Dip in dressing. Place fillets in foil packet. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.

Peel honeydew melons and dice into small pieces. Place in blender with lime juice and blend until smooth. Pour into pitcher and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Top with whipped yogurt and honeydew balls. Enjoy!

Heat 1 tbsp of peanut oil in a wok over high heat. Cook prawns for 2 minutes or until cooked through. Set aside. Cook noodles according to packet directions. Drain. Toss noodles in a large bowl with the remaining 1 tbsp of peanut oil. Add broccoli florets and cook for 2 minutes. Add red capsicum and red spanish onion and cook for 2 minutes. Add prawns and cook for 2 minutes. Add teriyaki marinade and toss to combine. Divide between serving bowls. Sprinkle over sesame seeds. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Heat margarine and shallots in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute for 5 minutes. Add green beans and cook for an additional 5 minutes. In a large bowl whisk together chicken broth and cornstarch. Add to green beans and simmer for 3 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour green bean mixture into a greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with Parmesan and bake for 20 minutes. Serve with a salad and your favorite hot bread.

Mix cornmeal and salt and pepper to taste and pour over fillets. Add enough buttermilk to cover. Mix the flour and cornmeal until well mixed and coat the fillets. Fry the fillets until crispy and golden brown, about 4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

1. Prepare whipped topping according to package directions. 2. Combine sour cream and sugar in a large mixing bowl and blend well. Add strawberries and fold in. 3. Transfer to serving dish and refrigerate several hours or overnight to blend flavors. 4. Just before serving, spoon whipped topping over the strawberry mixture. 5. Garnish with additional strawberries and mint leaves if desired.

Combine rice and water and bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cook until tender, about 20 minutes. Stir in mushrooms and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in onion and cook for 1 minute. Stir in butter and cream cheese. Cover and simmer until mixture thickens. Beat eggs and stir into rice mixture. Mix evaporated milk and salt together. Stir into rice mixture. Pour into buttered baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350f for 30 minutes. Serve hot.

In a small saucepan, melt the brown sugar blend with the cocoa and whisk with a fork to make sure it doesn t form clumps. Heat over medium heat to boiling. Reduce heat to low and simmer 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and steep the chili powder for about 10 minutes. Pour mixture into a glass measuring cup or jar for storage. Pour into a pitcher and add milk and vanilla. Heat on high heat to bring mixture to a boil. Once it s boiling add the whipping cream and heat to a rolling boil. Remove from heat and pour into glasses to serve.

Cook the spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente according to the instructions on the packet. Drain well. Meanwhile, cook the bacon until crisp, about 10 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Cut bacon into lardons. In a frying pan heat the olive oil over a medium heat, add the bacon, stirring occasionally for about 5 minutes until the bacon is crisp. Add the zucchini slices to the pan with the bacon, sautéing until they are tender (about 10 minutes). Add the cherry tomatoes to the pan, stirring until heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste, stirring well. Pour the spaghetti with pesto sauce on to the serving plates, arrange the bacon over the top. Finish by sprinkling the cheese over the top. Serve immediately.

Prepare an eight-inch skillet by heating oil over medium-low heat and lightly greasing with cooking spray. Add onion and green peppercook until tender, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes. Add red peppercook until tender, stirring occasionally, about 4 minutes more. Stir in baconcook until bacon is crisp, stirring occasionally, about 2 minutes more. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl whisk together the eggs with milk, salt, black pepper and hot sauceset aside. Add the cheeses and stir until melted. Stir in the vegetables. Heat the skillet over medium-low heat until hotadd the egg mixture and stir until set. Serve with toast and hash browns.
Place all ingredients in a food processor and pulse until smooth and free of any large chunks. Taste and season with more red pepper sauce if needed. Serve with toasted pita points or crackers.

Place coffee beans in a coffee filter in an empty jar with a tight fitting lid. Add crushed red pepper flakes, whole cloves and cinnamon sticks. Pour in enough water to cover the beans. Add coconut milk. Close jar and shake. Let sit for at least an hour before brewing. Brew coffee as you normally would. Pour coffee into your favorite mug and enjoy.

Bring chicken broth to a boil. Add potatoes to boiling broth and boil 3 minutes. Drain potatoes and add to pot with olive oil. Stir to coat potatoes. Cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan and reserve 2 tbsp drippings from pan. Add bacon to potatoes in pan over medium heat. Cook until potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally. Whisk whole grain mustard into vinegar. Add vinegar mixture to potatoes and stir until coated evenly. Cook on low heat until thickened. Adjust salt and pepper to taste. Stir in chopped parsley, green onions and reserved bacon drippings. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray an 8 by 8 by 2-inch pan with vegetable cooking spray. Cream together butter and sugars. Add eggs and vanilla and beat well. Sift together flour and baking powder. Add to butter mixture and stir well. Press into prepared pan. Bake 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from oven and cool. Cut into 2-inch squares. Melt semi-sweet chocolate chips in microwave in 30 second intervals. Dip squares of brownies into the melted chocolate. Place on wax paper and let dry. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer.

Heat oil and add onion and cook until transparent. Stir in cumin and curry powder and cook for 2 minutes more. Stir in broth and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook until liquid is almost absorbed, about 10 minutes. Stir in peas and raisins and cook for 2 more minutes. Stir in couscous and cook uncovered for 12 minutes more, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and let sit for 5 minutes before serving.

Toast 1 side of each slice of bread in a panini press or skillet until golden brown and just beginning to brown the other side. Add a generous amount of olive salad to each side of each slice of bread. Add a slice of provolone cheese to each slice of bread on the uncooked side of the press or skillet. Add the sliced meats to the cheese and add another slice of provolone to each slice of toast. Place the toast in the press or skillet and toast until cheese is melted and the sandwich is hot and ready to serve. Serve hot and enjoy! Makes 4 servings.

Place almonds in a large bowl. Combine sugar, water and honey in a saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil. Boil for two minutes. Pour mixture over almonds. Stir to coat. Spread almonds on waxed paper. Let cool. Store in an airtight container.

To make amaretti cookie, preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper or cooking spray. In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour with amaretto and stir until smooth. In a separate mixing bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gradually add sugar while beating until soft peaks form. Gently fold egg whites into amaretto mixture until combined. Gently fold in almonds, making sure not to over-mix. Place heaping teaspoonful of cookie dough onto cookie sheet, leaving space between each cookie so that they can spread while cooking. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. While amaretti are baking, prepare rice pudding by placing short-grain rice in a pot with water and bringing water and rice to boil over high heat. Cover pot with lid or foil and cook for 20 minutes until rice is tender but still firmdo not overcook as rice will become mushy. Remove from heat, drain any excess water, then transfer

In a pan, brown the meat with onion. Drain off the excess fat. Add water to the pan. Cook until the meat is no longer pink. Add the pasta sauce. Cook until the pasta is done. Add pasta. Add the mushrooms. Stir to coat with the pasta sauce. Cover. Cook on low for about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve.
Prepare all veggies and place in pan. Add steak to pan and cook until done. Add water and all seasonings. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes. Serve over rice.

In a large saucepan, bring chicken broth to boilingreduce heat to simmer. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute bacon until crisp. Remove baconset aside. Add onion to fat in skilletsaute until tender. Add celerycook until tender. Stir in ricecook 1 minute. Stir in chervilcook 1 minute longer. Add broth mixturesimmer until rice is tender but firm. Add bacon and parsleystir gently to combine.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place almonds in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Combine the sugar, cinnamon, vanilla, salt and egg white in a bowl. Pour over the almondsmix to coat. Bake until the almonds are tender and the sugar is golden brown. Cool on racks until crisp (1 to 2 hours).

Cut off top of each bell pepper. Clean out and discard seeds and white membranes. Place peppers cut side down on ovenproof dish or sheet pan and fill with water. Bake at 400f for about 1 hour until the peppers are soft and tender and the water has evaporated. Place peppers on a cutting board and scoop out the soft insides with a spoon and discard. Place insides back into the skins and set aside. Heat oil and garlic together in a pan over low heat. Add peppers with oil mixture and cook about 5 minutes until hot but not browned. Add salt and pepper to taste and toss with the garlic and oil. Remove from the pan and serve warm.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and return to pot. While pasta is cooking, melt butter in a large skillet. Add garlic powder and stir fry for 30 seconds. Add cream cheese and stir fry until cheese is melted and mixture is smooth. Add milk and parmesan cheese and stir until cheese melts and mixture is smooth. Stir in black pepper to taste and parsley flakes. Add pasta and toss to coat evenly with Alfredo sauce. Serve and enjoy!

Remove kernels from ears of corn. Cut 3-4 inches off the bottom of corn cobs and place them cut side up in a shallow pan. Place pan in the freezer until kernels are frozen solid. Place frozen ears in a ziplock bag with a tablespoon of water and squeeze bag to remove as much air as possible. Place bag in the freezer for 4-5 hours or until kernels are completely frozen. Thaw ears in the freezer. Transfer corn to a blender with 2 cups water and puree until smooth. Add salt to taste and remove from heat. Top with feta cheese and serve.

Heat a little oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the refried beans, jalapenos, chili and cheddar cheese. Stir until heated through. Spoon onto tortilla chips. Top with the monterey jack cheese, sour cream, green onions and tomatoes. Serve hot with more sour cream if desired.

Preheat the oven to 350 deg f. Sprinkle the pork loin with 1/4 of the cracked black pepper. Place the pork in an oven-proof skillet with the mushrooms and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add the onion and cook for 2 more minutes. Add the red wine and stir to scrape up the brown bits. Bring the wine to a boil. Turn the heat to low and add the parsley. Season with salt and add the remaining 1/4 of the black pepper. Transfer the mixture to the oven and cook for 20-25 minutes until the pork is cooked through. Let cool and serve with sauerkraut.

Trim the okra of any tough parts of the stalk, and cut the okra into pieces 3 to 4 inches long. Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat until shimmering. Add onion, garlic and gingercook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 6 minutes. Add chili and cumincook 1 minute more. Add okracook, stirring occasionally, until heated through, about 5 minutes. Add lemon juice, water and saltbring to a boil over high heat, stirring to dissolve the saltreduce to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, until okra is tender, about 5 minutes more. Transfer to a serving dishsprinkle with coriander before serving.

Prepare graham cracker pie crust as directed on box for two crusts. In a large bowl, beat together sweetened condensed milk and egg yolks until thick and lemon colored. Add key lime juice and beat well until combined and thickened (about 1 minute). Pour filling into prepared graham cracker crusts and refrigerate for at least four hours or overnight for best results. Top each pie with a dollop of whipped cream and garnish with lime wedges as desired. Store covered in refrigerator and serve chilled or frozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease 2 9x2 inch round cake pans. In medium bowl, combine flour, baking soda and salt. In large bowl, cream together butter and sugar. Add eggs one at a time. Add in flour mixture. Stir in rhubarb, brown sugar and oats. Spread batter evenly between prepared cake pans. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until cake tester comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pan. Transfer cakes to wire rack to cool.

Beat the egg yolks with the vanilla extract. Beat the butter with the sugar. Beat together the egg yolks and sugar. Mix the dry ingredients together. Add the dry to the wet and mix well. Fold in the eggnog. Roll into one-inch balls. Place them 2 inches apart onto a baking sheet. Flatten each ball with the back of a spoon. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before removing to wire rack.

Bring 2 quarts of water and 1 tsp of salt to a boil in a large pot. Add macaroni and cook until tender, about 8 minutes. Rinse under cold water and drain. In a large skillet over medium heat melt 2 Tbsp of butter and saute celery and onions for 2 minutes. Stir in the flour and cook 1 minute. Gradually stir in the milk and evaporated milk and bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly. Cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Stir in the macaroni, cayenne pepper and 1 1/2 cups of cheddar and montery jack cheeses until well combined. Stir in the velveeta cheese and season with salt and pepper. Pour into a greased 2 quart casserole dish and sprinkle remaining 1/2 cup of cheddar and montery jack cheeses over the top of the dish. Bake in a 350 oven for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serves 8
Clean chickens and marinate for at least eight hours or until ready to grill. Grill chickens over coals for approximately three minutes on each side or until cooked through. Serve hot off grill.

Preheat oven to 350f. Slice sausage into thin slices. Add sausage and beef to a large pot and cook over medium heat until browned. Add onion and celery and saute for 10 minutes. Stir in garlic. Add green and yellow bell peppers and saute for 5 minutes. Add rice and stir to coat with oil. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook until water is absorbed. Add more water as necessary. When all the water has been absorbed stir in the sausage mixture. Add salt, pepper and cayenne to taste. Transfer to a 2.5 quart baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan with butter. In a medium bowl combine flour, sugar, cardamom and baking powder. In a separate large bowl beat butter and sugar until fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time. Add the flour mixture and mix well. Pour batter into the greased pan. Bake for 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and allow to cool in pan for 15 minutes. In a bowl combine the oats and 1 cup of butter. In a small bowl combine the preserves and vanilla extract. Pour the oats and butter over the cake in the pan. Spread the preserves mixture evenly over the top of the cake. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/3 cup butter. Bake for 10 minutes or until the topping is golden. Allow cake to cool in the pan before slicing and serving.

Rinse pickles under cold water. Drain and pat dry. Place pickles in a bowl and cover with sugar. Stir in Tabasco sauce. Cover bowl with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 24 hours. Serve on crackers or with sausage or ham.

Peel potatoes & boil for about 10 minutes or until fork tender. Drain well & mash potatoes. Add heavy cream, butter & salt to potatoes & mix well. Add flour slowly & mix well. Add more flour as needed to make dough come together & be easy to work with on table top. Knead dough 5-10 minutes. Wrap in plastic & let dough rest for 1-2 hours. Roll out dough to about 1/8 inch thickness on floured surface. Cut dough into 1/4 inch strips & roll dough into 9 inch circles. Cook lefse on both sides in a cast iron pan (or similar) over medium heat (350-400 degrees). Cook 3-4 minutes on each side. Fold in half & cook on each side for 2 minutes or so or until lefse is golden brown.

In medium bowl, combine pumpkin and milkblend well. In small bowl, combine sugar, spices and salt. Blend wellset aside. In medium bowl, beat egg lightlybeat egg whites until stiffset aside. Pour pumpkin mixture into mugs or 8-inch square glass dish. Sprinkle spice mixture over pumpkin mixture. Whisk egg yolk slightlyadd egg yolk and egg whites to spiced pumpkin mixture in mugs or dishstir until blended. Cover mugs or dish tightly with plastic wrappierce plastic wrap several times with fork. Place mugs or dish in microwave ovencook on high (100 percent) power for 2 minutes. Remove from microwave ovenlet stand for 1 minute. Carefully remove plastic wrapstir mixture gentlylet stand for additional 5 minutes before serving. Yield: 4 servings.

Prepare a baking dish with cooking spray. Sprinkle flour into a bowl. In a separate bowl, mix soup and sour cream. Stir with a wire whisk to mix well and smooth. Add flour mixture to soup mixture and stir just to blend and be careful not to over-blend the mixture. Add chicken pieces to the mixture and stir to coat lightly. Pour chicken mixture into prepared dish. Bake, uncovered, at 350 f for 50-60 minutes or until juices run clear when chicken is pierced with a fork. In a small bowl, combine the liquid gravy browner with 2 tbsp of water and stir to dissolve. Pour over chicken during last 20 minutes of baking time. Sprinkle with green onions and season with salt and paprika. Serve with cooked rice or potatoes.

Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add zucchini, onion and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes. Add diced tomatoes, roasted red pepper and pepper flakes. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add cod. Cook for 5 minutes. Add fresh parsley. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Whisk together eggs, sugar and cocoa powder until well combined. In a separate bowl, whisk together cream and milk. Add to the egg mixture and mix together. In another bowl, toss together graham crackers and marshmallows. Fill a 9x13 pan with the graham cracker mixture. Pour ice cream mixture over top. Cover with plastic wrap and freeze for 1-2 hours. When ice cream is frozen, remove from freezer and top with marshmallows and a hershey bar. Return to the freezer for 5 minutes. Remove and top with remaining marshmallows and a hershey bar. Return to the freezer for an additional 15 minutes. Remove and enjoy!

Bring water to boil in a medium saucepan. Add butter. Add oysters. Cover pan, reduce heat to simmer for about 5 minutes. Uncover. Stir in Worcestershire Sauce. Cook uncovered for 1 minute. Stir in Russet Potato. Cover pan. Cook for another 5 minutes. Stir in Low-Fat Milk. Cook uncovered for 1 minute. Stir in Salt. Cover pan. Cook for another 5 minutes. Stir in White Pepper and Ground Nutmeg. Cook uncovered for 1 minute. Stir in cooked Potato. Serve.

Wash yellow squash. Cut into medium slices. Cut garlic cloves in half. Put squash and garlic cloves in a saucepan. Add water. Add salt and pepper. Bring water to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover saucepan. Cook for about 10 minutes or until squash is tender. Remove squash from saucepan. Strain water through a colander. Set squash aside. Add butter to saucepan. Add basil. Cook over medium heat for about 1 minute or until basil is wilted. Add water. Bring water to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover saucepan. Cook for about 2 minutes. Add squash. Stir. Add pepper. Cook for about 2 minutes or until squash is heated through. Serve immediately. Makes 2 servings.

Trim ends from beans and cut into 1-inch pieces. In large saucepan over medium heat, cook beans in 1/4 cup water just until tender. Drain. Heat remaining 1/4 cup water in saucepanadd sugar to water. Cook 2 minutes over medium-high heat stirring constantly. Add beanscook 2 minutes. Drain again. Add mushroomscook over medium heat, stirring constantly until tender. Stir in whipping creamheat to boiling. Remove from heat. Add seasoningsmix well. Serve warm.
Fill a large pitcher with water. Add baking soda and let sit for 15 minutes. Add tea bags to pitcher. Add sugar. Stir. Pour 2 cups into glasses and serve. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cut the cabbage into 1/2 inch thick wedges. Place the cabbage in a large pan or baking dish. Heat 1 tablespoon butter in an iron skillet. Add the apples to the skillet. Add 1 tablespoon butter to the pan. Cook the apples over medium heat until they are soft. Add the remaining 1/2 tablespoon butter to the apples. Stir the apples to coat the pieces with the butter. Remove the apples from the pan. Place the apples in a bowl. Add the brown sugar to the apples. Stir to combine. Place the apples in the cabbage. Pour the canola oil cooking spray over the top of the cabbage. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the top of the cabbage. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 to 45 minutes until the breadcrumbs are light brown. Serve warm.

Whisk the eggs and cream together in a shallow bowl. Add the worcestershire sauce and season with salt and pepper. Cook the eggs in a saucepan with the heat turned off. Carefully pour the eggs into the heated pan. Stir and cook gently until the eggs are firm and the desired consistency.

Preheat oven to 200 C/ 390 F. Dip the fish fillet into the egg and coat with the breadcrumbs. Place on an ovenproof dish and bake for 15-20 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve immediately with the sour cream mixture and the mayonnaise, season with salt and pepper if necessary and sprinkle with paprika.

Rinse shrimp wellpat dry with a paper towel. Brush shrimp with olive oil. In a large pan over medium heat, saute pine nuts in olive oil for 2 minutes. Add in parsley leaves. Saute 1 minute. Add in cilantro leaves. Saute 1 minute. Add in the mild green chilies. Cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add in the parmesan cheese. Stir until cheese is melted. Add in the olive oil. Stir until olive oil is mixed in well. Add in the shrimp. Stir until shrimp is evenly coated. Cover the pan with a lid. Place the pan in the oven for 3 to 4 minutes. Serve over pasta.

Combine 1 1/2 tablespoons soy sauce and 1 tablespoon rice vinegar in large bowladd snow peas and radishtoss to coat. Heat 2 tablespoons soy sauce and 2 tablespoons chili sauce in small saucepan over low heatstir in sesame oil, ginger, and cashews. Heat 2 tablespoons soy sauce and 2 tablespoons rice vinegar in small saucepan over low heatstir in sesame oil and gingerremove from heat. Drain and add snow peas and radish mixture to saucepan with cashewstoss to coat. Transfer vegetables to large serving plattersprinkle with sesame seeds and scallionsserve with dipping sauces. Makes about 4 cups.

Season salmon fillets generously on both sides with salt and pepper and lay flat on a sheet pan lined with foil. In a shallow bowl combine breadcrumbs and dried cranberries and mix well. Spread out breadcrumb mixture onto a clean plate. Drizzle with olive oil and toss to coat. Place one salmon fillet on breadcrumb mixture and spread out flat to coat both sides evenly. Place salmon fillet on baking sheet and repeat with remaining fillets and coatings. Bake until fillets are opaque and flaky and about 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for about five minutes before serving.
Place apples, celery, radishes and red onions into a large bowl. Add mayonnaise, lemon juice and rind. Add cranberries and cashews. Toss well to combine.

Cream the butter and sugar together. Sift together the flour, salt and poppy seeds. Add to the butter mixture. Mix together thoroughly. Make into a ball. Place on floured board. Knead together until smooth. Shape into a log. Roll out to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut into pieces about 1/2-inch wide. Dip into the egg, then roll into the currant jam. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 15 to 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 200c/180fan/gas 6. Heat oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6. Place flour and baking powder together into a mixing bowl and stir in the ginger and thyme. Whisk the milk with the eggs and stir into the flour mixture. Mix the cream-style corn and sweet potato together and stir into the egg and flour mixture. Heat some butter in a frying pan and add about 1/4 of the mixture into the pan. Cook the fritters until they are golden brown. Serve warm with butter.

Cut the fennel bulbs in half lengthwise and remove the stalks. Quarter the fennel bulbs. Put the fennel bulbs in a large pot with 2 cups of water. Add salt. Cook until the fennel is soft enough to mash with a fork. Transfer the fennel to a food processor. Add the anchovy fillets. Blend to a paste. Set aside. Bring 4 quarts of water to a boil. Salt the water. Add the pasta. Cook until the pasta is al-dente. Drain the pasta. Toss the pasta with the fennel mixture. Serve.
In food processor blend cheeses and mayonnaise until creamy and smooth. Add tabasco and pimento. Blend. Spread mixture on butter flavored crackers. Sprinkle with pimento.

To make the chipotle mayo, mix the mayonnaise, lime juice, and green onion in a small bowlstir in the chipotles and salt and pepper to taste. Wrap each tortilla in a damp kitchen towel and heat on a dry grill for about a minute or until the tortillas are soft and pliable. Spread a bit of mayonnaise on one half of the tortilla and top with shredded turkey and a few leaves of romaine lettuce. Fold the tortilla around the filling and serve immediately.

Bring 4 cups of water to boil. Add farfalle pasta and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain and rinse with cold water. Add mayonnaise, red wine vinegar and parsley. Fold in cooked tuna and remaining ingredients. Serve chilled.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add the green beansboil for about 4 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water and set aside until ready for use. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat and add the onioncook until softened and translucent, about 4 minutes. Add the green beanscook and stir until heated through and tender and add the parsleycook for about 2 more minutes and season with the salt and pepperremove from the heat and serve. Serve with freshly grated Parmesan cheese on top if desired.

In a large bowl, mix chicken with mayonnaise. Add celery, green onions, pepper and cranberries. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve with crackers or bread. This would be a wonderful dish for Christmas dinner. You could add a slice of red pepper if you like.

Saute lentils, celery ribs and onions in 2 tablespoons of oil until the lentils are soft and the celery is translucent. Add pork hocks and brown sugar and cook until pork hocks are tender. Add water and seasoning to taste and cook for 15 minutes over low heat. If you use dried lentils soak them overnight in 3 cups of water. If you use canned lentils use 2 1/2 cups water for 1 cup of lentils.

Peel potatoes. Boil until tender. Drain. Slice tomatoes. Cut onions in half. Mix all together in a large casserole. Season with salt & pepper. Mix margarine into milk. Stir into potatoes. Spread 3/4 of the potato mixture into prepared baking dish. Top with 1/4 of the flour mixture. Repeat layers. Sprinkle with 3/4 of the cheese. Cover with foil. Bake in a preheated 375F oven for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for 25 minutes or until brown.

Heat the sugar, corn syrup and water in a sauce pan to the point of dissolving the sugar and corn syrup. Bring to the boil and stir to keep from burning. Add the egg whites and the vanilla and salt to the mixture and stir to combine. Boil the mixture to the hard-crack stage of the candy thermometer, about 300 degrees F.
