Cool the syrup to the soft-ball stage of the candy thermometer - about 140 degrees F. In a small bowl blend the orange rind into the mayonnaise and set aside. To the hot syrup add the mayonnaise and orange mixture and stir to combine and cook to the hard-candy stage about 300 degrees F. Pour the hot syrup over the chopped fruits and marshmallows and let cool before serving. Serve as is or make fruit parfaits using yogurt and fresh fruit. Add some berries and top it off with the marshmallow syrup. Makes about one cup of syrup.

Combine all ingredients, except olives, in food processor until smooth. With processor running, gradually blend in olives until smooth. Transfer to serving dish, sprinkle with paprika. Serve with crackers.

Cut marmalade into small pieces. In a bowl combine bisquick baking mix and cold water. Mix well and form into balls. Roll in orange marmalade. Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 425 degrees for 12 minutes. Serve with butter.

Cream together butter and sugar. Add the flour and baking soda to the butter mixture and beat until blended. Stir in oatmeal. Fill paper-lined muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake 18 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes and remove from cups. Top each muffin with a dollop of frosting. (Recipe yields 12 muffins)
Place chicken breasts in a 4 or 5 quart slow cooker. Top with marmalade and juice. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and cook on low for 4 hours. Serve over rice.

Melt the butter in a pan and sauté the apples until they are soft. Set aside to cool. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees f. Combine all the breadcrumbs with the apple mixture. Grease a 10-inch casserole dish and place the apple mixture into it. In a bowl mix together the egg and the cream. Pour this mixture over the apple mixture and add the orange zest. Bake for 35 minutes. Allow the pudding to cool for 15 minutes before serving.

Make gravy mix according to package directions. Mix beef with worcestershire sauce. Drain fat from the gravy. Mix with the beef mixture. Stir in the gravy mixture. In a large bowl, combine the biscuit mix, milk and gravy. Mix well. Pour beef mixture into a greased 3-quart baking dish. Spoon the biscuit mixture over the beef. Pour the hot water over the biscuit mixture. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Let stand 15 minutes before serving. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Combine all the ingredients except the water in a saucepan. Bring to boil stirring constantly. Cook for 1 minute. Gradually whisk in the water while stirring constantly. Boil for another minute. Pour the mixture into small heatproof containers and cool completely before using.

Sift together the flour and cornmeal. Cut in the shortening until the mixture is crumbly. Stir in the baking powder and soda. Add sugar and mix thoroughly. In another bowl beat eggs. Stir the egg mixture into the dry mixture. Stir in water and oil. Turn out on floured board and knead until smooth. Place in greased bread pan. Bake at 425 degrees for 35-40 minutes. Remove from oven and turn out onto a wire rack. Let cool. Store in tin.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Arrange blueberries in bottom of pie shell. Place pie shell into the oven. Cook for about 5 minutes or until crust is brown. Meanwhile, make topping. In a bowl, combine flour, cinnamon and orange juice. Gradually add brown sugar until all the flour is moistened. Add the melted butter. Mix well. Pour the mixture over the pie shell. Bake for about 5 minutes or until the topping begins to brown. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees. Bake for about an hour or until the filling is bubbly. Allow pie to cool for about 5 minutes before serving. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream if desired.

Beat eggs in a mixing bowl. Beat in ricotta cheese. Add cream, sugar substitute and spices. Stir until well blended. Pour into a greased muffin pan. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool before removing from pan.

Cream sugar and cocoa powder together. Add the egg whites and corn syrup and beat until well combined. Stir in the baking powder and salt and then add the oats and the flour. Stir until just combined. Pour the mixture onto waxed paper and with the palms of your hands, roll the dough into walnut-sized balls. Place the balls of dough onto the bottom of the waxed paper and roll the dough balls with the palms of your hands into walnut-sized balls again. Then roll the balls in the cereal. Place the balls on ungreased baking sheets and bake for about 12 minutes. Let them cool for about 10 minutes and then transfer the cookies to cooling racks. These cookies will be crunchy if stored at room temperature or soft and chewy if stored in the refrigerator. Either way, they will taste yummy!

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat 2 teaspoons of the oil. Add the onions, bell peppers, garlic, cumin, oregano, hot chili peppers, and a generous pinch of salt. Cook until the onions are translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in the remaining oil. Add the chicken and cook until golden brown on both sides. Pour the lemon juice over the chicken. Stir. Cover with a lid and cook until the chicken is cooked through. Transfer the chicken to a cutting board. Strain the excess liquid from the pan. Add the juices from the pan to the chicken. Sprinkle the chicken with lemon juice. Cut the chicken into serving pieces. Serve over rice or couscous.

Wash rice and lentils several times with water until the water is clear of any dirt. Place lentils and rice in a large pot with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium heat then reduce heat to low and simmer for 45 minutes or until rice is cooked through. Drain excess water from rice/lentils. Add oil to a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and saute until onions are translucent, 5 to 7 minutes. Add rice/lentils to the skillet with the onions. Stir to combine. Add cumin and stir to combine. Cook for 5 minutes or until the rice/lentils are heated through. Serve immediately with lemon wedges or pita bread.

Cook the chopped onions in 1/3 cup of oil over moderate heat until tender. Add 4 cups of the tomatoes with juice and bring to boiling. Reduce heatcook uncovered, stirring occasionally for 25 to 30 minutes or until thickened. Blend 1/3 cup of the tomatoes with the chopped green chilies and 3 cups of the spinach. Add to the cooked tomatoes with the vinegar. Cook for about 10 minutes. Drain and transfer to a blender with the cream cheese and 3/4 cup of the half-and-half. Add 1/2 cup of the remaining half-and-half, the remaining cream and the cheese mixture. Process until smooth. Transfer to a bowlstir in the remaining 1/2 cup of half-and-half. Season with the salt and pepper. Transfer to a large serving bowl. Top with the remaining 1 cup of chopped spinach. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook sausage until brown and drain well on paper towels. Layer crescent rolls and sausage pieces into pie plate and top with egg mixture and cheese. Bake for about 45 minutes or until done and golden brown.

Place rice in saucepan and cover with milk. Bring to boil over high heat and then reduce to low. Cover and let simmer 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in coconut extract. Sprinkle with coconut flakes.

Prepare crust: In a food processor or blender, mix together graham cracker crumbs, margarine, soy cream cheese and 1/2 cup brown sugar. Mix well. Press firmly onto the bottom and sides of a 9-inch springform pan. Prepare filling: In a food processor or blender, mix together 1 cup brown sugar and 1 cup nonfat soy milk. Add the pumpkin puree and cooking rum. Blend until smooth. Pour into the crust. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until set. Cool completely. Refrigerate 2 hours. Prepare topping: In a food processor or blender, mix together remaining brown sugar and 1 cup nonfat soy milk. Blend until smooth. Pour over top of cheesecake. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving. To serve, remove side of pan. Dust with cinnamon-nutmeg mixture. Garnish with pecans and cranberries.

In a small bowl, combine eggs, water, biscuit mix, onions, and cayenne pepper. Beat well with a fork. Pour into a greased 9 x 9 or 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes. This is a great recipe to serve with a simple green salad. Enjoy!
Mix together all ingredients except pork chops and put into a baking dish. Put pork chops on top and bake at 300 degrees for 1 hour and 30 minutes to 1 hour and 45 minutes.

Peel potatoes and cut into large slices. Boil until tender then drain. Dip in beaten egg then roll in coconut and almonds. Lay in a lightly greased 13 x 9 x 2 inch pan and pour milk over them. Sprinkle with vanilla and powdered sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and immediately sprinkle with grated dark chocolate. Serve warm.

Combine soup and milkblend with 1/2 cup of the cheese. Stir in the chicken. Fill crescent rolls with the cheese mixturefold in ends of dough to seal. Place sealed crescents on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Heat the butter in a pan until melted. Add the onion and saute until tender. Add courgettes and stir until cooked through. Cook the pasta until al dente then drain. Toss the cooked pasta with the butter/onion/courgettes mix along with the walnuts and parsley. Stir over a low heat until heated through then add the cream and parmesan cheese and stir until melted. Serve immediately accompanied by a salad of your choice.
Add strong coffee to a blender. Add brown sugar, vanilla bean seeds and blend. Add bananas, almonds, ice cubes. Blend until smooth.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Prepare baking sheet with non-stick baking spray. Mix ground turkey with soup and eggs. Add oats, garlic cloves and onion. Mix thoroughly. Shape mixture into 8 to 10 meatloaves. Place on baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. Flip meatloaves over. Bake for an additional 20 minutes. Let sit for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Cook the rice according to the package directions. Add the beans to the rice for the last five minutes of cooking time. Add the mexicorn, ground turkey and seasonings to the rice. Cover the rice with cheese for the last five minutes of cooking time. Serve warm with tortilla chips.

Place meat in bottom of pressure cooker. Fill with water. Place vegetables on top of meat. Covercook on high pressure for 1 1/2 hours. Let the pressure out naturally. Remove meat. Remove vegetables. Serve over hot rice.

Boil the potatoes until tender, and cool. Grate the potatoes, and mix with egg yolks. Add flour until the gnocchi mixture is smooth. Dump the gnocchi mixture onto a lightly floured board. Flatten into 1/2 inch disks. Cook the gnocchi in boiling water until they rise to the top. Remove from water with a slotted spoon. Dump gnocchi into a large skillet. Add the boiling water, salt and 1 tbsp. Butter. Cook over medium heat until the gnocchi are softened. Drain well. Stir in the spinach. Transfer to serving bowls. Top with the remaining 1 tbsp. Butter.

Mix together sugar, peanuts and corn syrup. Put mixture into a mold that has a hollow center. Place the mold on a baking sheet. Set aside. In a small saucepan, heat the rice flour over medium heat. Stir constantly for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Let cool. When the peanut mixture is set, drizzle the rice flour mixture over the top. Let set for about one hour. Remove from mold. Enjoy!

Sift together the flours into a large mixing bowl. Add the butter and cut it into small pieces with your fingertips. Add the eggs, one at a time, whisking until incorporated. Add the milk while whisking. Beat until smooth. Whisk in salt. Pour mixture into the popover pan and bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Allow popovers to stand in pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool.

In large skillet cook ground beef and diced onions together with paprika. Drain. Add kidney beans and tomatoes. Simmer for 30 minutes. Stir in cooked rice and heat through. Mix in monterey jack and green bell peppers. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in butter and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Brown ground turkey and onion in a large saucepan. Cook over medium-high heat until turkey is no longer pink and onions are tender. Drain and discard the fat from the pan. Stir in the beans, salsa and refried beans until combined. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until beans are heated through and thickened slightly. Stir in the chili powder and cumin. Taste and add additional spices as needed to your liking. Serve with cornbread and garnish with cheese and sour cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta until al dente. Drain and return to pot. Heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant and lightly browned. Add the chard and cook until wilted. Add the tomato packed with oil and the broth. Simmer until the broth is reduced and thickened. Add the pasta and the balsamic vinegar to the sauce and stir. Remove from the heat and stir in the pine nuts. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to an ovenproof dish and sprinkle with the Parmesan. Bake until the Parmesan is golden brown and the pasta is bubbly, about 10 minutes.

Add sesame oil to large saucepan over medium heat. Add chicken and brown on all sides for approximately 10 minutes. Add scallions and ginger to chicken and continue to cook for 10 minutes or more. Deglaze pan with soy sauce. Reduce heat to simmer and add brown sugar. Cook until mixture is reduced by half. Serve with rice or noodles or both.

Preheat oven to 400f. Bring water to boil. Cut brussels sprout halves crosswise into fourths. In large bowl mix sprouts with lemon juice, sugar and kosher salt. Place brussels sprouts into glass baking dish. Drizzle with butter and pour water over top. Bake until brussels sprouts are tender but firm to touch, about 35 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir brussels sprouts and add more lemon juice. Serve warm.

In a large pot, mix together the buttermilk and mustard. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in the shrimp. Cook for 2 minutes or until shrimp are pink. Add the sugar and salt. Stir in the cucumber and green onions. Cook for 2 minutes. Ladle into cups and serve hot.

Make up dried apples by adding water to apples. Let sit for about an hour. Strain off water. Combine apples, orange juice, orange zest, cinnamon and sugar. Pour into pie crusts. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 35 minutes.

Combine oil, vinegar, mustard and soy sauce in a small mixing bowl. Stir in sesame oil, salt and pepper to taste. Set aside. Toss spinach with dressing just before serving to prevent wilting. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds before serving.

Prepare graham cracker crusts according to package instructions. In a large bowl, combine lime juice and sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add gelatin. Stir until dissolved. Add condensed milk. Stir until gelatin is completely dissolved. Add green food coloring and stir until green color is achieved. Pour into graham cracker crusts. Chill until firm. Garnish with lime rind. Serve with whipping cream for dipping.

Melt butter and brown sugar together in a saucepan and stir until dissolved. Remove from heat and add the eggs one at a time, beating with a whisk to combine. Add the flour and cocoa to the egg mixture and stir until combined. Add the vanilla extract and stir again to combine. Pour the batter evenly into a greased 13x9-inch baking dish and sprinkle with walnuts. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a brownie comes out clean.

Fill an 8-ounce glass half full of ice cubes. Pour in 6 ounces of boiling water. Stir to dissolve. Add fresh lavender and fresh lemon juice to the tea. Slowly stir in 4 ounces of fresh lemonade. Garnish with lemon slice. Serve hot or cold.

Cissy Bars: In a 9x13 baking dish melt margarine and brown sugar together and stir until well blended. Then mix in nuts and stir well. Next, place graham crackers in the baking dish and pour over the melted mixture and spread out evenly and smooth with spatula. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until lightly brown and crisp.

Wash carrots well under cold running water. Peel carrots. Cut carrots into large chunks. Peel onion. Cut onion into large chunks. Toss together carrots and onion. Dip carrots into corn starch. Dip carrots into eggs. Dip carrots into flour. Place carrots on cooking sheet. Spray with cooking spray. Cook carrots for about 15 minutes on medium heat. Stir carrots occasionally. Makes about 2 cups.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Coat a baking sheet with cooking sprayplace the breadcrumbs on a plate. Whisk the egg whites in a large bowl until frothyadd the cornstarch and whisk until combined. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Dip the breasts into the egg whites, then coat them evenly with the breadcrumbs. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the breaded breasts and cook until browned about five minutes per side. Transfer the breasts to the baking sheetbake for about five minutes or until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 165 degrees Fahrenheit. Serve with the lemon wedges on the side.

Boil water to gelatin. In a bowl mix gelatin and boiling water together. Let cool. Fold in frozen lemonade concentrate. Whip the cream cheese to soft peaks. Fold in the whipped cream. Fold in the gelatin/water mixture. Add food coloring to the gelatin/water mixture. Chill for 30 minutes. Serve over ice. Yummmmmm.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Wash potatoes. Pat dry with paper towels. Toss potatoes with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Transfer potatoes to a large rimmed baking sheet. Toss to coat. Roast potatoes for about 45 minutes to 1 hour or until potatoes are tender.

Cream butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer. Add sugar and molasses. Beat until light and fluffy. Add egg. Stir in dry ingredients. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake until firm. (cookies will be soft when removed from the oven.) Cool.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the orzo and cook until tender but not soft, about 8 minutes. Drain well. In a skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Stir in the onion powder and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice and zest and cook for 30 seconds. Add the spinach and cook until heated through. Stir in the orzo and the parmesan cheese until the cheese is melted. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

Prepare the Italian bread. Split in half lengthwise. Butter the bread slices and spread with a thin layer of sour cream and oregano. Layer with bacon. Add a layer of tomato slices. Layer with mozzarella and another layer of Italian bread. Place in a large baking dish. Cook at 375 for about 30 minutes. Enjoy!
Blend orange juice with pineapple juice. Add honey. Stir in ginger ale. Pour into a large punch bowl. Add rum. Add pineapple chunk and melon ball. Serve in a glass with a straw.

Saute onion in oil. Remove from oil and set aside. Mix eggs in a bowl with onion, soy sauce, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Mix in bok choy. Place a large pan on medium heat. Once pan is hot, add about a tablespoon of oil. Pour in egg mixture. Add bamboo shoots and shrimp. Stir eggs until cooked through. Serve over rice or noodles.

Pour egg whites in large bowl and stir in 1/4 cup of the sesame seeds. Place 1/4 of the sesame seed mixture on a plate. Dip one piece of chicken at a time in the egg white mixture then press into the sesame seed mixture to coat. Place on baking sheet. Repeat with remaining chicken pieces. Spray baking sheet lightly with nonstick spray. Place chicken in oven and bake for 20 minutes or until no longer pink. Remove from oven. Dip each piece of chicken in dijon mustard mixture. Coat with apricot preserves. Serve with dipping sauce. Serves 8. Makes 16 pieces.

In a large saucepan, combine broth, green onion, garlic clove and lemon juice. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for about 5 minutes or until liquid is reduced to about 2 cups. Remove from heat. Add avocado, yogurt and crabmeat to broth mixtureblend well with immersion blender or whisk. Pour into 4 soup bowls and garnish with fresh chopped parsley or cilantro.

Combine raspberry jello and boiling water in a large bowl. Stir until dissolved. Chill until ready to serve. Mix cream cheese and butter together until blended. Add the raspberries and stir until smooth. Place raspberries in a serving bowl. Cut pretzels in half and dip into melted butter. Dip pretzels into raspberry mixture and arrange on a serving platter. Chill until ready to serve. Just before serving, mix together Cool Whip and powdered sugar. Spread over pretzels. Serve with raspberries.
Bake at 375 for approx. 30 min. until bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In 2-quart casserole dish, combine cooked chicken, celery, soft breadcrumbs, parsley, salt, eggs, and 2 cups of the chicken broth. In large bowl, combine the remaining broth with the flourstir. Pour over chicken mixture. Cover casserole dish tightlybake 45 minutes or until heated through. Serve warm.

Melt the butter in a large pan over medium heat. Add the shallots and saute until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and saute 1 minute more. Add the thyme and tarragon and saute 1 minute more, until fragrant. Add the white wine and deglaze the pan, scraping the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon. Add the mussels and cook just until they begin to open, about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and transfer the mussels to a large serving bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until the mussels are fully open, about 15 minutes. Serve over the bread slices drizzled with the ale. Serve with the dipping sauce on the side.

Sauté chicken breasts in a skillet over medium heat for 3-4 minutes per side or until lightly browned and done. Dice chicken into small pieces and set aside. In a large saucepan, heat butter over low heat. Add Italian salad dressing mix, white wine and cream of mushroom soup. Stirring constantly over medium heat until mixture is hot but not boiling. Stir in cream cheese with chives until smooth. Add chicken, angel hair pasta, salt & pepper to taste. Covercook 2-3 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Mix sour cream, lemon juice, sugar, salt and crushed pineapple until smooth. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Scoop 1/3 cup of the sour cream mixture into each paper cup. Add 1 banana slice to each cup. Add 1 cherry. Sprinkle with pecans. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Serve. (You can use orange juice instead of lemon juice.)

Preheat oven to 325f. Whisk flour, baking soda, salt, and creamy butter in large bowl. Beat in sugar, vanilla extract, eggs and mashed bananas with electric mixer at low speed until blended. Fold in pecan pieces with wooden spoon until evenly distributed. Divide batter into three 8 ounce pans greased with butter or spray oil. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until lightly golden brown on top. Cool in pan 10 minutes before turning out onto wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl sift together flour, baking soda and salt. Add sugar and cocoa and stir to combine. Add eggs and beat with mixer until well mixed. Add boiling water and buttermilk and stir until combined. Mix in oil and vanilla and stir until combined. Pour batter into two greased 9" round cake pans. Bake for 30 minutes. Let cool before frosting.

Cook rice according to package directionsdrain. Prepare broccoli according to package directionsdrain wellset aside. Melt butter in skillet over medium heatsaut onion about 5 minutes or until tender. Add broccolicook 2 minutes or until tender-crisp. Mix broccoli and rice together in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Top with cheese whizsprinkle with salt and pepperdot with sour cream. Bake at 375F for 22 minutes or until heated through and bubbly. Serve hot.

Spread chive & onion cream cheese onto the sourdough bread. Add lemon juice to the cream cheese to thin and spread. Add dijon-style mustard and garlic pepper seasoning. Add sliced turkey breast. Top with provolone cheese. Roast sweet peppers and spinach leaves. Place roasted peppers and spinach leaves over the top of the sandwich.

Prepare pie crust as directed on box for two crusts or use your favorite prepared crust. For the crumb toppingcombine all the ingredients in a mixing bowluse your fingers to crumble the mixture together. Spread the mixture over the pie crustsdot the top with the butter. Bake at 375 degrees fahrenheit for 40 to 45 minutes or until the apples are tender when pierced with a fork. Let cool on wire rack before serving.

In medium saucepan heat oil over medium-high heat. Saute celery, mushrooms, slivered almonds for 2 minutes. Add vegetables and soy sauce. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes over medium heat or until vegetables are tender-crisp. Serve immediately or cool completelyrefrigerate up to 24 hours.
Melt butter in saucepan. Saute onions and mushrooms. Add barley and chicken broth. Cook over low heat until barley is soft. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

Roll crescent rolls out on a lightly floured surface into a large rectangle. Spread apples and mountain dew over the rolls. Sprinkle cinnamon and butter over the apples. Roll up and cut into 1-inch pieces. Bake at 375 degrees for about 20 minutes or till golden brown. Serve warm with whipped cream and/or carmel sauce if desired.

Prepare crust as directed on box. Bake until golden brown. Cool completely. In medium saucepan over low heat, mix evaporated milk and brown sugar until blended. Gradually blend in kahlua and corn syrup. In large bowl with electric mixer beat egg yolks until light and fluffy. Gradually beat in corn syrup mixture. Stir in pumpkin pie spice and salt. Gradually beat in pumpkin. Pour into crust and bake at 350f for 40 minutes. Serve with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large bowl combine the flounder fillets with the dried oregano, salt, pepper, spaghetti sauce and the parsley until the fish is coated with the sauce mixture. Place the mixture into an ungreased 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Top the flounder with mozzarella cheese. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes until the mozzarella cheese has melted. Serve with a side salad and crusty bread.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat olive oil. Add leek and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add cauliflower and cook until tender. Add chicken stock and cook until heated through. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Puree in a blender until smooth. Season with nutmeg and salt and pepper. Return to saucepan and stir in olive oil. Warm before serving.

Place the chicken breasts on the bottom of the slow cooker, pour the soup over the top and top with the butter pieces and the egg noodles. Cook on high for 4 to 5 hours or low for 6 to 8 hours. Serve with a salad or vegetable.

Slice bagels lengthwise and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Brush top of bagel with butter. Place in oven and bake for about five minutes or until lightly browned. While bagels are baking, place eggs in saucepan and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for three minutes. Drain. Place eggs in small bowl and add salt and pepper to taste. Chop cheddar cheese and place in small bowl. When bagels are done bake them and place cheese and egg mixture in center of bagel halves and top with remaining bagel halves. Serve hot.

Place raisins in a small bowl and pour soymilk over them. Microwave soymilk and raisins together for about 30 seconds until raisins are plump and soft. Meanwhile, combine oatmeal and ground cinnamon in a large mixing bowl. Add raisins and soymilk mixture and toss well. Transfer to an 8-inch square baking dish and sprinkle evenly with salt and maple syrup. Bake for about 30 minutes or until oatmeal is light golden and very firm. Let cool for about 10 minutes. Place walnuts on top. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken pieces in a single layer. Cook until they have browned well all over. Remove them from the skillet. Set aside. Add the relish to the hot skillet. Cook until the relish has softened slightly, about two minutes. Add the chicken pieces back into the relish in the skillet. Cook for about two minutes more. Transfer to a large baking dish. Drizzle with oil. Sprinkle with ground black pepper. Pour lemon juice over the chicken. Sprinkle with the parsley. Bake until the chicken is done, about 15 minutes. Transfer chicken pieces to a serving platter. Keep warm. Serve with a side salad.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large Dutch oven or heavy pot. Add onion and cook until tender. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add tomatoes and chili flakes. Cook until mixture begins to bubble. Stir in balsamic vinegar and sugar. Cook until reduced to 1/3 of original volume. Stir in basil. Cook 2 minutes. Add pasta and toss to coat. Season with salt. Serve with parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large pan heat olive oil. Add the onion and garlic. Cook until softened. Add carrot and rice. Cook for about five minutes. Add the frozen vegetables. Mix. Add the herbs. Cook until the rice is tender and the vegetables are done.

Cook pasta according to package directionsdrain and keep warm. In a large skillet heat the ground beef and the spaghetti sauce over medium heat until meat is cooked and sauce is hot. In a bowl combine the sour cream and whipping creamadd to the ground beef mixture. Stir in the pasta and cooked ground beef. Toss with parmesan and mozzarella cheeses, then serve.
Mix macaroni and cheese mix with the tuna and potato chips. Pour into a 9x13 pan. Top with breadcrumbs. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes.

Pour vegan mayonnaise into a bowl and add tofu. Add celery and onions to bowl and mix with a fork. Add mustard to bowl and mix with tofu and other ingredients. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve chilled.

Heat olive oil in large skillet on stovetop. Add red pepper flakes and garlic cloves. Cook until garlic is fragrant. Add shrimp. Cook until shrimp are pink and opaque. Pour in dry sherry. Cook until sherry is reduced by half. Remove shrimp from skillet and add chopped fresh parsley and Old Bay seasoning. Serve shrimp over cooked pasta.

Cut bread into small cubes and arrange in a baking dish. In a saucepan melt butter and add raisins and nutmeg. Bring to boil and then remove from heat. Pour over bread. Whisk eggs and cream together and pour over bread mixture. Mix together sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle over bread and pour cream mixture over bread. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. The next day preheat oven to 350f degrees and bake for 45-50 minutes or until golden brown on top and set in center. Serve warm or at room temperature with ice cream and berries.

Peel potatoes, cut in half lengthwise and remove seeds with knife. Place potatoes in large pot with enough water to cover. Bring to boiling, cook for 10 minutes or until potatoes are fork tender. Drain well. Return potatoes to pot, add milk and salt. Mash potatoes with potato masher or fork until potatoes are smooth and fluffy. Add brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice and butter. Stir until blended. Spoon mixture into greased baking dish. Cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes at 350f or until center is set. Place in refrigerator for at least one hour before serving. While potatoes are cooling, prepare puffs by putting almonds in small bowl and tossing with brown sugar until coated. Place on parchment paper lined baking sheet, drizzle with melted butter. Sprinkle with salt. Bake for 20 minutes or until crisp. Remove from oven. Let cool completely on baking sheet. Drizzle with warmed syrup if desired. Serve with potatoes

Clean leeks and slice lengthwise into half moons. Slice carrots into half inch pieces. Heat olive oil over medium heat. Add leeks and carrots and saute for about 5 minutes. Add garlic and saute for another minute. Add water and cover for about 30 minutes. Serve over pasta.

Cook bacon in the microwave. Dice bacon into small pieces. Dice red onion and chop broccoli. Drain bacon. Combine the bacon with the broccoli florets. Combine the rest of the salad ingredients. Chill until ready to serve.

In a large mixing bowl, cream butter until smooth. Add the cocoa powder. Cream until mixture is smooth. Add the coffee liqueur. Cream for 1 minute. Add the instant coffee. Cream for 1 minute. Add the corn syrup. Cream for 30 seconds. Add the sugar. Beat until mixture is smooth. Stir in the chocolate wafers and the almonds. Roll dough into balls. Dip balls into the cinnamon sugar.

Prepare cinnamon sugar mixture. Set aside. Unroll biscuits. Cut each into eighths. Place about 12 biscuit pieces into each of four greased 9-inch round cake pans. In a small bowl, combine butter and sugar. Cut butter into flour mixture with a pastry blender until crumbly. Sprinkle crumb mixture evenly over biscuits. Add pecans and raisins. Bake at 350f for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from pans. Cool completely. Drizzle with glaze. Store in an airtight container at room temperature up to one week.

Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the kohlrabi and cook until browned and tender, about 10 minutes. Add the parsley, flour and cook for another minute. Add the broth and cook until the liquid evaporates. Add the sugar and cook until the liquid thickens and coats the back of a spoon. Season with salt and remove from the heat. Serve hot.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in icing sugar and cornstarch until smooth. Cook over medium-high heat until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat and whisk in flour until combined. Add vanilla extract and whisk until combined. Pour mixture into a large bowl and use a spoon or spatula to whip until smooth and fluffy. Transfer mixture into a large, greased baking dish and spread into an even layer. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and firm around the edges, about 55-60 minutes.

Place carrots in a large pot and add apple cider. Bring to a boil and cook 10 minutes or until carrots are fork-tender. Drain carrots in a colander and place in a large bowl. In a small bowl combine brown sugar and tarragon. Set aside. In a large skillet melt butter over medium heat and add carrots and brown sugar mixture. Stir gently over medium heat until carrots are coated with butter and brown sugar mixture. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
Trim the broccoli to remove the tough stem and tougher outer leaves. Cut into bite sized florets. Toss in olive oil and set aside. Toss the broccoli with the rest of the ingredients and serve.

Put sugar into the bottom of a large saucepan. Place over medium heat and bring to a simmer. Pour egg yolks into a bowl. Temper egg yolks by adding a few drops of the hot sugar syrup. Whisk to combine. Slowly pour the tempered egg yolks into the pan while constantly whisking. Keep cooking until the mixture is thick and coats the back of a spoon. Whisk in the condensed milk, vanilla extract, chocolate cookies, and heavy cream. Mix until the cookies are completely dissolved. Transfer to an ice cream maker and freeze according to the manufacturer's directions.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Beat butter, sugar, cocoa powder, and eggs until fluffy. Pour into pie crust. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until set and slightly puffed up. Let cool completely before adding whipped topping. Spread whipped topping over piesprinkle with nuts and chocolate curls, if desired. Store leftovers covered tightly in refrigerator for 1 to 2 days or frozen for up to 2 weeks. To reheat, remove from refrigerator 1 hour before baking at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 minutes or until heated through. Let cool before adding topping.

In a large pot bring coconut milk to a simmer. Add orange juice and orange zest. Simmer for a minute. Add Thai fish sauce and chili sauce. Stir and add garlic and ginger. Simmer for a few minutes. Add salmon fillets and cook for about 4 minutes or until salmon flakes easily with a fork. Add mint and cilantro. Simmer for a minute and serve over rice.
Melt butter with salt and brown sugar and simmer for about 5 minutes. Whisk to blend. Cool. Use to drizzle on ice cream.

Spread the dried out bread cubes in the bottom of an ungreased 11 x 7 inch casserole dish. Sprinkle with the shredded cheddar cheese. Place cooked sausage in the center of the cheddar and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Whisk the eggs in a small bowl with a fork until blended and then add the milk and whisk until blended. Pour over the sausage mixture in the casserole dish and sprinkle with the remaining cheddar cheese. Bake for about 40 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the eggs are set. Let stand for about 10 minutes before serving. Serve with a tossed salad and fresh fruit if desired.

Cut off tops of jalapenos. Fill with cream cheese. Wrap in bacon. Secure with toothpick. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 to 40 minutes or until bacon is crispy. Serve with your favorite dip.

Combine 3 cups flour, 1 cup sugar, baking powder, salt in large bowl. Beat eggs well. Add orange juice, water and vegetable oil. Stir until well mixed. Heat vegetable cooking spray in large frying pan. Pour mixture by about 1/4 cupfuls onto hot griddle. Cook until golden brown.
Cook the mushroom in a pot with olive oil and butter, add garlic granules and red wine and cook for about 30 minutes.

Beat eggs slightlyadd milk, salt & freshly ground black pepper. Add cheese. Heat a small amount of oil (about 1 tablespoon) in a pan over medium-high heatadd onions and cook 1 to 2 minutes or until tenderthen add eggs to pancook 1 to 2 minutes or until eggs are softly setspoon eggs on toasted slices of bread (buttered first) and enjoy with fresh fruit on the side.
Take a hot dog bun. Place hot dogs in bun with cheese. Make a well in the cheese with a fork. Crack egg over well. Top with breadcrumbs. Bake in oven at 350 degrees until golden brown.

Make pie crust as directed on box. Blend flour, sugar and orange zest in food processor. Add rhubarb and raspberries and puree. Mix jelly and rhubarb puree. Fill pie shell with rhubarb mixture. Refrigerate 3 hours before serving. Sprinkle powdered sugar over pie just before serving. Serves 8.

In a large pot over medium heat combine the dried apples and the cinnamon stick. Cook for 1 minute and then add the scotch whisky and the honey. Simmer for 10 minutes. Remove the cinnamon stick. Pour into a heatproof mug and top with hot water. Garnish with fresh sage leaves.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook and stir zucchini and corn with garlic for 10 minutes. Combine the pimiento and remaining vegetablescook for 5 minutes. Combine the cheese and seasoningssprinkle over vegetables. Cover and cook for 5 minutes more or until cheese is melted and vegetables are tender.

Bring 3/4 cup of water to boil. Add creole seasoning and new potatoes. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Drain and set aside. Heat butter and garlic in a fry pan until melted. Add onion and cook until softened. Add green beans and stir until they are tender but still bright green. Drain. Add green beans and new potatoes to the fry pan. Cook over medium heat until they are hot. Transfer to a serving dish.
Combine all the spices and coarse salt. Store in a tightly sealed jar. Use as a rub for meat or poultry before grilling.

Cook onion until tender. Add tomatoes and beans. Stir in curry powder and water. Cover and simmer on low until beans are tender. Add oxtail soup mix. Cover and simmer on low for 10 minutes or until thickened.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In large bowl combine quinoa flour, quinoa, baking powder, baking soda, salt, bananas, eggs, honey until smooth. Fill muffin pan 3/4 full with batter. Bake for 18-20 minutes.

Mix all dry ingredients together. In a separate bowl beat eggs until blended. Add sugar to eggs. Stir dry mixture into eggs until smooth. Spread batter into a greased pan. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 25 to 30 minutes or until brown. Remove from oven. Cool. Cut into circles. Fill with raspberry jam. Fold edges to make triangle. Place one triangle side down in muffin tin. Add raspberry jam. Repeat until all mixture is gone. Bake until cookies are brown.

Break wafers in half. Line a 9-inch springform pan with waxed paper. Sift powdered sugar. Blend wafers in bowl until crumbly. Add the coconut. Mix well. Press mixture firmly on bottom of prepared pan. Cream together the oleo and orange juice. Add the nuts. Fold in the orange juice mixture. Pour over crumb mixture. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Remove from pan. Cut into 1-inch balls. Roll in powdered sugar. Store in airtight container.

Soak salt cod fish for an hour in cold water changing the water every 10 minutes. Drain the fish. Heat the fat salt pork in a large stock pot over low heat until it begins to render some fat and is lightly browned on all sides. Add the fish to the pot along with the onion, potato, carrot and boiling water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Lower the heat to low, cover the pot partially and simmer for about 2 hours until the fish is cooked through and the potatoes are tender. Strain the fish through a colander to drain the liquid from the pot, leaving behind all of the flavorful broth. Skim any excess fat that may have come to the surface during the cooking process. Add the broth to a large pot along with the milk. Bring to a boil over high heat. Stir in the corn niblets, season with salt and pepper to taste and cook for another 5 minutes or so until the corn is tender. Stir in the cooked cod fish. Taste for seasoning again as needed. Serve immediately in bowls with crackers or crusty bread

In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, combine the egg yolks. Whisk in the sugar until pale yellow. Whisk in the Grand Marnier. Whisking constantly, slowly stream in the heavy cream. Fold in the Kahlua. Add the vanilla extract and stir to combine. Divide the mixture into 2 bowls. Place one bowl over an ice bath and the other over a small saucepan of simmering water. Whisk the egg whites until they become foamy. In a clean bowl, beat the egg whites until soft peaks form. Gently fold the egg whites into the egg yolk mixture. Transfer the pots de crme to individual serving dishes. Top the pots de crme with the chocolate chips and the whipped cream. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray an 8 x 8 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine coconut, cornflakes and nuts. In another bowl whisk together eggs and milk. Dip bread slices in egg mixture until coated. Dip slices into coconut mixture. Lay in prepared pan. Bake until golden brown for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Serve with maple syrup and whipped cream.

Cook noodles as directed on package, drain. In a small saucepan melt butter over low heatstir in sour cream. Cook over low heat just until sour cream mixture is hot. Add noodlestoss to coat with butter mixture. Sprinkle with pot cheese.

Saute bacon grease and onion in heavy pan until onion is transparent. Mix in flour and salt and pepper to taste. Add tomatoes and cook for 30 minutes or until tomatoes begin to thicken. Add sugar and bay leaf. Cook an additional 10 minutes. Add celery leaves and cook an additional 10 minutes.

Prepare the fish by rinsing and then drying with paper towels. In a shallow bowl add breadcrumbs to buttermilk and stir to combine. Dip trout fillets into crumbs and set aside on a plate. In a small bowl whisk together parsley, mustard powder and season with salt and pepper to taste. Dip each fillet into the parsley mixture and place on baking sheet lined with aluminum foil. Drizzle each fillet with melted butter. Arrange almonds on top of each fillet. Bake trout for 15 minutes or until flaky and opaque throughout. Serve with lemon wedges on the side. Enjoy --.
Combine spiced rum and milk in mug. Add sugar and cinnamon to taste. Serve warm.

In a small skillet over low heat, heat the oil. Add the onion powder and thyme and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Set aside. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Place 3 wonton skins on a plate. Brush each one with the egg mixture. Place 1/4 cup broccoli in the center of each. Sprinkle with the cooked broccoli. Divide the cheese into 3 equal portions. Place a portion on each wonton skin. Brush the edges with the egg mixture. Place the wontons in a baking pan. Bake for 12 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle the roasted red pepper on top. Serve warm.

Slice a medium onion in half. Put butter in a pan and melt over medium heat. Slice half of the onion and cook until softened. Mix onion and butter with 4 cups of flour. Add 2 cups of milk and stir until smooth. Stir in the remaining onion and 3 cups of hash brown potatoes. Mix in 1 1/2 cups of sharpc cheese. Transfer to a greased 11 x 7 inch pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 25 minutes.

Peel and chop the potatoes into large pieces. Put them in cold water to cover and soak for 20 minutes or so. Drain the potatoes and put them in a large pot of water with the onions and salt and pepper. Bring to a boil and cook for 10-15 minutes until the potatoes and onions are tender. Drain the potatoes and set aside. In the meantime, heat the olive oil in a frying pan and cook the potatoes and onions until they are browned. Transfer to an oven-safe casserole dish and sprinkle with the shredded cheddar. Bake in the preheated oven at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until the topping is browned and crisp. Serve immediately with eggs and toast.

Drain macaroni and place in a greased 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Place diced tomatoes on top of macaroni in baking dish. In a small bowl mix together salt and pepper and sprinkle over tomatoes and macaroni. In a small saucepan melt butter and pour over macaroni and tomatoes. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until cheese is melted and golden brown.

Prepare broccoli florets with the cut side down. Sprinkle with a little salt. Set aside. Heat stir-fry sauce with honey over high heat. Cook over medium heat until hot. Stir until sugar dissolves. Add vegetables. Cook 3 minutes. Add peanuts. Cook 1 minute. Stir until heated through. Serve vegetables over rice.

Cut the lemon into quarters lengthways. Remove the seeds with the help of a small spoon. Squeeze the juice from one of the quarters into a dish. Pour in the olive oil. Add the fish to the dish and sprinkle with salt, pepper and capers. Cover with cling film. Set in the fridge for 15 minutes. Arrange the fish on a serving dish with the juice from the rest of the lemon. Serve with rice or potatoes if desired.

Preheat oven to 350. Cook pasta to package directions. Drain and set aside. Melt Velveeta in skillet and add soup to it and heat thoroughly. Add tuna and mix thoroughly. Stir in the pasta and pour into casserole dish. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Cook the spinach in boiling water until wilted. Remove the spinach from the water, drain well, and cut into small pieces. In a large skillet over medium heat add olive oil. Add the minced garlic. When the garlic is fragrant add the spinach to the pan along with the white beans. Cook over medium heat until the spinach is tender. Cook the pasta until al dente, drain and mix with the spinach mixture. Add the vegetable broth to the pan until the spinach is very moist and the pasta is covered with the mixture. Add the pasta to the pan and stir until combined. Mix the Parmesan cheese with some of the broth and add to the pan. Stir until the cheese melts. Serve with additional Parmesan cheese if desired. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place pie crust into a 9-inch pie plate. In a 10-inch saute pan, saute onions and mushrooms until translucent. Add asparagus spears to pan and saute until crisp-tender. Remove from pan. In a mixing bowl combine asparagus mixture, eggs, milk and seasonings. Stir. Pour into pie crust. Top with bacon. Bake until puffy and lightly golden brown. About 45 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Prepare the turkey drumsticks by removing the meat from the bone. Season the meat with sea salt, black pepper, unsulphured molasses, red wine vinegar, ketchup, and worcestershire sauce. Lay the drumsticks on a baking sheet. In a small bowl, combine the red onion and coconut oil and mix together until combined. Spoon the mixture evenly over the drumsticks. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Transfer the drumsticks to an aluminum pan or cookie sheet to cool slightly before serving. Serve with your favorite dipping sauces or as is.
Combine all salad ingredients. Add vinaigrette to taste. Makes about 6 servings.
Mix white cake mix with diet sprite. Blend with egg whites. Add raspberry jello gelatin. Blend with boiling water. Pour into pan. Pour cool whip over the top. Sprinkle with flaked coconut.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). Prepare breading station by placing flour in a shallow bowl or pie plate. Beat eggs in a second shallow bowl or pie plate. Place breadcrumbs in a third shallow bowl or pie plate. Dip chicken in flour to coat evenly. Shake off excess flour. Dip chicken in egg wash. Dip chicken in breadcrumb mixture. Place chicken onto a nonstick baking sheet. Spray the chicken with cooking spray. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Serve immediately. Enjoy!

Beat the egg whites until stiff with an electric mixer. Gently fold in the egg yolks until combined. Add ranch salad dressing and continue folding until dressing is incorporated into the egg mixture. Heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the eggs until just set and lightly browned around the edges. Fold in the spicy brown mustard, fresh parsley, garlic powder and grated part-skim mozzarella cheese. Serve immediately. Serves 6 to 8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease an 8 x 8 inch baking dish. Sift together flour, breadcrumbs, cinnamon, ground hazelnuts and salt. Combine honey, eggs and lemon peel. Add honey mixture to dry ingredients. Stir to combine. Add carrots, ginger and cream cheese. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed until smooth. Pour into baking dish. Bake for 1 hour. Cool to room temperature. Serve with fresh fruit.

Combine all of the ingredients except the avocados in a food processor. Blend until smooth. Serve with the avocado on top. Note that if you want to make the guacamole ahead of time, you will need to reserve 1/2 cup of the peas. You can do this by draining the liquid from the peas, reserving 1/2 cup of the liquid. You can also use the liquid to make another dish. Add the peas to the blender with the other guacamole ingredients. Blend until smooth.

In a small saucepan cook the diced onion in the oil over moderately low heat until softened. Add the ricestir to coat. Add the orange juice. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook the rice until tender. Drain the rice in a sieve set over a bowl. Transfer to a large bowl. Set aside. In a small bowl stir together the cinnamon, the dried thyme, the dried parsley and the salt. In a medium saucepan, melt the butter. Add the chicken breasts and cook over moderately low heat until done. Add the orange juice mixture to the ricetoss to coat. Add the chicken. Stir in the ginger. Sprinkle the cinnamon mixture over the rice. Toss to coat. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375. Rub pork chops with olive oil. Add wine to pan and bring to boil. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes. Turn heat to low and add honey and mustard. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Turn off heat and remove from pan. Pour honey mustard mixture over the chops and place in an oven safe pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until done. Serve with rice or mashed potatoes.

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mustard to the skillet, stirring constantly. Cook until the mustard is blended in. Add the honey to the skillet. Cook until smooth. Add the pecans to the skillet and stir until pecans are coated. Remove from heat. Stir in the parsley. Sprinkle the bread crumbs in the skillet. Stir to combine. Add salt and pepper. Mix in the tilapia fillets. Cover skillet and cook on low heat for about 10-15 minutes. Stir occasionally. Check fish to make sure it is cooked through. Serve hot.

Mix orange juice with orange peel and garlic in a medium saucepan over low heat until garlic is softened but not browned. Add ginger and cook for 1 minute more, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in the vegetable oil and flour until smooth. Stir in the tilapia and season with salt and pepper. Transfer the mixture into a 1-quart casserole dish or a 9-by-13-inch glass baking dish and bake for 20 minutes or until the fish is tender and flakes easily when tested with a fork. Stir in the green onions and serve with rice or pasta and a green salad.

Combine espresso powder and condensed milk in saucepan. Bring to boil and cook for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and add cream. Transfer to blender or food processor. Add cinnamon and blend until mixture is smooth. Add yogurt and blend. Transfer to freezer for 3 hours. Freeze figs for about 3 hours or until hardened. Slice figs and layer with ice cream mixture. Freeze for 6 hours. Enjoy. !
Slice avocados into 1/2-inch thick rounds. Place in medium bowl. Add onionscover with water. Let stand 10 minutes. Drain. Gently mix until well blended. Add remaining ingredients.

Place gelatin in large mixing bowl. Add boiling water. Stir until gelatin dissolves. Add cold water. Stir until gelatin dissolves. Add 1 cup of sugar-free cool whip. Stir until thoroughly blended. Divide into 4 serving glasses. Chill until firm.

Melt the butter and saute the onion until tender. Add cream of celery soup, milk and tomato. Cook and stir over low heat for 10 minutes. Stir in frankfurter until heated through. Cook noodles separately. Drain and add to the tomato mixture. Stir and heat for 2 minutes. Serve over noodles.

Cut bacon into strips. Fry bacon until brown. Set bacon aside. Cut tortillas into 6 strips. Place tortilla strips on top of bacon strips. Add cream cheese mixture. Add tomatoes and romaine lettuce to cover the top half. Roll up tightly and cut into 6 pieces. Wrap each pinwheel in plastic wrap and place in refrigerator until ready to serve.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook rigatoni until al dente according to package directions. Drain and return to pan over medium-high heat. Add white beans and tomatoesstir well to combine. Add sausage and heat through. Stir in asiagoseason with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer pasta to a 13 x 9-inch baking dishtop with cheese. Bake at 400 until melted and bubbly, about 25 minutes.
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Whisk until combined. Drizzle over asparagus and shallot. Toss. Serve immediately.

Remove any excess fat from the outside of the chicken breasts. Slice the tops off the garlic cloves and rub the rosemary inside the cuts. Place the cloves and the rosemary inside the cavity of the chicken. Combine the olive oil and the McCormick Grill Seasoning. Place the chicken skin side down into the oil. Bake the chicken at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for about 20 minutes or until the juices run clear. Brush the outside of the chicken with the lemon juice. In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice with the dry white wine. Bake the chicken for about another 10 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Transfer the chicken to a serving dish. Pour the liquid into a small saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil and reduce until thickened. Remove from the heat and serve with the chicken.

Wash the brussels sprouts by running them under cold water. Remove the outer leaves and halve them lengthwise. Remove the core in the center with the tip of a paring knife or your fingers. Slice them into half-inch pieces. Cut the green beans into thirds lengthwise or into thirds widthwise if they are longer than one inch thick. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat with olive oil until hot. Add the brussels sprouts and stir to coat with the oil. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes, or until the brussels sprouts start to brown slightly on the edges and the bottom is nicely browned, stirring occasionally. Add the green beans and garlic and cook until the beans start to soften, 5 to 7 minutes or so depending on their size. Add the balsamic vinegar and stir to coat the beans with it. Cook for another 2 minutes. Add the salt and pepper to taste to the beans. Cook for another minute or so until they are heated through and the liquid has thickened slightly. Remove from the heat and serve hot with some toasted bread for dipping

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Spray or grease 9x13 inch baking dish. Mix breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, paprika, thyme, garlic salt, red pepper flakes. Add 3/4 cup buttermilk. Dip each breast half into buttermilk mixture. Dip each breast half into breadcrumb mixture. Arrange in baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until done. Serves 4.

In a heavy skillet melt butter over medium heat. Add shallots, mushrooms, wine and lemon juice stirring to prevent scorching. Cook for 5 minutes until tender. Add artichokes, chives, pimiento and parsleycook for 5 minutes more until heated through. Meanwhile cook shrimp in a large skillet of boiling water until pink and firm 1-2 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Add shrimp to artichoke mixture stirring to mix in with heated artichoke mixture. Serve immediately.

Mix water, yeast, salt & dry milk together. Add to flour mixture & mix well. Turn onto floured surface & knead 10-15 minutes or until smooth & elastic. Place into greased bowl & cover with plastic wrap & let rise until doubled (about 1 hour). Punch down & shape into rolls or buns (or pound into 2x2x1-inch squares if you want to freeze them). Let rise again for about 30 minutes & bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
Combine chicken and hard-boiled eggs in medium bowl. Stir in celery, onion, relish and mayonnaise. Stir in salt and pepper and fold in parsley.

Bring water and instant coffee granules to a boil in a small saucepan. Pour into a large bowl and stir in tomato sauce. Add vinegar and stir. Stir in worcestershire sauce and brown sugar. Add pepper and stir. Put butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Cook until melted. Stir into tomato mixture and refrigerate.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. In a separate bowl combine the milk, egg, butter, almond extract and plum. Mix the dry ingredients with the wet ingredients until just combined. Spoon the batter into the muffin cups. Bake the muffins for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool in the pan for a few minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Boil kale in a pan for a few minutes. Drain the kale. Peel potatoes. Boil potatoes in a pot of water for 20 minutes. Drain the potatoes. Put the potatoes in a blender with the kale, chicken broth, butter, salt, and garlic powder. Blend until smooth. Add the Parmesan cheese. Transfer to a bowl. Serve.

Brown beef and sausage in a little olive oil in a large saucepan, stirring frequently over medium heat. Drain off excess grease. Add onion, green pepper and garlic. Saute for 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Add beans and potatoes. Add enough broth to almost cover meat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer for 1 hour or until beef is tender. Add basil just before serving if desired.

Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Place green beans into a small bowl of ice water to stop cooking. Remove the leaves from the asparagus spears. Brush chicken with olive oil. Add chicken to the skillet over medium heat. Cook until lightly browned and cooked through. Remove chicken from the skillet. Stir in garlic. Cook until fragrant. Add green beans to skillet. Cook until crisp tender. Add asparagus spears. Cook until crisp tender. Add tomatoes. Cook until lightly browned. Add chicken back to skillet with vegetables. Add basil. Stir in remaining ingredients. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.
Whisk eggs until blended. Stir in milk, ham, chives ortega chiles and seasoning. Pour mixture into a baking dish. Top with cheese. Bake at 350F for approximately 25 minutes or until eggs are set.
Bring chicken broth and water to boil and add grits. Boil grits and stir until thickened. Add bacon and diced tomatoes. Stir and serve.

Combine all the ingredients and whisk until smooth. Taste and adjust seasonings if necessary. If you find it too thin, add more sugar and if too thick add more vinegar or water until it reaches the consistency you prefer.

Roll the pastry out to about 3mm thick and use this to line the bottom of an 8 inch diameter pie dish. Prick the base with a fork several times. Cover with foil and chill until firm. Meanwhile make the filling by mixing together the fruit and butter. Reserve 40g of the mixture for the filling and combine the rest with the sugar and lemon juice. Spread this mixture on the pastry base and top with the reserved fruit. Roll the pastry out once again and use this to cut out 8 large rounds of pastry. Place these over the top of the filling and press the edges together. Brush with egg and sprinkle with icing sugar. Bake in a preheated 200C/400F/Gas 6 oven for 45 minutes until the pastry is golden and the filling is bubbling. Serve warm with cream or ice cream.

Boil the potatoes until very tender. Drain the potatoes and peel off the skins. Cut the potatoes into 1/2 inch thick slices. Mix together the thyme and cumin. Put the potato slices into a shallow bowl. Coat the potato slices with the herb mixture. Coat with the all purpose flour. Shake off any excess. In a large skillet heat the cooking spray over medium heat. Add the potato slices and saute until lightly browned on both sides. Remove the potato slices from the skillet and drain on paper towels. Place a large serving platter on a large serving platter. Put the potato slices on the platter. Melt the butter in the skillet and drizzle the melted butter over the potato slices. Serve warm.

Brown hamburger and onions until cooked and drain fat. Add water to pan and stir to mix hamburger and onions. Add taco seasoning mix and water and bring to a boil. Cook and stir until thickened. Add tomato paste and stir. Stir in taco chips and heat through. Top with shredded cheddar cheese and serve immediately.

Melt 1/2 cup butter in large saucepan over medium heatadd onion and bell peppercook 8 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes and garlicbring to boil over medium-high heatcook 5 minutes or until reduced to 3 cups (discard tomato skins). Stir in flourcook 1 minute or until thickened. Stir in broth and bring to boilcook 1 minute or until thickened and bubbly. Stir in milk and cook 2 minutes or until thickened. Season gravy to taste with salt & pepper.

Wash and slice rhubarb into thin slices and add to large bowl. Add water and sugar and bring to boil over high heat stirring frequently until rhubarb is tender. Drain rhubarb and discard water and sugar. Place rhubarb back into large bowl and add sugar-free raspberry gelatin and stir until dissolved. Add lite evaporated milk and stir until sugar is dissolved. Pour into a shallow dish and refrigerate until set. Rhubarb fool will keep refrigerated until used up.

Cook macaroni in boiling salted water according to package instructions. Drain and place in 11x7 inch casserole dish. Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heatadd flour and cook, stirring constantly, until mixture begins to bubblegradually add evaporated milk, stirring constantly. Bring to boilcook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Reduce heatstir in cheese soup. Cook and stir until cheese is meltedpour over macaroni. Sprinkle with paprikabake at 350f for 30-40 minutes. Top with shredded cheddar cheesebake an additional 10 minutes until cheese is melted and golden brown.

Combine the yogurt with the cucumber and mint in a large bowl. Season with the salt, pepper and cumin. Drizzle the vinegar over the salad. Sprinkle the paprika over the salad. Mix well and taste for seasoning. Serve immediately or cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for up to 2 days.

Fill a large saucepan two-thirds full with water. Bring to a boil. Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine the leek soup mix and milkstir well. Add the chickenstir until completely coated with the liquid mixture. Add the broccoli florets and cook, uncovered, for about 10 minutes or until the broccoli is crisp-tender and the chicken is done. Stir in the cheese and diced red pepper. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Drain and serve over rice.

Rinse fish fillet under cold running water and pat dry with paper towel. Cut slits in fish fillet to prevent it from curling up while baking in the oven. Place fillet onto a foil-lined baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. Season with fresh ground black pepper and shallot. Top with cherry tomatoes, olives, capers, fresh oregano and a squeeze of balsamic vinegar. Place in preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until fish is opaque throughout.

Combine the yogurt with the mustard, garlic and the ground ginger in a large bowl. Stir in salt and pepper until well blended. Add the chicken breasts. Turn the chicken to coat both sides with the yogurt mixture. Marinate at room temperature for 2 hours or in the refrigerator for 6 hours before cooking. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place the chicken in an oiled 13 by 9 inch (33 by 23 cm) glass baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper, if desired. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 35-45 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and juices run clear. Serve with your favorite vegetable or salad.

Preheat the oven to 375 f. Slice the sweet potatoes into 1 inch thick discs and place on a cookie sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for about one hour until soft and tender. While the potatoes are cooking, prepare the onions. Remove the green tops from the onion and thinly slice it into rings and place it in the bottom of a shallow dish or saute pan. Drizzle with oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat for about 15 minutes until the onion is tender and starting to caramelize. Remove from the pan and place on a paper towel to drain any excess oil and allow it cool for about 10 minutes. While the onion is cooling, mash up the potatoes with a fork and mix with the sour cream and the salt and pepper. Once the onion is cool, mix it in with the potatoes and place in individual servings. Top the potato mixture with the caramelized onions and serve warm.

Cream together the cream cheese and the other ingredients except for the tuna. When combined, add the tuna and combine until the tuna is coated with the cream mixture. Serve in a small crock dish or individual appetizer cups. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a large bowl, combine crushed pineapple, frozen blackberries, peach slices, yellow cake mix and pecans. In a large bowl, cream together sugar and butter until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Add to the fruit mixture. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 baking dish. Bake at 425 for 20-25 minutes until the top of the crumble is golden brown. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

Toast muffins under broiler until light brown on top. Place on plate or serving plate. Add canadian bacon or ham and sprinkle with cheese. Beat eggs with milk and season with black pepper and cayenne pepper to taste. Pour egg mixture over bacon and cheese on toasts. Top with hollandaise sauce. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add fresh sage and minced garliccook and stir 1 minute. Add the potato and 3 cups of the brothbring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook 3 minutes or until potato is tenderstir in the remaining broth and 1 tablespoon of the parsley. Sprinkle with the seasoningtop with the chicken. Cover and cook 6 minutes or until the chicken is doneremove the cover and sprinkle with the remaining parsley.

Boil potatoes until tenderdrain and cool slightly. Meanwhile, melt butter in saucepanstir in flour and cook over low heat until bubbly and blended. Gradually add milk, stirring constantly. Bring to boilcook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened and bubbly. Stir in paprika, salt and pepper. Add potatoes and cook and stir for 2 minutes more or until heated through. Stir in cheesecook and stir until cheese is melted.

Melt butter in pan over medium heat and add flour and stir constantly with wooden spoon for 3 minutes. Gradually stir in milk and cook and stir constantly for 2 more minutes. Remove from heat and stir in sugar and salt and pepper and stir in sour cream. Place drained green beans and onions and corn flakes in baking dish and pour over sauce and sprinkle with Swiss cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes.

Cut bread into quarters or sixths. Spread one half with hot pepper jellytop with hamthen cheesethen eggthen breadthen top with other halfthen brush with eggthen spoon with milkthen sprinkle with hot saucethen brush with butterthen place on greased cookie sheetthen bake at 375 for 10-12 minutes or till bread is brown. Serve with salad or potato chipsgreat for brunch!

Combine chicken breasts and celery in a large bowl. Stir in red bell peppers. Sprinkle with dry ranch dressing mix. Add mayonnaise to taste. Cover and chill 2 hours. Serve on lettuce leaves. Yield: 8 servings.
Stuff mushroom caps with sausage mixture. Place in an oven preheated to 350 degrees f. Bake for approximately 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve with a salad or vegetable.

In a saucepan, combine sugar and water. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir until mixture reaches hard-ball stage on a candy thermometer or 244 degrees F (118 degrees C). Remove from the heat. Gradually stir in peanut butter. Cool slightly. Pour into a shallow pan. Freeze until firm. Melt ice cream according to package directions. Stir in peanut butter mixture. Pour into a blender. Add ice and blend until smooth. Pour over peanut butter mixture in pan. Sprinkle with salted peanuts. Freeze until firm. Let stand at room temperature 10 minutes before serving.

Mix together mashed potatoes, sugar, evaporated milk, eggs, vanilla, butter until well blended. Spread into a greased baking dish. Sprinkle with coconut flakes, walnuts or pecan pieces, brown sugar, flour (optional). Bake at 450 for about 20 minutes. Yields 6 servings.

Bring 2 1/2 cups water to boil. Add couscous. Remove from heat and cover. Let stand 5 minutes. Drain. Stir in fruit. Let stand 20 minutes. Stir in honey. Cook over medium heat 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in heavy cream. Cook 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in vanilla and cinnamon. Serve.

Add pastina and milk into a medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Stirring occasionally. Once it boils, add the eggs and stir. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cook until pasta is tender and eggs are soft. Serve sprinkled with Parmigiano-Reggiano and black pepper.

Preheat the oven to 200 degrees. Place the steak in a large shallow roasting tin. Season with salt and pepper. Cook in the oven for 1 hour. While the steak is cooking make the sweet potato mash. Peel and chop the sweet potato into even-sized chunks and place in a large saucepan. Cover with water and add a pinch of salt. Cook until tender. Drain and mash the sweet potato. Mix in the oil and chili sauce and season to taste with salt and pepper. Remove the steak from the oven. Serve with the sweet potato mash. Spoon the mash onto the plate and place the steak on top. Drizzle with some of the lemon juice and sprinkle with parsley. Serve.

Toast rolls until lightly brownedset aside. Place ham in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook, turning once or twice until browned on all sides and just cooked through in the center (about 4-5 minutes). Transfer to a cutting board and let cool slightly. Finely dice ham and set aside. Cut cheese into small dice and set aside. In a small bowl or measuring cup combine cream cheese and butterstir until smooth. In a large bowl combine cream cheese mixture and worcestershire saucestir until smooth and well combined. Add ham and chopped parsleystir until well combined. Spread onto rolls and sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese and dried onion flakesserve immediately.

Heat large skillet over medium heat. Add butter. Add green peppers onions olives mushrooms. Cook 5 minutes stirring frequently. Add sauce. Cook 5 minutes stirring frequently. Stir in pepperoni. Cook 3 minutes. Add cheeses. Cook 1 minute. Stir in cooked biscuits. Top pizza with parmesan cheese. Bake at 400 degrees 15 to 18 minutes.

In large skillet, brown ground beef and onions in oil for about 10 minutes or until cooked through. Drain. Stir in tomato sauce and rice until all of the rice is coated. In individual pepper halves, fill peppers with the meat mixture and top with cheese. Bake unstuffed peppers for about 15 minutes or until cheese is browned and bubbly.

Prepare yellow cake mix according to package directions using vegetable oil and eggs. Fold coffee liqueur and coffee into the cake batter and pour into prepared bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about 60 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for about 30 minutes and then remove the cake from the pan and allow it to cool completely on wire rack. To prepare the pudding mixture, combine the instant pudding mix and strong black coffee into a small bowl and stir until blended and thickened. Fold the pudding mixture into the cake batter and fold in powdered sugar until combined and the sugar is evenly distributed throughout the cake batter. Pour cake batter into prepared bundt pan and bake for about 60 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow the cake to cool for about 30 minutes and remove the cake from the pan and allow it to cool completely on wire rack. Pour the hot coffee into a small sauce pan and add the cocoa and stir until the cocoa is dissolved and

In a medium saucepan, place ham hock in water. Add salt and pepper and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook for about 30 minutes or until meat is tender. Stir in beans and onions and cook for 20 minutes or until beans are tender. Stir in garlic clove and cook for 2 minutes more or until garlic is soft and slightly browned.

Cut avocados in half and scoop out the insides of each half. Put the avocado insides in a bowl and mash with a fork or potato masher until chunky and smooth. Stir in tomatillos, onions, tomatoes and lime juice. Stir in hot sauce and red pepper flakes. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve with tortilla chips or on crackers or baguette slices. Makes about 4 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x9 inch baking dish. In a large mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, nutmeg, and mix well. Stir in mashed bananas, butter, eggs, sugar, and vanilla extract until well blendedfold in chocolate chips. Pour batter into prepared baking dish. Bake in preheated oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until setcool completely. Cut into squares before serving.

Spread crescent rolls with miracle whip. Sprinkle with lemon juice and pepper. Add cheese and crabmeat. Sprinkle with green onion and parsley. Roll up and cut into 24 squares. Bake at 375 degrees for 12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Combine panko breadcrumbs and parmesan in a shallow bowl. Drizzle with the butter and mix until well combined. Season flounder with salt and pepper. Coat both sides of the flounder fillets with the breadcrumb mixture. Place fillets in a lightly greased 9x13 baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes or until flaky and golden brown. Serve with a side of tartar sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 1 1/2 quart baking dish. In a medium bowl whisk together the brown sugar and flour. Make a well in the center and add the eggs. Using a fork beat the eggs until they are blended. Add the salt and milk and continue to beat until combined. Stir in vanilla extract. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish and place in the preheated oven for 1 hour or until set. Allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving. Store in refrigerator for up to 2 days. Reheat before serving.

Bring water to boil. Salt the water and add spaghetti. Cook spaghetti until al dente. Drain and place in a bowl. Add extra virgin olive oil and stir. Add crushed garlic cloves and stir. Add red hot chili peppers and parsley. Stir and serve.

Pat chicken dry with paper towels. Season with salt and pepper. Lay out chicken and rosemary in a single layer on a rimmed cookie sheet. Drizzle with marmalade and vinegar. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Bake uncovered for about 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Let stand for a few minutes before serving.

Bring water and potatoes to boil. Cook until tender. Drain. Melt the butter. Add potatoes and mix. Add the watercress and peas and mix well. Add the corn and mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Cook potatoes according to package directions. Drain potatoes, then return to pot. Add in pepper jack cheese, garlic powder, baby spinach and low fat chicken broth. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until spinach wilts. Mix well.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all the ingredients in a bowl with your hands until well mixed. Pour into a greased 9x13 pan or 2 greased 9x9 pans. Bake 30 minutes or until done. For icing, combine 1/4 cup milk with 1/2 cup powdered sugar and 1 tbsp mayonnaise.

In a large pot heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and carrot. Cook for about five minutes or until softened. Add the garlic and cook for an additional minute or two. Add the dried split peas and water. Bring the mixture to a boil and then reduce the heat and simmer for about an hour or so or until the peas are very tender (you may need to add more water if the mixture becomes too thick). Add the turkey ham and dried marjoram and cook for a few minutes more. Remove from the heat and let it cool for a bit. When cooled, add the mixture to a food processor and puree it into a smooth soup consistency. Add salt and pepper and serve warm or at room temperature. Serve with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkling of dill or parsley if desired.

Combine ground beef, kosher salt, and ground pepper in large bowlmix with hands until combined. Divide meat mixture into 4 patties and place on medium-high grillgrill 4 to 5 minutes per side or until patties reach desired doneness. To assemble burgers, place buns on grill or toaster oven until lightly toasted. Top each burger with a slice of mozzarella cheeseclose grill or toaster oven to melt cheese on each burger. Place french fries on bunstop with burgers and drizzle with chicken gravy. To make caramelized onion, heat oil over medium heat in large skillet until hotadd onioncook 5 minutes or until onion is soft and begins to turn golden brown in spotsremove from heatset aside. (Can be made 2 days aheadcover with plastic wrapchill.)
