Slice the peaches into a 4 qt slow cooker. Add water and all the other ingredients. Set the crock pot to high and cook for 3 hours. Allow to cool. Spoon the peach mixture into a 1 qt canning jar. Cover and refrigerate for up to a week.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease a 9 x 5 loaf pan with Crisco. In a small bowl, whisk together the flour, cornstarch, and salt. Set aside. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream the butter with the Crisco until creamy and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula after each addition. Add the sugars and beat until creamy, about 2 minutes more. Add the flour mixture in three additions alternating with the milk and mix just until combined. Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula to make sure the batter is smooth. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for one hour or until a cake tester comes out clean when inserted into the center. Transfer the pan to a wire rack to cool for 5 minutes before unmolding onto the rack to cool completely.

1. Cook spinach until just wilted, drain well. 2. Cut kiwi into thin slices. Cut strawberries into quarters. 3. Mix spinach and strawberries. Sprinkle poppy seeds and feta cheese. 4. Sprinkle chicken breast with lemon juice and pepper. Grill or broil chicken breasts until done. 5. Arrange spinach on platter. Top with grilled chicken breast. Garnish with kiwi slices. Serve with vinaigrette dressing. 6. Combine sour cream and mayonnaise. Mix in lemon juice and pepper. 7. Mix together. Serve on top of spinach. 8. Arrange red onion rings on top. Garnish with slivered almonds.
Mix seasoning mix with pork tenderloin and rub well. Place tenderloin on baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for about 1 hour.

Preheat a large skillet over medium heat until hot. Add the bell peppers and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Remove the bell peppers to a plate with a slotted spoon. Increase the heat to high. Place the brats in the skillet and cook for 3-5 minutes until browned. Pour off any accumulated fat from the brats into a small bowl. Increase the heat to high again and add the remaining bell peppers to the skillet with the brats and stir until the brats are evenly coated with the bell peppers. Stir in the paprika and caraway seed and cook until the brats are heated through, about 2 minutes longer. Serve immediately with mustard.

Slice boneless chicken breasts into 1/2-inch cubes. Cook in 2-quart saucepan with olive oil and onion. Add carrots and cauliflower florets. Cook for 5 minutes. Add broth and dried herbs. Bring to a boil, cover and reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 15 minutes or until pasta is tender and vegetables are soft. Add salt and pepper to taste. Remove bay leaf before serving. If desired, sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

Heat oil and whole cumin seeds in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute until cumin seeds sizzle and change color slightly. Add garlic and saute until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add onion and saute until translucent and golden, about 4 minutes more. Add green lentils and 3 cups water. Bring to a boil and simmer 30 to 35 minutes until tender and flavors are well blended. Season with salt and cayenne. Serve hot with basmati rice.

Cook macaroni until tender, drain. Cool. Combine ham, celery, red onion, mayonnaise, lime juice and honey. Chill. Fold ham mixture with the drained macaroni. Add cilantro. Toss. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve on lettuce leaves or on crackers.

Spray a 9x13 baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Cook chicken breast halves in a large skillet until done (cut open to check doneness). In a large bowl, combine the spinach, goat cheese, dijon mustard, and seasoned bread crumbs. Layer half the spinach mixture in the baking dish. Top with a chicken breast half. Next, layer the ham slices. Finally, add the remaining spinach mixture. Roll each chicken breast half up tightly to form a roll. Arrange each roll in the baking dish seam-side down. Cover with foil. Bake 45-50 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Uncover. Bake an additional 10-15 minutes or until baked through. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil. Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper to taste. Saute the chicken for 10 to 12 minutes or until juices run clear when pierced with a fork. Transfer chicken to a plate. Remove and discard any excess fat from the skillet. Add the olives and garlic and cook 1 minute or until fragrant, stirring constantly. Stir in the sherry and reduce until slightly thickened, about 1 minute. Stir in flour and cook 1 minute or until bubbly and thickened. Add chicken and any accumulated juices to the skillet with the flour mixturecook 1 minute more or until thickened and bubbly. Transfer to a platter and garnish with the thyme.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add gnocchi and cook according to package directions. Drain and keep warm. Meanwhile in a large skillet over medium heat, heat 2 tablespoons oil and saute the prosciutto until golden brown and crispy. Add the garlic and cook until softened. Add the fontina and parmesan cheese and heat until melted. Add the basil and season with freshly ground black pepper to taste. Place the gnocchi in shallow bowls and top with the prosciutto and cheese mixture. Add more cheese to taste.

Season chops with salt and pepper. Place margarine in the bottom of the casserole dish and place the seasoned pork chops on top. Sprinkle cinnamon and brown sugar over the pork chops and cover with the apples. Place casserole dish in the preheated oven and bake for 40 minutes or until the pork chops are cooked through. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the garlic and saute until it softens and turns golden brown, about 2 minutes. Stir in the rice and snow peas. Cook about 5 minutes or until the rice and snow peas are tender. Sprinkle with cilantro.
Melt butter in a sauce pan over medium heat. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Add milk and bring to a boil. Add cocoa and stir until thickened. Serve over biscuits. Serves eight to ten.

Place the sugar and water into a 4 cup measuring pitcher. In a 4 cup glass bowl place the vanilla extract and the ground cinnamon. Add to the sugar mixture in the pitcher and stir to combine. Add the soymilk and stir to combine. Strain through a fine mesh strainer to remove any large bits of cinnamon. Pour the soymilk mixture into a shallow pan. Add the slivered almonds. Place the mint sprig on the soymilk mixture. Freeze until partially frozen. Remove from freezer. Pour the soymilk mixture back into the bowl and stir vigorously with a wooden spoon to scrape the mixture from the sides of the bowl and to break up large ice crystals. Pour mixture into a blender. Add the slivered almonds. Blend until the mixture is completely smooth. Pour the mixture into a 4 cup glass bowl and place in the freezer. Once the mixture is completely frozen and has a granita texture, scoop the granita into a serving dish and enjoy.

Preheat the oven to 400 degree celcius. Combine the cornmeal, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and add the yogurt and creamed corn. Gradually beat the dry mixture into the liquid. Pour the batter into a greased baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes or until a tester inserted into the center comes out clean. Serve warm. Serves four.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a medium bowl combine flour and the baking powder and baking soda. Stir in the cinnamon. In a large bowl beat the egg whites until soft peaks form. Gradually beat in the applesauce. Fold in the flour mixture. Stir in the bananas and vanilla. Grease a loaf pan. Pour batter into the pan. Bake at 350 degrees f for 1 hour. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing from pan. Cool completely before frosting. To make frosting: combine the confectioners' sugar and butter. Beat until fluffy and spread over the top and sides of the loaf.

Melt the baking chocolate in the microwave. Set aside to cool slightly. In a large bowl, beat the butter with an electric mixer until fluffy. Add sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time and beat until combined. Stir in vanilla. Beat in the cooled chocolate. Stir in the flour until combined. Stir in the nuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto un-greased baking sheet. Bake in preheated 375 degree oven for 15 minutes. Let stand 3 minutes. Remove from baking sheet to wire rack. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

In large crock pot combine dried italian seasoning, salt and pepper. Add potatoes and onions. Mix well. Add boneless pork chops and apples. Add frozen peas. Add frozen kielbasa and frozen sauerkraut. Pour 1/2 cup white wine. Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours. Serve pork chops on buns with the choucroute garni on the side.

With electric mixer, beat cream cheese and sugar until blended. Add vanilla and pecans. Mix in the mini chocolate chip and graham crackers. Form into 1 ball. Wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate. Unwrap. Dip in powdered sugar. Roll in chopped pecans.

Peel sweet potatoes (if desired) and cut into bite-sized pieces. Add sweet potatoes to a pot with the apple pie filling. Cover and simmer over medium heat for 10 minutes or until tender. Add golden raisins, pecans, sugar and apple pie spice to the sweet potatoes. Mix well. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream if desired.

Put all the ingredients except the water in a blender or food processor and process until combined. If it is too thick, add the water a bit at a time to thin it down until desired consistency. Serve with grilled fish or other seafood or as an accompaniment to soups or stews. It also makes a great topping for tacos or a nacho-like appetizer with tortilla chips or toasted baguette slices. :

In a bowl mix together all the corn kernels and the fish sauce. Add the crushed red peppers and the shallots. Mix everything well. In a separate bowl beat the egg with a fork. Add in the cornflour. Mix well. Add in the corn mixture. Mix well. Scoop out about 2 tablespoons of the mixture and shape it into a patty. Repeat with the remaining corn mixture. Place the patties on a plate and then in a cold pan. Pour enough oil in the pan to cover the bottom of the pan. Heat the oil over medium heat. Once the oil is heated place the patties in the pan. Fry the patties for about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove from pan and place on a plate. Sprinkle with crushed red peppers. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heatcook onion in oil 3 minutes or until tender but not brown, stirring frequently. Stir in garliccook 1 minute or until fragrant. Stir in ground turkeycook 8-10 minutes or until turkey is cooked through and no longer pink, stirring frequently. Stir in pasta sauce, sweet cornreduce heat to lowcook 5-7 minutes or until heated through. Stir in pastacook 2-3 minutes longer or until heated through. Stir in seasoningserve.

To make the tea, steep 3 to 4 tea bags in boiling water for 5 to 10 minutes. Add unsweetened cranberry juice. Serve with brown sugar for sweetening. For the punch, combine the apple cider with the tea. Add brown sugar to taste. Slice orange into wedges. Stir in ginger and cinnamon sticks. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil and place the sweet potatoes cut side down on the baking sheet. Roast for 35 to 40 minutes until the sweet potato is tender and the skin is dark brown. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool slightly. Peel the skin and discard the skin and the ends of the sweet potato. Cut the sweet potato in half lengthwise and then into 1 inch cubes and place the sweet potato cubes onto a platter or serving dish. In a small bowl, combine the orange marmalade and dijon mustard and whisk until smooth. Add the orange marmalade mixture to a large saucepan and whisk in the maple syrup, orange juice and salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for 3 minutes. Pour the glaze over the sweet potatoes and gently toss to coat the sweet potatoes and let them sit for 15 minutes. In a small bowl

In a large soup pot combine the chicken broth with the rice. Bring to boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to simmer and cook, covered for about 20 minutes or until the rice is tender. Meanwhile, melt the 1 tablespoon of the butter in a small skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the carrot, celery and onion for about 5 minutes or until softened and golden brown around the edges. Stir into the chicken broth mixture with the chicken. Stir in the remaining tablespoon of butter. Season with the salt and pepper. Serve.

Preheat oven to 450f. In a shallow baking pan combine all glaze ingredients except pork chops. Place pork chops in panbake 25 minutes turning once. Remove from oven, transfer to serving platter and serve hot with honey-glaze sauce over the top.

Place the pineapple ring in a bowl. Add the lime jello gelatin to 1/2 cup of cold water. Stir and let stand for 2 minutes. Add the pineapple water and mix until gelatin is dissolved. Stir in the cold water and pineapple juice. Chill and serve with the pineapple ring and fruit.

Sift together the flour and baking powder and set aside. Cut the green chili peppers into small dice. Place the chilies in the blender with the garlic cloves and blend into a paste. With an electric mixer, beat the butter until soft and fluffy, then add the garlic/green chili mixture and blend until smooth. Add the flour mixture and beat until combined. Beat in the whipping cream and cayenne pepper until blended. Divide the dough into four pieces and roll into balls that are approximately one and one-half inches in diameter. Place the dough balls on an ungreased baking sheet and bake at 425 degrees for approximately five minutes until golden brown. Let cool for one minute, then remove from the baking sheet to cool completely on a wire rack. Serve warm with preserves or whipping cream for dipping.

Wash and clean beets. Boil beets until tender. Drain and cool. Cut beets into cubes. Melt butter in a large skillet. Add onions and cook until golden. Add beets and cook until tender. Sprinkle sugar and vinegar over beets. Cook until sugar melts and beets absorb liquid. Add salt and pepper. Toss. Serve warm or cold.

Bring vegetable broth to a boil, add diced onion and red bell pepper. Once the onion and peppers are tender, add brown lentils. Continue cooking for approximately 20 minutes or until lentils are tender and a little mushy. Once the lentils are tender, drain excess liquid out of the pan. Remove from heat and stir in grated monterey jack cheese. If desired, sprinkle some red pepper flakes on top of the cheese to taste. Serve with your favorite chips or crackers as an appetizer or snack.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Melt the butter in a medium-sized pot. Add the onions and cook over low heat until they begin to turn translucent. Add the garlic cloves, the bay leaf, the black peppercorns, the whole cloves and the sea salt. Continue cooking over low heat for about 15 minutes. The onions should be soft. Stir every now and again. When the onions are soft, add the puff pastry. Mix well and cook for a few minutes. Transfer the onion mixture into a pie dish. The filling should cover the bottom of the dish. Put a piece of parchment paper on top of the filling. Then place a round of puff pastry on top of the filling. Bake the pie for 15 minutes. Then remove the top piece of pastry. Sprinkle the cheese over the top of the filling. Return to the oven for 5 minutes. Remove from the oven. Leave the pie to cool for a few minutes before cutting into it. Sprinkle with thyme just before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a 3 quart casserole, combine hot water, stuffing mix, and one of the chicken breasts. Sprinkle with salt & pepper to taste. Add condensed cream of chicken soup to casserole mixture. Cover with remaining breast of chicken and sour creamsprinkle with cheese and top with vegetables (peas & carrots). Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until heated through. Serve over rice if desired.
Put soba noodles into a large bowl. Pour sauce over the noodles. Toss to coat. Taste and add additional chili oil if you want it hotter. Sprinkle with green onion. Serve immediately.
Combine all the ingredients in a medium size bowl and mix together gently. Cover and refrigerate for 1/2 hour before serving. Serve cold or at room temp. Serves 4-6.

Cream the butter and unsweetened applesauce together until fluffy. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well with an electric mixer. Drop by spoonful onto cookie sheet and bake at 325 degrees for about 12-14 minutes until they are lightly browned at the edges and slightly cracked at the centre. Cool cookies before removing from cookie sheet.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place the onions in a large bowl and add the olive oil, garlic, tomato sauce, parsley, salt and pepper to taste. Add the halibut steaks to the mixture and toss to coat. Arrange the halibut steaks on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray and place in the preheated oven. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.

Cook bow tie pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, in large saucepan, saute broccoli in olive oil until tender. Drain pasta and combine with broccoli. In small bowl, combine flour and milk. Add milk mixture to broccoli and cooked pasta. Stir in mustard and old cheddar. Cook over low heat until heated through. Place into serving bowls and top with crumbled old cheddar. Serve with steamed green beans.

Heat oil in wok over high heat until hot but not smoking. Stir in garlic, onion and shrimp. Cook until shrimp are pink and opaque, stirring occasionally and scraping bottom of wok with wooden spoon to remove browned bits. Stir in fish sauce and sugar and cook until sugar dissolves. Stir in rice and pineapple and cook until heated through. Garnish with green onions and serve immediately.

Rub chicken wings with hot pepper sauce and set aside for at least 30 minutes. Dry chicken wings on paper towel and cook in oil on medium-high heat for approximately 15 minutes turning frequently. Remove from oil and set aside. In a small bowl combine the melted butter, vinegar and ranch dressing mix. In a larger bowl combine the hot pepper sauce and the ranch dressing mixture. Toss the chicken wings in the sauce mixture and serve warm.

Melt margarine and mix with pretzel sticks. Pour raspberry jell-o gelatin over boiling water and stir until dissolved. Mix jello with pretzel mixture. Fold in cool whip and cream cheese. Add frozen raspberries and stir until well coated.

Mix 2 cups of boiling water with 2 cups of cold water. Stir in 1/2 cup of jello. Pour into 9 x 13 pan. Let cool. Refrigerate until set. Mix 3/4 cup of boiling water with 3/4 cup of cold water. Stir in 2 cups of red raspberries. Pour over jello layer. Refrigerate until set. Mix 3/4 cup of boiling water with 1/2 cup of cold water. Stir in 1/2 cup of jello. Pour over raspberries. Refrigerate until set. For a decorative touch, sprinkle chopped nuts over the top. Makes 8 servings.

Cook ravioli in boiling water according to directions on package. Drain well and set aside. In a large skillet, heat up some butter or olive oil and sautee onions and mushrooms until softened. Add in the beef and cook until brown all over. Season with salt and pepper. In a seperate saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add in flour and allow it to mix well. Pour in spaghetti sauce and mix well. Add in cooked ravioli and mix well. Pour in cheese and mix well. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve hot. Makes 8 servings.
Spread chive and onion cream cheese evenly over pita bread. Top with tuna and mild cheddar. Place in microwave and heat for 1 minute. Fold in half and serve.

Boil the spinach until it wilts. Drain the spinach well and then pour it into a large mixing bowl. Add the dashi, soy sauce, sake (if using) and sesame seeds. Stir the mixture with a fork or a spoon until it is well combined. The mixture will be slightly thick. Taste the dressing. You may want to add more soy sauce. Put the spinach into a serving dish. Drizzle the dressing over the spinach. Serve immediately.

Prepare a dough crust according to the pie crust recipe directions. Combine ground turkey and carrots and mix well together. Roll into 8 balls and flatten out into patties. Flatten out 4 balls and add a tablespoon of hash browns and form into patties. Flatten out the remaining 4 balls and add a tablespoon of hash browns and form into patties. Saute in butter until cooked through (about 5 minutes). Combine breadcrumbs, worcestershire sauce and garlic powder in a shallow bowl. Dip patties in egg and then into bread crumbs. Place into the prepared crust. Place remaining patties onto crust. Top with cheese and place into a 375f oven for 30 minutes until cheese is melted and crust is golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Grease cookie sheet or use nonstick baking paper. In a large mixing bowl beat egg yolks with a wire whisk until thick and pale yellow. Add sugar and vanilla extract. Stir in walnuts. In a separate bowl beat egg whites with a wire whisk until they form soft white peaks. Fold in walnuts and stir in lemon rind. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto baking sheets. Bake 20 to 25 minutes. Cool. Transfer to a cookie jar.

To prepare breadcrumbs, cut bread into slices and then cut into croutons in a food processor. Place croutons in a bowl and add the half-and-half and whirl again with a spoon until crumbs are crumbly. Put crumb mixture in a bowl and stir in dill. Place turkey in a bowl and add egg. Add dill-crumb mixture to turkey and mix well. Shape into patties about 2 inches thick. Place patties on wax paper and refrigerate for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Heat cooking oil in a skillet to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dip patties into flour, then egg whites, then crumb mixture to coat well. Fry patties until brown in both sides. Place cooked patties on a paper towel-lined platter.

Mix mayonnaise with honey and vinegar. Whisk in poppy seeds. In separate bowl, combine apples and cranberries and toss with dressing. In another bowl, combine cooked and cooled chicken with apple and cranberry mixture. Spread on rolls.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, cream butter and powdered sugar together. Add walnuts and vanilla extract and mix well. In a separate bowl combine the flour with the baking powder. Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet mixture and mix well. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 10-12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Slice onions thinly. Peel garlic cloves and smash them with the flat side of your knife. Place onions on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with brown sugar and salt. Roast onions until soft - about 30-40 minutes. Meanwhile, heat the butter in a pan over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the steak and season with pepper to taste. Cook until medium-rare (135 degrees). Transfer steak to plate and tent with foil to keep warm while you cook the onions. Add the vinegar to the pan and simmer over medium heat to reduce the sauce slightly - about 2 minutes. Spoon some sauce over the steak before serving with the onions on the side.

In a large skillet over medium-low heat, combine the bread, egg and garlic powder. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the bread is crumbly and the egg is cooked through. Add the ground pepper and cook for 1 minute. Add the beef and cook, breaking up any lumps with a wooden spoon, until the beef is no longer pink. Add the tomato paste and cook for 30 seconds. Stir in the sauce and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the parsley. Allow meatballs to cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together butter, cranberries and honey. Place bread in a 9x13 inch pan. In a bowl whisk together the eggs, sugar, vanilla and the milk. Stir in cranberry mixture. Pour mixture over bread. Bake for 20 minutes or until set. Serve with brie cheese.

Roll out crust and line pie pan with crust. Put in oven and bake 10 minutes. Heat butter in a large saucepan and melt over medium heat. Stir in flour and cook until a roux is formed, about one minute. Gradually stir in spinach and cook over medium heat until spinach is wilted and mixture has thickened, about two minutes. Stir in salt and pepper and remove from heat. Pour mixture into prepared pie crust and sprinkle cheese on top. Bake in preheated 375 degree F (190 degree C) oven for 30 minutes or until cheese is melted and golden brown on top. Let stand five minutes before serving.

Add vinegar to a small bowl. Add the mustard seeds and cover with water. Let soak for a few hours. In a food processor or blender puree the beer and mustard powder. Add the soaked mustard seeds to the beer and mustard mixture. Transfer to a jar and let sit at room temperature for at least 2 days before using. It is best when used within a week. The mustard will be very thick. It will thin out after sitting for a while. Stir before using. It can be stored in the refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 350. Line 12 muffin cups with paper liners. In large bowl, mix brownie mix with water. Blend applesauce with egg whites and add to brownie mixture. Pour into muffin cups. Bake 20 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pans. In large bowl, blend 1/2 cup light whipped topping with candy corn. Frost each cupcake. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 180c (fan) Grease and line a round cake tin with greaseproof paper and dust it with flour. In a large bowl whisk together flour and baking powder and set aside. In another bowl whisk eggs, then add sugar and beat until smooth and pale in colour. Add corn flour and whisk until combined then add egg mixture to flour mixture and fold in with a spatula until just combined. Pour batter into prepared tin and bake for about 35 minutes or until a skewer inserted comes out clean (mine took about 25 minutes). Cool cake in tin for about 5 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely (about 15 minutes). Serve with butter icing and a cup of tea!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Grease and flour an angel food cake pan. Beat eggs with sugar until light yellow with thick white ribbons forming when beater is lifted from batter. Mix flour with salt. Fold into eggs with orange juice, zest and rind. Fold in butter and pour into pan. Bake about 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool on wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar before serving if desired.

Peel and dice 1 medium yellow onion. Peel and cut 4 medium garlic cloves in half lengthwise. Finely chop 3 medium potatoes. Finely chop 1 head of cauliflower florets. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium soup pot over medium heat until hot. Add onions to soup potcook 5 minutes. Add garlic to soup potcook 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add diced potatoes to soup potcook 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add cauliflower to soup potcook 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add 3 cups low-sodium chicken broth to soup potbring to a boil. Add water to soup potbring to a boil. Add 1/2 teaspoon salt to soup potbring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-lowcook 10 minutes, stirring occasionally until cauliflower is tender. Discard bay leaf from soup pot. Add 1/2 teaspoon chopped chives to soup potcook 1 minute. Ladle soup into bowls

In a large stock pot, bring broth to a boil. Add corn. Reduce heat to a simmer. Add celery rib, carrot, onion and tomato. Simmer 15 minutes. Add cooked chicken. Season with salt and pepper. Cook an additional 20 minutes.

Stir together soy sauce, rice wine, brown sugar, cornstarch, vegetable oil and gingerroot. Stir well to dissolve cornstarch. Stir in garlic and heat to boiling. Boil 30 secondsremove from heat. Stir 1 cup of cold water into saucemix well. Place steak into a shallow dishpour sauce over steak. Cover with plastic wraprefrigerate 8 hours or overnight. Stir together cornstarch and remaining 1/4 cup cold wateradd to steak mixturecook over medium heat 10 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally. Drain snow peasplace into serving dish with steak mixturetoss to coat. Sprinkle with green onionsserve immediately.

Heat the butter in a large skillet. Add the onions and saute over medium heat until they are tender and translucent. Add the curry powder and stir until thoroughly mixed with the onions and the butter has melted. Add the chicken broth and stir until the broth has evaporated and the onions and curry have coated the bottom of the pan. Add the cooked chicken, rice and the seasoning. Stir until the seasoning has coated the chicken and rice. Transfer the mixture to a greased casserole dish and cover. Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees or until rice is tender and the mixture has thickened. Serve with toasted corn flake crumbs on the top.
Mix beef and onion together. Stir in spaghetti and tomato sauce. Add elbow macaroni and pepperoni. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

In a large skillet over medium heat, sauté eggplant with olive oil, garlic and salt. When eggplant is cooked, remove to bowl and keep warm. Add marinara sauce to pan and heat until bubbly. Add mozzarella cheese and stir until melted. Add chicken breast to pan and heat until cooked through. Remove from heat and add eggplant to pan. Stir and serve over rigatoni pasta with fresh basil on top.

Melt margarine over low heat in saucepan. Add powdered sugar, vanilla and flour all at once and mix until combined. Add walnutsmix until coated. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Allow to set for about 20 minutes.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add smoked sausage and cook until browned. Add water and barbecue saucebring to a simmer. Reduce heatsimmer until sauce thickens. Stir in honey. Top Hawaiian rolls with sausage and pour barbecue sauce over.

Place butter into a small bowl and melt over low heat until completely melted. Remove from heat. In a medium bowl, combine orange juice concentrate, chipotle chiles, molasses, salt, cilantro and corn. Stir to combine. Add butter to corn mixture and stir until corn is coated. Place corn onto a preheated grill (or grill pan). Grill for about 10 minutes or until corn is tender when pierced with a fork. Remove from grill. Transfer corn to serving dish. Pour glaze into a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer and cook until slightly thickened. Serve corn with glaze on the side.
Make pie crust by mixing all ingredients together. Roll out onto cookie sheet. Use to fill pie pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes. (This will make two pie crusts.)

Slice pineapple and peel. Remove skin from pineapple. Chop into small pieces and place in mixing bowl. Stir in eggs and sugar. Mix well. Add butter. Mix well. Add bread. Mix well. Spoon into greased 8 x 8 baking dish. Bake at 350 for 50 minutes. Serve warm.

Stir together shallots, white wine and lemon wedge. Bring to a boil and then remove from heat. Add sea scallops and mussels. Cook until mussels open. Drain and reserve liquid. Toss shrimp with butter and a little of the white wine cooking liquid. Add shrimp to sea scallops and mussels. Fill each scallop shell with a spoonful of the shrimp mixture and place on a baking sheet. Place mushrooms around each shell. Sprinkle with fresh ground pepper. Bake at 400 degrees f for 15 minutes. Sprinkle each scallop with basil. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Slice roma tomatoes. Sprinkle each slice with pesto sauce. Place a slice of green onion on each slice. Top each with a slice of mozzarella cheese. Roll up the tomatoes. Place a few cheese slices in a row. Place each tomato roll over the cheese slices. Place the tomato rolls in a greased 13x9 baking dish. Pour the remaining pesto sauce over the rolls. Bake in a 350 degree f oven for 10-12 minutes or until cheese is melted. Sprinkle parsley over the rolls.

Prepare the salsa according to package directions. In a small bowl stir together the sour cream and miracle whip. In a skillet over medium heat melt the butter. Add the sour cream mixture and stir to coat. Add the chicken and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes or until juices run clear. Remove from heat and transfer to a cutting board to cool. In a large skillet heat 1 tablespoon of the oil over medium heat. Add the flour tortillas and spread evenly in the skillet. Cook for 30 seconds or until lightly browned. Flip and repeat. Meanwhile in another skillet heat the remaining oil over medium heat. Add the chili powder and the tortillas and stir to coat. Cook for 30 seconds. Remove from the heat and arrange the tortillas in a single layer in the bottom of the skillet. Top the tortillas with the chicken and the four-cheese mexican blend cheese. Fold the tortillas over and place the quesadillas in the skillet. Cook over medium heat for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately. Ser

Combine apples, cranberries, sugar, oats, brown sugar, all-purpose flour, pecans in medium saucepan. Combine with water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Cook until thickened. Pour into greased 2 quart baking dish. In medium bowl mix together flour, brown sugar, all-purpose flour and cinnamon. Cut in butter. Sprinkle over fruit mixture. Bake at 450 degrees for 20 minutes. Serves four.

Slice halloumi into 4cm-thick slices. Grill the cheese slices for a few minutes until crisp. Meanwhile, cut the tomatoes in half lengthways. Combine the pesto and lemon juice. Heat the oil in a large pan. Add the tomato halves cut side down and cook for 2 minutes. Turn the tomatoes over and add the cheese slices. Cook for 2 minutes more and remove from the pan. Sprinkle the top of each stack with pine nuts and serve.

Cook sausage links in skillet over medium heat until brown. Drain. Meanwhile heat hash browns according to package directionsdrain and set aside. In a large nonstick skillet sprayed with cooking spray melt butter over medium-low heatstir in flour until smooth. Stir in milk until slightly thickened. Add cheddar cheese and stir until melted. Stir in sausage, hash browns and eggs until well blendedserve immediately.

Cube steaks to desired thickness. Place steaks in greased 13 x 9 x 2 baking dish. Place sliced potatoes, carrots, celery in foil packets. Place foil packets over steaks. Combine soup, milk and soup mix in a saucepan over low heat. Stir in flour to make paste. Pour over steaks. Cover dish with aluminum foil. Bake at 375 degrees for one hour or until steaks are tender. Serve over potatoes.

Slice strawberries and cantaloupe into bite-sized pieces. Place in a large bowl. Add rose water and toss to coat. Place in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour to let the flavors meld. Drizzle icing sugar over the fruit and serve.

Bring chicken stock to boil in large pot. Stir in celery and onions. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Add broccoli florets. Cover and cook 10 minutes longer. Add potatoes. Cover and cook 10 minutes more. Stir in half-and-half. Add thyme and seasonings. Cover and cook 10 more minutes. Stir in cheese. Cook 1 to 2 minutes until cheese melts. Garnish with additional thyme if desired. Makes 6 servings.

Mix biscuit mix with water. Press into a 9 inch square pan. Bake at 350 degrees until golden brown. Remove from oven. Make a layer of mushrooms on top of crust. Layer ground beef on top of mushrooms. Bake 15 minutes. Mix soup and soup mix together. Pour soup mixture over ground beef layer. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Place cream cheese and sugar in medium bowl and beat at high speed until well blended. Add milk and vanilla and mix well. Pour into crust. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until set. Remove plastic wrap and spread frozen whipped topping over top. Return to refrigerator until ready to serve. Serve with graham cracker crumbs.

Boil small potatoes (about 2 cups) until tender, drain and cool slightly. Dice tomato and add to potatoes. Stir together olive oil and picante sauce, then add mixture to potatoes and tomato. Toss with remaining ingredients and serve at room temperature. Serves about 6.

Drain & rinse the chickpeas. Put all of the remaining ingredients into a food processor. Pulse until smooth & creamy. Refrigerate for several hours before serving. This will allow the flavors to blend.

Blend rava with water to make a smooth batter. Add milk, sugar, ghee and green cardamoms to the batter. Cook on a low flame stirring continuously till it turns thick. Add saffron strands to this and mix well. Transfer it to a bowl. Add coconut flakes to the mixture. Pour this mixture into greased plates. Let it cool for 15 minutes. Garnish it with almonds.

In a large frying pan with a lid over medium heat heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Add the shallots. Cook the shallots until they begin to turn translucent about 3 minutes. Add the chicken breasts. Cook 4 to 5 minutes per side or until they are browned. Remove the chicken from the pan. Add the wine to the pan. Reduce the wine by half. Add the broth. Increase the heat to medium-high. Add the tarragon. Simmer until the potatoes are tender. Add the chicken to the pot. Cook 2 to 3 minutes per side or until the chicken is cooked through. Season with the salt and the pepper. Sprinkle the parsley over the pot.

Cook rice according to package directions. Drain and cool slightlyset aside. Brown sausage in large skilletdrain. Stir in rice, chili powder, garlic powder, and peppermix well. Add chicken broth and diced tomatoesbring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally. Reduce heatsimmer 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Sprinkle with cheeselet stand for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.
In large bowl combine pears, lemon juice and hazelnut oil. In another bowl combine arugula and parmesan cheese. Add blue cheese and walnuts and stir. Dress salad with pear mixture and serve.

Wash apricots. Cut them in half. Take the seeds out. Put them in a big bowl. Add sugar. Boil water. Pour boiling water into the bowl. Let it boil for 10-15 minutes. Add almond extract. Take out almonds from the bowl. Put them in a big jar. Pour the compote into the jar. Leave for 2-3 days. Take the compote out of the jar. Stir it. Serve it.
Mix all ingredients together with an electric mixer. Bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes.

Melt butter in sauce pan over medium heat. Stir in flour until mixture begins to bubble. Slowly stir in chicken stock. Cook for 3 minutes or until thickened. Add dill. Stir in vinegar. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add sugar. Stir in egg yolk. Season with salt. Set aside.

Preheat oven to 350. Cream together stuffing mix, eggs and onion. Add seasonings. Mix well. Form into small meatballs. Place meatballs on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare sauce. Stir together sour cream and chili sauce. Stir in brown sugar and ginger. Serve over meatballs.

Cut the shortcut bacon into 3/4-inch pieces. Spread each of the four croissants with half of the mayonnaise. Arrange the tomato wedges on each croissant. Top each croissant with 1/4-cup of the bacon bits. Sprinkle each croissant with 1/2 teaspoon of the parsley.
Combine all ingredients and blend well. Refrigerate for about 2 hours before serving. Serve with crackers and/or chips. Yields about 4 cups.

Peel and slice cucumbers into paper thin slices. Slice onion into thin rounds. Cut radishes into thin rounds. Drain and slice pickles into paper thin slices. Place on a paper towel to absorb excess moisture. Mix cucumbers, onion, radishes and pickles together. Add vegetable oil and white wine vinegar to taste. Add sugar and dry red pepper. Stir. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour. Stir well before serving.

Heat olive oil in a large soup pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and carrots and sauté until onion is translucent and carrots are tender. Add vegetable stock and bring to a boil. Add green beans and return soup to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until green beans are tender - about 20-30 minutes. Add almond milk and bring soup back to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until liquid is absorbed. Add salt and dried herbs and serve warm with croutons or drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with fresh parsley.

Place potatoes in the bottom of the slow cooker. Add onions and apples to the potatoes. Top with corned beef brisket. Mix together remaining ingredients. Spoon over the top of the brisket and potatoes. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours or on high for 4 hours. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with your favorite sauce on the side.

Slice onions lengthwise into 1/2-inch thick rings. Slice rings into 1/4-inch thick strips. Place onions in large saucepan with enough water to cover them by 1 inch. Bring to boil over high heat. Boil for about 20 minutes or until tender but still firm. Remove from heatdrain off any excess water. Stir in mintlet stand 5 minutes. In medium bowl beat eggs. Add onionsstir in flour, baking powder, salt and black pepper. Heat oil in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat until a small piece of onion sizzles when dropped into hot oil. Working in batches, drop batter by heaping tablespoons into hot oil. Fry until golden brown on both sides, about 10 minutes per batch. Drain on paper towels.

Cut each crescent roll into thirds. Spread each with cream cheese. Add one slice of bacon on one end. Add 1/2 slice tomato and 1/2 slice bell pepper. Roll each crescent roll into a coiled rope. Place seam side down and roll up. Secure with toothpicks. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Brush with butter. Serve with salad.

Preheat the oven to 180c/gas mark 4. Butter a 2-litre pudding basin and line the sides with cling film. Put the sugar and eggs into a bowl and whisk together with an electric whisk until pale and fluffy. Sift in the flour and ginger and fold in. Add the orange juice and orange zest and fold in again. Divide the mixture between the pudding basin and level the surface. Cover with cling film and put into the fridge for at least 2 hours or overnight until firm and set. Preheat the oven to gas mark 6/220c. Remove the basin from the fridge and put into the hot oven for 1 hour. Remove from the oven and let stand in the basin for a few minutes before turning out onto a serving plate. Serve warm with a little of the reserved juice and zest alongside.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly grease 13x9 baking dish. Place chicken in baking dish. Top with tomatoes and seasonings. Pour 1 cup of canola oil over the mixture. Sprinkle with taco seasoning. Cover with tortillas and cook in the oven for 45 minutes.

Soak dried beans overnight. Drain. Place beans in a large saucepan with enough water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer until beans are soft, about 1 hour. While beans are cooking, saute garlic and onions in virgin olive oil. Add to beans. Add chicken stock. Add salt and pepper to taste. Simmer until beans are tender. Serve.

Toast apricot halves in skillet over medium heat for 1-2 minutes on each side until golden brown. Place apricots on plate lined with paper towels. Sprinkle apricots with cranberries, orange zest, and dark chocolate chips. Place truffles on plate lined with parchment paper. Store in an air-tight container or freeze for up to 1 month.

Heat olive oil in pan and saute garlic and onions until softened. Add chicken breast to pan with seasonings and let simmer until golden brown. Add peanut butter to pan along with 1 cup of tomato sauce (or paste if you prefer). Cook another 10-15 minutes until sauce is thickened slightly. Add another 1/2 cup of sauce if necessary to thin out sauce to preferred consistency. Serve immediately over brown rice or pasta or with rice noodles if desired.

Warm the oil in a large saucepan and add the leeks and parsley stems to the pan and saut for 5 minutes until softened, but not colored. Add the potatoes and saut for a further 5 minutes until softened. Drain off the excess oil from the leeks and add the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes until the potatoes are tender. Blend half of the soup into a purée in a blender and return to saucepan and add the chives and remaining stock. Simmer for a further 5 minutes and season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Pour into a blender with a stick blender to make a creamy soup and return to pan for a final simmer for 5 minutes to thicken the soup further and re-season to taste with freshly ground black pepper. Serve with a drizzle of creme fraiche.

In a large pot over medium heat add oil and then add ground beef and cook until brown. Then add green bell peppers and cook until soft and tender add garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Then add jalapenos and tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes more. Add beef broth and tomato juice and stir to combine and bring to a boil. Once the soup comes to a boil add steamed rice and cook for 5 minutes stirring occasionally. Then add the onion soup mix and stir to combine and serve hot with a slice of bread and enjoy.

In large saucepan over low heat, dissolve gelatin in orange juice. Cook over low heat until gelatin is completely dissolved and mixture is clear. Stir in orange juice mixture. Add sugar and cook over low heat until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice. Pour into freezer container. Freeze until firm. Whip cream until soft peaks form. Gently fold in sherbet. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, salt and lemon pepper. Simmer for about five minutes or until butter turns a deep red color and fragrant smell. Add popcorn and stir until popcorn is well coated with seasoning mixture. Serve immediately in a large bowl or on a platter with a large spoon for serving.

In small bowl, beat egg and vanilla until smooth. In medium bowl, mix together peanut butter and splenda sugar substitute. Mix together egg mixture and peanut butter mixture. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are firm and set. Cool on rack. Makes about 2 dozen cookies.

Slice and grill the Kielbasa. Place the grilled Kielbasa onto a large platter or onto a platter lined with a paper towel. Sprinkle brown sugar over the Kielbasa. Place the Kielbasa back onto the grill to carmelize. When done set aside. Prepare the sour sauce by mixing brown sugar with cornstarch. Cook 2 minutes to make a paste. Add apple juice and cider vinegar. Stir and cook 2 minutes. Add orange zest. Pour the sour mixture over the grilled Kielbasa. Grill the bell peppers and the onions until slightly charred. Add the pineapple to the grill for 2 minutes. Slice the bell peppers and the onions. Place onto a platter with the Kielbasa. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 9-inch pie plate. Pour 1/3 cup of pudding mix into pie shell and refrigerate while you prepare filling. In large bowl combine remaining pudding mix with milkbeat until thickened. Fold in protein powder and whipped topping. Spoon filling into pie shell. Peel banana, cut into slices and arrange over filling. Refrigerate at least 1 hour until set.

Peel potatoescut into large cubes, leaving the skin on for extra flavor. Place potatoes in pot of cold water over high heat and bring to boil. Immediately cover with lid and cook for about 10 minutes or until tender. Drain potatoes and return potatoes back into pot with lid on. Shake potatoes around so that they are completely covered in heavy cream. Let cool for about 15 minutes or until cream has thickened. Meanwhile melt butter in small pot over medium heat. When butter has melted add garlic clovessaute garlic for about 2 minutes or until fragrant and golden brown. Add potatoes to pan with butter and garliclet simmer for about 10 minutes or until potatoes are golden brownsprinkle with fresh parsley and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat broiler. Wash mushrooms and pat dry. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add garlic and cook until golden, about 2 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Remove to a serving plate. In a small bowl, whisk together wine and soy sauce. Stir in cracker crumbs. Spread on top of mushrooms. Broil until golden and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Remove jalapeno stems from both sides of each jalapeno. Cut each jalapeno in half lengthwise (but not through). Place each half on a microwave safe plate and place one slice of bacon on each jalapeno half. Cover each jalapeno half with one slice of cheese. Cover each plate and microwave on high for 3 minutes. Remove each jalapeno half from microwave and cut each half lengthwise into 4 pieces (4 pieces total). Place a scoop of cream cheese in the center of each jalapeno half and top with a piece of turkey bacon. Wrap each piece tightly in a tortilla and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut off the bottom of each squash so that it will sit flat on the baking sheet. Cut the squash lengthwise in half, scoop out the seeds and pulp with a spoon. Scoop out as much of the remaining pulp as possible without damaging the skin of the squash. Place the squash halves cut side down on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake for 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until the squash is soft when pierced with the tip of a paring knife. Remove the squash from the oven. While the squash is baking prepare the rice. In a large saucepan, combine the brown rice with the water. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat to a simmer and cook until the liquid is absorbed, about 25 minutes. Stir in the olive oil and saute the garlic in the olive oil for 1 minute. Add the onion and bell pepper to the pansaute for 5 minutes or until the onion is tender. Remove the pan from the heat and stir

In a large pot of boiling water, blanch the green beans for 2-3 minutes. Drain and cool slightly. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, bring the broth to a boil. In a small bowl combine the cornstarch and 1/2 cup cold water. Stir in the broth and bring to a boil stirring constantly. Cook for 1 minute or until thickened. Remove from heat. Add the mustard, garlic and honey and stir until smooth. Stir in the peanut oil. Season with salt and fresh ground black pepper. If desired add some sliced green onions. Serve warm or cold.

Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Heat 1 Tbsp. butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken. Brown chicken on both sides. Transfer to a large bowl. Stir in sherry. Add enough chicken broth to equal 2/3 cup. Heat remaining 1 Tbsp. butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in lemon rind and juice. Cook until lemon is tender. Add chicken broth mixture. Cook until sauce thickens slightly. Add cream. Heat through. Pour sauce over chicken. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Makes 4 servings.

Bring 1 cup of water and 1/2 cup of sugar to a boil in a saucepan. Add 1 cup of frozen raspberries. Boil for 2 minutes. Strain into a large pitcher. Stir in lemon juice. Refrigerate until cold. Serves 8 to 10.

Drain and rinse beans. Put 2 cups of beans in a 9x13 inch pan. Mix 1 1/4 cups ketchup and 1/2 cup water together. Pour over beans. Add 2/3 cup molasses, 2 tablespoons brown sugar and 1/2 cup water. Cook beans until tender. Mix in 1/2 cup water and 1 1/2 teaspoons of mustard and 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder. Mix together. Put tofu weenies in a hot dog bun with sauce.

Melt butter over low heat. Stir in brown sugar. Remove from heat. Stir in nuts. Press firmly into buttered 8 x 8 inch pan. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and top with chocolate chips. Let stand 20 minutes. Remove from pan. Cut into squares.

In a saucepan over medium heat add oil and cook onion and garlic until onion is translucent. Add crushed tomatoes and stir with a wooden spoon for about 10 minutes. Add smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, rosemary and dried marjoram. Stir and cook for 2 minutes more. Add chicken stock to tomato mixture. Bring to a boil then simmer for 10 minutes. Add more stock if needed. Ladle into bowls and top with a dollop of sour cream and freshly chopped cilantro or basil.

Cook tortellini according to package directions. While tortellini is cooking, combine remaining ingredients except peas in a small pot. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat and cook for approximately 5 minutes. Add peas and continue to cook for an additional minute. Remove from heat and add tortellini and combine. Serve warm.

Prepare caramel topping first by combining brown sugar, butter, and water in saucepan over medium heat until caramel begins to form around edges of pan and bubbles start to appear. Do not boil or stir constantly or it will burn easily. Remove from heat immediately when caramel is done. Combine apple slices in small bowl with brown sugar, salt, caramel topping, and whisk together. Place puff pastry on lightly greased cookie sheet. Spread apple mixture evenly over pastry. Bake at 375 degrees for about 35 minutes or until golden brown and puffy on top. Cool for 15 minutes before serving with whipped cream & vanilla ice cream on top.

Cut the bread lengthwise. Spread with mayonnaise. Layer with lettuce leaves. Sprinkle with tomatoes. Top with bacon. Then top with cooked chicken breast. Then top with mayonnaise. Place on a platter. Serve with the sticks.

In a large bowl mix eggs, sugar and butter. In another bowl, stir together eggnog, rum extract, vanilla extract and flour. Add flour mixture to butter mixturestir just until blended. Pour into prepared pans. Bake at 375 f for 40-45 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 20 minutes in pan before removing to cooling rack. Cool completely before frosting.

Rinse and pat dry your salmon fillets. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pan and cook the salmon for 5 minutes until it is almost cooked. Transfer to a plate and set aside. Sautee garlic and ginger in a little oil in a pan. Add curry paste and cook for 5 minutes. Add coconut milk and simmer for about 15 minutes. Add green beans and cook for another 5 minutes. Add salmon and cook for another 5 minutes. Add brown sugar and fish sauce. Cook for another 5 minutes. Add lime juice and mushrooms and cook for another 5 minutes. Cook jasmine rice as you normally would. When salmon is cooked through, place some rice in a serving bowl and top with salmon and vegetable curry. Sprinkle with basil and serve.

Mix together salt and pepper in a bowl. Slice eggs in half. Place each slice in a rye round. Layer on top half of an open faced sandwich with smoked salmon on top of each egg half. Top each sandwich with a butter slice and a handful of fresh dill. Place sandwiches on a baking pan. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes at 350 degrees or until eggs are cooked to your liking. Serve immediately.

Mix graham cracker crumbs with sugar and melted butter. Press into bottom of an ungreased 8 x 8 x 1 inch pan. Chill in refrigerator while you make the filling. Beat sweetened condensed milk and raspberry preserves. Spread raspberry mixture over the crust. Sprinkle with cashews and white chocolate chips. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Cool for one hour before cutting and serving.

Mix club crackers and margarine in large bowl. Add milk and stir until blended. Stir in brown and white sugars. Press in 9x13 pan. Let stand 15 minutes. Mix graham cracker crumbs and chocolate chips. Sprinkle on top of brown layer. Microwave peanut butter in microwaveable bowl for 25 seconds. Stir until smooth. Spread on top of brown layer. Cool completely. Cut into bars. Refrigerate.

Put the chuck in a large pot and cover it with cold water. Bring the liquid to a boil over medium-high heat. Skim the scum that rises to the surface. Reduce the heat to low and simmer the meat until it is very tender. Remove the meat from the liquid and set it aside. Add the potatoes to the liquid and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove the potatoes from the liquid and set them aside. Drain the liquid into a saucepan. Add the carrots and bring the liquid to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the carrots are very tender. Add the potatoes and the pearl onions and bring the mixture to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 10 minutes. Add the Guinness Stout and cook for 5 minutes. Add the meat and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the soup mix and simmer for 5 minutes. Place the stew in a slow cooker. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Let the stew simmer for

Wash spinach well. Cut leaves into bite size pieces. Place in a large salad bowl. Peel cantaloupe and cut into wedges. Toss spinach with cantaloupe. Drizzle raspberry dressing over salad. Toss gently. Sprinkle pistachios over salad.

Peel and boil potatoes until tender. Drain. Cut potatoes into 1 inch cubes. Melt butter in large skillet and add potatoes. Add sour cream and mix. Add cream cheese and mix. Stir in garlic salt and salt. Fold in eggs. Pour into a greased 11x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Mix flours, baking powder, salt, cinnamon and sugar in large mixing bowl. Make well in center of dry mixture. Add liquid ingredients. Beat until smooth. Spray non-stick skillet with vegetable oil spray. Heat skillet over medium heat. Pour about 1/4 cup of batter into center of hot skillet. Cook until small bubbles form around edges of pancake. Turn pancake over. Cook for 2 minutes longer. Flip pancake over. Cook for 1 minute longer. Serve warm with butter. Makes about 8 pancakes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the chicken in a bowl and cover with ranch dressing. Add the breadcrumbs and stir to coat. Place the chicken in a 9 x 13-inch baking pan and pour the butter over the chicken. Place chicken in the refrigerator for 15 minutes to marinate. Remove chicken from the refrigerator and coat the chicken in the egg. Place the chicken in the oven and cook for about 20 minutes. Remove the chicken from the oven and coat the chicken with the bacon and cheese. Place the chicken back in the oven and cook until the cheese is melted and the bacon is crispy. Serve the chicken on the rolls.

Peel the potatoes and cut into quarters and remove the eyes and center section. Bake the potatoes at 450 degrees for about 50 minutes until tender. Cool completely and then cut lengthwise into 1/4 thick slices and then cut into wedges. Spread sour cream on each wedge and top with bacon and cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for about 15 minutes until cheese is melted and baked and serve warm or at room temperature with fresh chives.

Combine pomegranates, sugar and grenadine in medium saucepan. Bring to boil. Stir frequently until sugar and grenadine are dissolved and mixture thickens. Add tapioca. Cook 2 minutes more. Remove from heat and stir. Cool. Refrigerate. To serve, stir pomegranate mixture and whipped cream together. Serve. Garnish with pomegranate seeds.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the beef to the skillet and cook until browned, turning occasionally. Add the bell peppers and onions to the skillet and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Add the water and the hoisin sauce and cook for 2 minutes or until the liquid is reduced and the mixture is thickened. Serve over rice.

In a large zip-top bag place the chicken breast and add the remaining ingredients. Seal the bag and shake to coat the chicken with the crumb mixture. Place the coated chicken breast on a lightly greased cookie sheet or a pan coated with a non-stick cooking spray. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes at 350 degrees F or until a meat thermometer reads 165 degrees F when inserted into the thickest part of the breast meat.

Rinse potatoes, place them in cold water for about 30 minutes. Drain well. Cut potatoes in half. Peel onion. Slice onion in half lengthwise. Slice onion into thin half rounds. Add potatoes and onions into cold water in stock pot. Add butter. Bring water to a boil. Boil until potatoes are tender. Drain potatoes. Place potatoes on greased baking sheet. Sprinkle potatoes with salt and pepper. Top potatoes with grated cheddar cheese. Bake in 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. While potatoes are baking, prepare onions. Peel onions. Cut onions in half. Cut onions in half lengthwise. Slice onions in half again lengthwise. Place onion slices on greased baking sheet. Bake in 350 degree oven for 15 minutes. Place onions on potatoes. Sprinkle potatoes with parsley. Serve.

Heat olive oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened. Add garlic cloves and cook until fragrant. Add ground allspice, ground cinnamon, chili, lime juice and sugar to pan. Simmer for 10 minutes to allow flavors to come together. Season with salt to taste if needed. Place meat on grill directly over medium-high coals (or indirectly over medium coals if using charcoal). Baste meat with baste every 5 to 10 minutes for about 20 minutes, or until done to your taste. Grill or baste-cooked meat can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 4 days or frozen for up to 3 months.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Sift together flour and soda. In large bowl, cream butter and shortening. Add sugar and molasses. Beat well. Stir in eggs, one at a time. Add vanilla. Gradually add dry ingredients to beaten mixture. Mix well. Drop dough by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 12 to 14 minutes. Cool 2 minutes on cookie sheet before removing to wire racks.
Place bacon in a 6-quart steamer and add onions. Add enough beer to come halfway up the side of the bacon. Add clams. Cover and steam 12 to 15 minutes.
Combine all of the ingredients in a bowl until well blended. Stir in the shrimp. Serve with crackers.

Put sugar-free gelatin in a bowl and add cherry vodka. Stir and set aside until gelatin has completely dissolved. Pour half of the cherry vodka mixture into a shot glass. Add 3 to 4 drops of red bull and stir well. Serve immediately. The bull is an after thought so don't use to much. Just a few drops.

Sauté onion and mushrooms in butter until translucent and set aside. Spread crepes with marinara sauce and place one half of the spinach in the center of each crepe. Place mozzarella on top of the spinach and sprinkle parmesan cheese over the top of the mozzarella. Fold crepe in half and place on plate. Top crepe with the sautéed vegetables and serve with a side of marinara sauce on the side.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a small mixing bowl, whisk together melted butter and vanilla extract. In a large mixing bowl, combine cake mix and butter mixture. Use an electric mixer to beat for 3 minutes or until dough is smooth. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut dough into 2-inch cookies. Place cookies 2-inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until edges of cookies are lightly brown. Cool for 1 minuteremove from cookie sheets to cool completely. In a small bowl, mix cream cheese and egg until blended. Spread frosting over cookies. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Melt a pat of butter and fry sliced onion and garlic over medium heat until tender. Add 2 cups of chicken broth and simmer until reduced to about 1/3 cup. Add another pat of butter to pan and add sliced peppers. Cook over medium heat until tender. Add a cup of chicken broth and simmer until reduced to about 3/4 cup. Add sliced potatoes and stir until coated. Add remaining broth and continue to cook until thickened. Season to taste and serve.

Bake bread for about 30 minutes at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) or until it is golden brown on top. Slice bread open length wise and spread it out on a cookie sheet or baking dish to cool. When bread is cool, remove it from the pan. Spread butter on each side of bread slices to coat them well. Sprinkle cheddar cheese on top of bread slices. Add a slice of cooked bacon on each piece of bread. Crack eggs onto bread slices and sprinkle them lightly with salt and pepper. Bake eggs at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for about 12 minutes or until whites are set. Serve warm or cold. Serve with a toasted English muffin for dipping.

Mix all the above together in large bowlpress firmly into greased eclair mold. Refrigerate for at least one hour. Turn out on serving platetop with chocolate frosting if desired. Refrigerate for at least one hour before serving.

Beat eggs with milk and spices in large bowl until combined. Dip bread slices into egg mixturecoat both sides of each slice with egg mixture. Heat skillet or griddle over medium heat for 1 minute. Add bread slices, turning until golden brown on both sides. Serve with applesauce or jam.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Place kabobs in a baking pan and broil for 4-5 minutes. Flip over and broil again until cooked.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray lightly with nonstick cooking spray. Place the pork chops in the pan. Sprinkle with seasonings. Add enough oil to cover the bottom of the pan. Add enough water to cover the bottom of the pan. Cover pan tightly with aluminum foil. Bake 1 hour or until tender. Add remaining water to pan, stirring frequently. Bake an additional 30 minutes. Drain pork. Add remaining seasonings to pan. Cook 5 minutes or until sauce is thick. Serve with pork chops.

Preheat broiler. Place onions in the center of each hoagie roll. Sprinkle with steak seasoning and a pinch of garlic salt and pepper. Place steak on onions and add provolone cheese on top of steak. Broil for 2 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Cook rice according to package directions. Drain. In a skillet cook bell pepper in vegetable oil over medium heat for about 3 minutes. Add onions. Cook until tender. Stir in mushrooms. Cook until tender. Add cooked rice to skillet with the vegetables. Stir in garlic. Sprinkle with cajun seasoning. Stir in salt and black pepper. Stir in pecans. Cook over low heat until pecans are toasted. Serve immediately.

In a large pan over medium heat heat olive oil and garlic until fragrant about 1 minute. Add zucchini cook until tender about 5 minutes. Add basil cook for another minute. Add pasta cook until tender drain well and reserve about 1/2 cup of pasta liquid in the pan. Meanwhile mix together cheese parsley salt and black pepper into the pasta until well combined. Place pasta into serving bowls top with zucchini mixture sprinkle with reserved pasta liquid and parmesan cheese serve immediately or refrigerate for later use. Makes about 4 servings.

Combine pancake mix and milk. Whisk until smooth. Add the oil and whisk again. Slowly pour in the egg while continuing to whisk. Fill a donut hole pan 2/3 full and place in preheated oven for 3 to 4 minuets or until done. Dip in powdered sugar and roll in cinnamon.

Peel the potatoes and cut them into cubes. Boil them until tender. Drain them well and put them into a bowl along with the onions, eggs, parsley leaves and some lemon juice. Put the mixture into a large bowl and stir in the sour cream and the rest of the lemon juice. Toss gently to combine the ingredients. Let the potato salad stand for about 20 minutes before serving. If you prefer a sharper flavor, you can add more lemon juice as well as some dijon mustard before serving. Serve cold or at room temperature.
Spread bread with butter and slice cheese over each slice of bread. Mix together mayo and cream cheese and spread over top of sandwiches. Spread second slice of bread over top of sandwiches.

Add the sweetened condensed milk and salt to the caramel sauce and stir until combined. Remove from the heat and add the butter and vanilla and stir until smooth. Pour the mixture into a 9 x 13 inch pan and sprinkle the toasted rice cereal evenly over the top of the caramel mixture. Chill the mixture for 30 minutes before cutting into bite-size bars. Top each bar with 1 miniature marshmallow and 1/4 teaspoon flaked sea salt. Store covered in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.

In a large skillet melt butter over medium heat. Cook corn flake crumbs for about 1 minute. Add parsley. Remove from pan. Stir tomato sauce. Stir in seasoning. Remove from pan. Dip chicken breasts into eggs. Dip into seasoning mixture. Cook in pan until done. Stir in corn flakes and parmesan cheese. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Spread pizza sauce on a greased 15 x 10 x 1-inch jelly-roll pan. Sprinkle ground round evenly over sauce. Sprinkle macaroni over ground round. Top with shredded cheese. Bake 20-30 minutes in 350 degree oven. Let stand 5 minutes. Cut into strips and serve.

Melt butter in a 2-quart heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic cloves, cayenne pepper, cream cheese and whisk until smooth, about 3 minutes. Add milk and cook over medium heat until cheese is melted and sauce is smooth, about 3 more minutes. Season with pepper. Serve over pasta or other cooked vegetables or cooked meats such as pork or veal.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Grease your muffin tins (or line with paper muffin cups). In a large bowl, cream together the sugar and butter until smooth and creamy. Beat in the eggs and bananas until well-combined and smooth. In a medium bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda and salt. Add the dry mixture into the wet mixture and mix until just combined (batter will be lumpy). Fold in the blueberries and mix until they are evenly distributed throughout the batter. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups and bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 20 minutes.

Boil the red potatoes in salted water until fork tender. Drain and let cool. While the potatoes are cooking, combine the red wine vinegar, vegetable oil and dill. Stir well. When the potatoes are cool, add to the vinegar mixture. Add the red bell peppers and cucumbers. Add the green onions. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir well. Spoon into serving bowl. Sprinkle with feta cheese.

Clean the pork loin. Place the pork loin in a 9 by 13 baking dish. In a small bowl add the garlic cloves, the thyme, the rosemary, and the basil. Add the olive oil. Stir well. Pour the herb mixture over the pork loin. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove the pork loin from the refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Cook the pork loin uncovered for 1 1/2 hours or until the pork loin reaches an internal temperature of 145 degrees F. Remove the pork loin from the oven. Allow the pork loin to rest for 5 minutes before slicing. Serve the pork loin warm.

In a large pot combine the olive oil, leek, butternut squash and season with salt and pepper. Saute until tender and translucent. Add the navy beans and rotel tomatoes and stir until hot throughly. Transfer to a crock pot and add the mozzarella cheese, stirring until melted. Add the bacon and cook until crisp. Turn the heat down and let the mixture sit for a few hours before serving. Serve over rice.
Cream butter and sugar together. Add vanilla essence. Fold through dry ingredients. Roll into 12 balls. Flatten into round shapes. Bake at 180 c for 12 minutes. Chill.

In a medium saucepan stir the brown sugar and flour together. In a small bowl mix the egg yolks, milk and butter. Add this mixture to the brown sugar mixture. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly. Cook for 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and cool. Pour into the pie crust and chill for at least one hour.

In a small saucepan combine strawberries and sugar. Cook over medium heat until strawberries begin to pop. Mash strawberries to release juices. Set aside to cool. In a large bowl place spinach. Add strawberry mixture and gently toss. Sprinkle with red wine vinegar and olive oil. Toss to coat. Add poppy seeds, red onions and candied pecans. Refrigerate for at least an hour before serving. Serve with feta cheese and fresh cracked pepper.

Cut each bun lengthwise in half horizontallyspread halves with butter and top with cheese and sesame seeds. Bake at 400 degrees for about 10 minutes or until cheese melts and breadsticks are lightly browned.

Peel garlic and cut into cloves. Add garlic to slow cooker. Add 1 cup of water. Add pork roast. Season with salt and pepper. Cook on low for 8 hours. Add 1/2 cup barbecue sauce to slow cooker. Add 1/2 cup of water. Cook for 30 minutes. Shred pork. Add pork to pulled pork barbecue sauce. Serve.

Beat butter with an electric mixer on medium speed for 30 seconds. Beat in sugar alternately with eggs, beating until combined after each addition. Beat in flour mixture alternately with the vanilla until well combined. Pour batter into a greased 9 1/2- x 5 1/2- x 3-inch loaf pan. Bake for 60 minutes or until a cake tester inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes before removing to the rack to cool completely.

In a heavy saucepan combine cornstarch and water and stir in sugar and stir until dissolved. Stir in butter until melted. Add the juice and rind of one large lemon, stirring constantly until thickened. Fold in one cup chopped strawberry. Chill for 2 hours or more before serving. Serve in small glasses garnished with shortbread cookie or cake or meringue.

In a large mixing bowl combine red cabbage, apple juice, salt, apple pieces, raisins, vinegar, honey and oil. Cover and refrigerate several hours before serving to allow the flavors to develop. Serve over red leaf lettuce.

Bake the onions on the stove top until tender about 10 minutes or so or until they are almost brown. Then place the turnips on the stove top in a pan with water and salt and let boil for about 20 minutes or so until they are almost soft. Take the onions out of the pan on the stove top then put the turnips back into the pan on the stove top for a little bit to get rid of the water that the turnips may have left on the pan. After the turnips are done place them into a food processor or blender add the butter, onions and milk. Puree until smooth then put it into a saucepan on the stove top on medium heat and bring it to a boil for about 3-5 minutes or until it thickens to a smooth consistency. When the sauce is done place the sauce into the container then add the baguettes on top of the sauce then let sit for about 5 minutes then serve! Enjoy!

Roll the cheddar into a ball. Place the ball on a piece of wax paper. Cut the ball in half. Spread each piece with the cream cheese. Place one slice of the solid pack pumpkin on the cream cheese. Add a dollop of preserves. Roll into a ball. Roll the ball in the cracker crumbs. Wrap in the wax paper. Place in the fridge for 20 minutes. Remove the ball from the paper. Roll in the remaining cracker crumbs. Store in the refrigerator until serving.

1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Cut off the stems and bulb of the fennel and discard. Cut away the tough outer layers. Cut the bulb in half lengthwise and remove the cores. Cut the fennel into quarters lengthwise.2. Melt the butter in a large skillet. Add the garlic clove and saute for about 30 seconds. Add the fennel and saute until lightly browned. Transfer the fennel to an ovenproof baking dish. Deglaze the skillet with the wine and stir to deglaze. Add the stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer for about 20 minutes.3. Transfer the fennel to the oven and bake for about 15 minutes.4. Serve with a sprinkling of chopped parsley and freshly ground black pepper.

Peal potatoes and cut them into cubes. Boil them in salted water until they are tender. Drain them. Cut eggs in half lengthwise. Slice the gherkins. Mix them with the potato. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Pour the salad dressing over the potato. Mix everything together. Serve.
Beat eggs and milk until thoroughly blended. Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour into 10 inch non-stick frying pan and cook on medium heat until firm and cooked through.

Put pork chops in a shallow dish and pour over soy sauce. Set aside for 30 minutes. Pound the pork to 1/4 inch thickness and slice the meat crosswise into 1-inch pieces. Combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl and mix well. Pour the mixture over the pork and marinate for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator. Drain the pork and discard the marinade. Heat the oil in a wok or deep frying pan and fry the pork for 4 minutes. Add the cornstarch mixture and stir-fry until the pork is browned and coated with the sauce. Serve hot with rice or noodles and cucumber and tomato salad.

Clean the parsnips by peeling off the top layer of the skin. Chop into thick slices of around 1cm thickness. Drizzle the oil on a baking tray and arrange the parsnips in the tray. Sprinkle with salt and herbs of choice (I used fresh thyme). Cook for 45 minutes or so at 180 degrees celsius. The time will depend on how thick the slices are, so keep an eye on them as they cook. They should turn golden brown when they are ready. Remove from the oven when golden brown. Serve with dip of choice!

Blend all the cheese with the eggs in a blender or food processor until smooth. Add the powdered milk and lemon juice and blend for about a minute more. Add the honey and the almond essence (or extract) and blend for about a minute more until very smooth (you don't want any lumps). Pour into a 9 inch springform pan or two 6 inch springform pans. Bake at 325° for about 45 minutes or until the center is set (don't over bake). Chill at least 2 hours before serving. Top each slice with a dollop of whipped cream or a raspberry. Serve chilled or at room temperature (I like them at room temp).
In a food processor combine ricotta cheese, maraschino cherry juice, pecans, sugar and whipping cream. Blend until smooth. Serve chilled with mini chocolate chips on top.

Put cranberries into a medium saucepan with cinnamon stick, sugar, and water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring occasionally, until cranberries burst, about 10 minutes. Add port. Simmer until sauce thickens slightly, about 5 minutes more. Set cranberries aside. Transfer sauce to a jar and let cool completely before serving. Serve over meat or poultry.
Combine dry ingredients and mix well. Stir in wet ingredients until well-blended. Fill muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake at 425f for 10-12 minutes.

Melt butterscotch chips in a saucepan over low heat. Stir until chips are melted. Remove from heat. Stir in chocolate chips. Cool. Place 1/4 cup of whole wheat cereal into each of two large paper grocery bags. Add 3/4 cup melted chips. Seal bags. Tie with string. Dip bags in melted chocolate. Twist ends to seal. Dip bags in sugar. Place on waxed paper to dry.

Brown chicken breast halves in a Dutch oven over medium heat until cooked through. Remove chicken to a plate and set aside. In a small bowl combine sauerkraut and thousand island dressing. Spoon sauerkraut mixture over chicken in Dutch oven and sprinkle with Swiss cheese. Cover and cook on low 2 to 3 hours or until cheese is melted. To serve, top each slice of pumpernickel bread with a chicken breast half and a slice of Swiss cheese. Place a dollop of sauerkraut mixture on top of each sandwich and serve immediately.
