In large pot onion and kielbasa are cooked until onion is soft. Add black-eyed peas, navy beans and brown rice. Add chicken broth and bring to boil. Stir in garlic powder and cayenne pepper then add water if needed. Let simmer for 2 hours. Serve hot and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel and dice pumpkin into 1/4-inch cubes. Place pumpkin cubes into large saucepan and cover with water. Cook over high heat until pumpkin is tender when pierced with a fork, about 30 minutes. Remove from heat and drain well. Mix pumpkin with milk, egg yolks and salt and set aside. In another bowl combine egg whites and sugar until stiff peaks are formed. Fold egg whites into pumpkin mixture. Divide between unbaked pie shells. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees and bake until set. Remove from pans and cool.

Boil pasta for 10 minutes or until al dente, drain and set aside. Meanwhile, cut the zucchini into long strips and cook in skillet with butter and red onion over medium heat until tender. Add tomatoes and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and add zucchini to cooked pasta and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and basil and toss well. Add lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Serve with lemon wedges on the side.

Bring large saucepan of water and 1 teaspoon salt to boil. Add macaroni and cook until tender but firmdrain well. Meanwhile in a large skillet cook onion and garlic in butter until tender. Add tomatoes, water, salt and peppercook until hot. In a small bowl stir together breadcrumbs and melted butter. Place macaroni in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Top with onion mixture and 1/3 cup Parmesan cheese. In a small bowl, stir together the breadcrumb mixture and 1/3 cup Parmesan. Sprinkle over top of macaroni mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Combine all-purpose flour, salt and oil in a large bowl. Whisk well with fork. Gradually add water until dough forms. Form dough into a ball. Cover and let sit at least 1 hour or up to 24 hours. Roll dough into about 1/2-inch thickness. Cut into desired shapes. Cook in boiling water for about 2 minutes. Drain. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake in a preheated 425 degree F. oven for 12 minutes.

Bring a pot of water to boil for the egg and the milk. Crack one egg in a small cup and mix with the cream cheese. Add in the chives and pepper and stir. Once the water is boiling, crack in the rest of the eggs and cook until the whites are set and the yolks are cooked to your liking. Pour the egg mixture into the pot of boiling water and cook for about one minute. Pour the eggs out of the water and into a shallow bowl and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve immediately with toast or crackers.

Preheat oven to 375. Cut apples into wedges. Melt butter. Sprinkle cinnamon sugar over the apples. Dip apple wedges in the melted butter and then roll in the cinnamon sugar. Place apple wedges in a 13x9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with flour. Mix sugar with milk. Pour over apple wedges. Bake for 45 minutes. Top with whipped cream. Serve.

Squeeze juice from 2 lemons into a large bowl. Add enough water to make 1 cup and stir in 3 tablespoons cornstarch until blended. Heat soymilk in a small saucepan just to a boil over medium-high heat. Gradually add cornstarch mixture, whisking constantly to prevent lumps. Cook for 2 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in margarine. Cool slightly. Pour into a jar or other airtight container. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until set before using. You can also freeze this if you want to save it for a special occasion or for a later date. You can also use other citrus juices in place of lemon juicelime juice is nice too.

Heat oil in pan to medium-high. Sear scallops for 2 minutes on each side. Remove from pan. Puree pineapple, mango, cucumber, red bell pepper, cilantro, lime juice and jalapeno together in blender or food processor until smooth and creamy. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve scallops with salsa.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 8x8 baking pan. Beat the butter with 2/3 cup of the brown sugar until creamy. Add eggs and vanillabeat well. Gradually stir in the remaining brown sugar, cocoa powder and flour. Pour into greased 8x8 baking panbake 20-25 minutes until brownies are set and toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool completely before serving.

Preheat grill. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil and seasonings. Brush pork steaks with the seasonings and grill over high heat until done to your liking. Serve with your favorite BBQ sauce.

Bring 1 cup of water to boil. Add the eggs to the boiling water. Cook 6 to 7 minutes or until eggs are completely cooked through. Drain the eggs under cold water and peel them. Add the onion, celery and green bell pepper to the boiling water. Cook 3 to 4 minutes or until the vegetables are tender-crisp. Drain the vegetables under cold water and peel them. Place the noodle cup in the boiling water for 3 minutes. Remove the cup from the water and peel off the top. Stir the eggs, vegetables and noodles together until well combined. Serve hot.

Brown the muffin mix in a small amount of oil. Add enchilada sauce and simmer for 3 minutes. In a small bowl combine the eggs with the water and beat until blended. Add the cheddar cheese and the cilantro. Remove the corn muffin mix from the stove. Place 2 tablespoons of the enchilada mixture in the center of a tortilla and place a piece of the eggs in the center. Roll the tortilla and place in a lightly greased 8 x 12-inch pan. Repeat with the remaining tortillas and enchilada mixture. Pour the enchilada mixture over the top and sprinkle with the cheese. Bake for 20-25 minutes in a 350-degree oven until the tortillas are lightly browned and the enchilada mixture is bubbling.

Put garlic heads in a pot of cold water and bring to a boil. Let boil for 10 minutes. Drain water and add cold water to garlic and let cool. Peel garlic and add to blender. Add 1/2 cup canola oil and 1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil. Blend until pureed and smooth. Set aside and let cool. In a separate saucepan combine 1/2 cup water and 2 t. Canola oil. Heat and add 6 peeled cloves of garlic to saucepan. Bring to a boil and turn down heat to low. Cover and let cook for about 30 minutes. Strain garlic and discard water. Add garlic to garlic puree.

In large bowl, mix all salad ingredients except chicken. Mix chicken with dressing. On tortillas, place cabbage mixture. Top with chicken. Roll up tightly. Place in baking dish. Bake at 400 degrees until chicken is cooked through. (about 20 minutes) Serve with fresh tomatoes if desired.

Bring large pot of salted water to boil. Add pasta and cook according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Place noodles in large bowl. Add garlic and gingerstir to combine. Add tahini and 1/4 cup soy saucestir to combine. Add 1/4 cup sesame oil and stir to combine. Add onion and cilantrostir to combine. Add pasta and stir to combine. Add remaining soy sauce and sesame oilstir to combine. Serve immediately.

In a bowl mix together dry breadcrumbs, lemon juice, onion powder, pepper & basil. Set aside. Heat olive oil & butter in a frying pan over medium heat. Sauté onion & green bell peppers until tender. Set aside. Place cod fillets skin side down. Place a large tomato slice on each fillet. Sprinkle with bread crumb mixture. Cover & bake at 350f for 15 minutes or until fillets flake easily with a fork. Garnish with tomato slices. Serve immediately.

Cut 3 lemons into quarters and put them into a large jug. Add 120ml (4fl oz) of sugar and 120ml (4fl oz) of cold water. Crush the mint leaves and add to the jug. Stir well and add 600ml (1 pint) of mineral water and 300ml (10 fl oz) of freshly squeezed lemon juice. Put ice cubes into 4 tall glasses and then pour the lemonade into the glasses and serve.

In a large pot boil the chicken stock with the ravioli for 10-15 minutes or until done and the pasta is soft and tender. Drain ravioli and spinach from the stock and return to pot to keep warm until ready to serve. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and parsley and serve with a loaf of italian bread.

Brown the sausage and onion with the oil. Add the tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes are heated through. Drain. Combine the tomatoes and the other ingredients. Cook the ziti according to package directions. Drain and toss the ziti with the sauce. Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese on top and cook for 1 minute or until the cheese melts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large skillet melt olive oil over medium heat. Add sausage and cook until browned. Remove sausage to a plate with a slotted spoon. Drain any fat from the skillet. Add tomato sauce to the skillet. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add chablis, oregano, and mushrooms. Stir to mix well. Add sausage back to the pan. Simmer 30 minutes. Serve with pappardelle pasta.

Cut sirloin steak in half cross-wise for even thickness. Place in a shallow dish and pour in water to cover by one inch. Cover and refrigerate at least six hours and up to overnight. Drain well and pat dry on a paper towel. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add a tablespoon of olive oil. Place sirloin steak in skillet and cook five minutes on each side. Remove from skillet and set aside. Bring remaining one tablespoon of olive oil and vegetable oil in skillet over medium heat and add shallots and onion. Cook until onion begins to soften. Add chopped garlic and stir one minute. Add wine and cook until reduced by half. Add sugar, Worcestershire sauce and light soy sauce and bring to a boil. Add water and balsamic vinegar and reduce until desired consistency is reached. Pour sauce over sirloin steak and serve.

Heat oil in heavy large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and carrotcook and stir 5 minutes. Add celerycook 5 minutes longer. Add barley and ricecook 5 minutes longer. Add salmoncook 5 minutes longer. Add water and cilantrobring to boil. Reduce heatcover and cook 15 minutes. Sprinkle with pepper.

In a small saucepan, combine 1 cup raspberries and sugar. Heat over medium heat until sugar dissolved. Remove from heat. In a small bowl, mash remaining raspberries until mostly pureed. Pour mixture into saucepan. Stir in port. Bring to a boil over high heat. Boil 2 minutes. Reduce heat to medium lowcook 8 minutes. Stir in chipotle. Cook 1 minute. Stir in raspberry mixture. Cook 1 minute. Pour into a small saucepan or food-processor container. Cool. Refrigerate.

Place butter, sugar, corn syrup in saucepan over medium heat. Cook until sugar dissolves and mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat and add peanut butter to hot mixture stirring constantly until butter melts completely. Add rice krispies to mixture stirring constantly until evenly coated. Pour onto waxed paper and let cool for about 5 minutes. Press mixture with hands to form balls about the size of walnuts. Roll in melted chocolate morsels to coat completely. Remove from waxed paper to cool completely on waxed paper.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan. Add the onion and saute until tender. Sprinkle the flour over the onions and stir until smooth. Add the milk and sherry. Whisk in the cream. Cook and stir for about 5 minutes until thickened. Stir in the lobster meat. Season with the paprika and pepper. Garnish with chopped fresh chives. Serve with warm bread.

Bring orange juice to boil in a saucepan. Add rice, celery, onions and parsley. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook for 20 minutes stirring frequently. In a small bowl, mix orange rind and salt together until salt is dissolved. Add mixture to rice mixture. Cover with water and simmer for 50 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Sprinkle with slivered almonds before serving.

Bring water and sugar to a boil and add sauerkraut and caraway seeds. Cook for approximately 30 minutes or until the liquid has evaporated and the sauerkraut is soft and translucent. Add the cooking apples and simmer for a further 5 minutes. Transfer to a food processor and puree. Season with salt and pepper. Place the frankfurter into a hot frypan and brown on both sides. Slice the hot dog lengthwise and fill the frankfurter with the sauerkraut. Top with fresh parsley.

Place chicken on a wire rack over a rimmed baking sheet. In a small bowl, whisk balsamic vinegar with 2 tablespoons honey, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 tablespoons brown sugar and rosemary until blendedreserve 1 tablespoon for serving. Transfer chicken to a large zip-top plastic bagpour dressing over chicken. Close bag securely, pressing out air. Refrigerate for at least 8 hours or overnight. Transfer chicken to a wire rack set in a rimmed baking sheet. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate for 15 minutes before serving. Sprinkle with sesame seedsgarnish with parsley sprigs and reserved balsamic vinegar mixture.

Bake ham covered at 225 for one hour and uncovered at 325 for 1 hour or until heated through. Combine brown sugar and orange juice and drizzle over ham. Cook at low temperature until heated through. Serve as is or with glaze.

Combine vinegar, mustard, thyme and 1/3 cup of the oil in small bowl and whisk until emulsified. Toss greens with remaining 1/3 cup of the oil. Divide greens among platestop each with pecans, cranberries and onion. Drizzle greens with dressingsprinkle with cheese.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In large bowl or mixer beat whole wheat flour and unbleached all-purpose flour. In separate bowl beat egg whites until stiff. Add eggs and egg whites to wheat mixture and beat until smooth. Stir in white sugar and milk. Mix baking soda and lemon juice and fold into batter. Pour into two greased loaf pans and bake for 35 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan. Cool on rack and serve. Makes two loaves.

Wash and peel potatoes. Cut them in half. Place in a large saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil and cook for about 15 minutes or until tender. Drain and cool. When cool enough to handle, peel skins off of potatoes. Place potatoes in a large bowl and add remaining ingredients. Mash with a potato masher or fork until smooth. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In large bowl with electric mixer beat margarine and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Add applesauce and beat until blended. Stir in flour mixture until just combined. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased cookie sheets 2 inches apart. Bake for 9 to 10 minutes until set. Cool on cookie sheet for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Cover a Dutch oven with a lid and pour in water. Place pork shoulder in the pot and cover with a lid. Simmer over medium-high heat for 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Turn off heat and let sit for 10 minutes. Remove pork from pot and discard water. In a large bowl, combine brown sugar, molasses, tequila and garlic. Stir in water. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Place pork in a roasting pan and pour glaze over top. Roast for 1 hour and 15 minutes in a preheated 375 degree oven until caramelized. Remove and let cool. Slice into 1-inch rounds. Serve with pico de gallo and tortillas.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cream the butter with the sugar until light and creamy in color, about 2 minutes in a standing mixer. Add the eggs one at a time to the mixture of the butter and the sugar until it is completely incorporated. In a separate bowl combine the dry ingredients except the sliced almonds. In a third bowl combine the milk with the vanilla extract and the cinnamon. Stir the dry mixture into the wet mixture. Fold in the sliced almonds. Pour the batter into a greased or lightly oiled 9x5x3 inch pan. Bake for 45 minutes to an hour until golden brown. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pan to cool completely on a wire rack.

Boil macaroni and cook until tender. Drain and rinse with cold water. In a large bowl combine macaroni and all other ingredients. Mix well and serve. This recipe has been a family favorite for over 50 years.

Preheat oven to 450f degrees. Spray a baking sheet with pam cooking spray. Place pork chops in pan. Top with mayonnaise and lipton onion soup mix. Top with parmesan cheese. Cook for 15 minutes or until pork is done. Remove from pan.

In a medium sized saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and the white sugar together. Stir in the brown sugar and the vanilla extract until combined and the brown sugar has dissolved and is smooth and creamy in texture. Stir in the egg yolk and the flour and stir until well mixed and the mixture has thickened slightly and is glossy in texture and slightly lumpy in appearance. Remove from heat and set aside and let cool for a minute or two before adding the chocolate chips. Stir the chocolate chips in well until they are coated with the cookie dough mixture and the dough is evenly distributed throughout the mug. Place the mug in the freezer for about a half an hour or until the cookie dough is frozen solid and the cookie dough mixture is stiff and hard. Use a large spoon or a butter knife and remove the cookie dough from the mug by lifting the mug up and out of the cookie dough mixture. Let the cookie dough set for about a half an hour or until the cookie dough is completely stiff and hard. Lift the cookie dough from the mug with a

Cut cucumbers lengthwise into 1/4 inch thick slices. Place in a bowl. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine vinegar, water, sugar and mustard seeds. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Pour mixture over the cucumbers. Stir in tomatoes. Let cool. Refrigerate for several hours to overnight. Place pickled cucumbers on a platter. Place onions over the cucumbers. Sprinkle chilies and pepper over all. Serve with crackers.

Combine hoisin sauce with sambal oelek in a large bowladd scallions and wineand marinate chicken in mixture for at least an hour or up to four hours before cooking. To prepare chicken pieces, pat dry with paper towels and then douse each piece with the marinade and let it sit for one hour or up to four hours. Preheat grill or broilerplace chicken on grill or broiler pan and cook for four minutes on each side. To make chicken breast cutlets, pat dry with paper towels and then douse each piece with the marinade and let it sit for at least one hour or up to four hours before cooking. Preheat grill or broilerplace chicken on grill or broiler pan and cook for four minutes on each side or until done.
To make the sauce combine all ingrediants in a small bowl and whisk to combine. Taste and add hot sauce or lemon juice if desired.

Saute onion in peanut oil. Add cardamom. Add peanut butter. Cook for 10 minutes. Add soy sauce, liquid red pepper seasoning, and 1 cup water. Simmer 5 minutes. Add brown sugar. Stir to dissolve. Serve over steamed vegetables.

Preheat oven to 375f. In large bowl combine all dry ingredients. Stir wet ingredients into the dry mixture. Spoon into paper cupcake liners. Bake for 15 minutes or until toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow to cool before frosting.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Whisk together the whole wheat flour, salt and honey in a large mixing bowl. In a separate bowl whisk together the oil, egg yolks and milk. Pour the oil mixture into the flour mixture and mix well with a wooden spoon. Knead the dough until it is smooth. Form the dough into a ball and let it rest for 15 minutes. Place the dough into a large bowl that has been dusted with flour. Cover the bowl with a tea towel or a plastic bag that has been punched with holes. Let the dough rise for 1 hour. Once the dough has risen, punch it down with your fingers. Divide the dough into two smaller balls. On a lightly floured surface roll out the dough until it is 1/4-inch thick. Place the dough onto a baking sheet that has been dusted with cornmeal. Bake the bread for 30 minutes. Let it cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in an oven-proof skillet over medium heat. Add rosemary, garlic cloves. Cook for 1 minute stirring frequently. Add 1/3 cup balsamic vinegar to skillet. Bring to a simmer. Add chicken breasts. Cook for 4 minutes. Transfer skillet to oven. Cook 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Add remaining 1/4 cup olive oil to skillet. Add 2 teaspoons of balsamic vinegar to skillet. Cook for 1 minute. Add remaining 1/4 cup of balsamic vinegar to skillet. Transfer to serving platter. Sprinkle with coarse black pepper. Garnish with fresh rosemary. Makes 4 servings.

Rinse the snapper fillets with cold water. Dry with paper towel. Salt and pepper each fillet to taste. Place snapper fillets in shallow 13x9-inch pan. In large shallow baking dish mix the buttermilk with the instant potato flakes until smooth. Stir in the garlic. Dip fillets into potato mixture to coat completely. Place fillets on rack of broiler pan. Broil 5 to 6 inches from heat about 7 minutes. Turn fillets overbroil 4 to 5 minutes more or until fish flakes easily when tested with fork. Serve fish on platter with lemon wedges.

Cut lamb into bite size piecesseason with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the lambcook 8-10 minutes or until browned on all sides. Add the onionsaute until tender. Add the beef brothbring to a simmer. Cook, uncovered, over low heat until the lamb is tender, about 1 1/2 hours. Drain the lamb and discard the broth. In a food processor or blender, blend the almonds with the prune and apricots until coarsely chopped. Add the almond mixture to the lambtoss gently until combined. Coverrefrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Serving suggestion: Serve the khoreshe as a main dish with a vegetable of your choice, or as a side dish with your choice of rice or pasta.
Bring water and salt to boil in large saucepan and cook green beans until tender but still firm. Drain. Drizzle with olive oil and toss with garlic and rosemary. Serve hot.

Boil okra in water for 5 minutes then drain. Sauté onions, garlic, ginger, jalapenos in olive oil for five minutes. Add tomatoes then okra. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 45 minutes covered. Serve hot with injera bread or over rice.
In a small bowl mix yogurt with water until it becomes smooth. Cook wheat and egg separately. Mix all together and add mint and parsley. Serve hot.

Brown the beans with the chopped white onion in the oil until tender. Remove from heat. Add the chopped avocado to the beans. Add the hot water to the beans until they are covered. Add the tortillas to the beans. Heat through. Add the white cheese to the beans. Stir. Add the chopped chiles to the beans. Mix well. Add the chopped garlic to the beans. Stir. Heat through. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt butter and mix with sugar and orange zest. Peel and core apples, cut into eighths. Place in a 9-inch pie plate. Sprinkle with tapioca. Add apples. Sprinkle with cranberries. Dot with butter and sprinkle with sugar. Place in oven and bake for 45 minutes or until apples are tender. Cover edges of pie with pastry. Cut 3-4 vents in top crust. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

In a small bowl place the flour, salt and pepper. In a large skillet over medium-high heat melt 2 tablespoons of the butter. Dip the chicken into the flour mixture and shake off excess. Place the chicken in the skillet and saute for about 3 minutes. Remove from the skillet and reserve. In the same skillet over medium-high heat melt the remaining butter. Stir in the white wine and mustard. Cook for about 1 minute. Add the sage leaves. Cook for 30 seconds. Add the reserved chicken and broth. Cover and cook for 4 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Peel potatoes and boil for 15 minutes or until tender. Cool slightly. Scoop out potato and mash with butter and brown sugar until smooth. Add orange juice, zest, nutmeg and coconut. Season with salt and cinnamon. Roll into balls with your hands. Roll each ball in granulated sugar or marshmallows. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375°F. Butter 2 10-inch round casserole dishes. In 1 bowl combine sour cream, mayonnaise, cheese, eggs, salt and pepper. In another bowl combine broccoli, mushrooms and ramen noodles. Place half of the mixture into each casserole dish. Top each with the remaining mixture. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve.

Prepare salad dressing by whisking together raspberry vinegar, sugar and salt. In a small bowl, toss together maytag blue cheese with half of the dressing. Set aside. In a large salad bowl, toss together the lettuce, pears, walnuts and blue cheese dressing. Sprinkle with Tabasco sauce.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cook onion and garlic in olive oil until tender and soften. Stir in tomatoes and season to taste. Add spinach and parsley and cook until spinach is tender. Stir in penne pasta. Pour mixture into a baking dish and place in the oven for 10 minutes until pasta is tender and liquid has evaporated. Sprinkle kalamata olives and serve immediately.

Place mushrooms in a large bowl. Melt butter in a skillet over low heat. Add garlic and cook until tender. Add mushrooms and cook over low heat for 20 minutes or until tender. Strain and reserve liquid. Reserve liquid and mushrooms in separate containers. Blend mushroom mixture with 1/4 cup of the reserved liquid. Add more liquid if necessary. Salt and pepper mixture. Add nutmeg. Blend in whipping cream. Place bread slices on a baking sheet. Brush with mushroom mixture. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until golden.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place a few pieces of chicken in the oil. Cook until golden brown, turning once. Drain on paper towels. In a shallow bowl or pie pan beat egg with milk. Dip each piece of chicken in the egg mixture then in the flour. Place chicken pieces in the hot oil and brown on both sides. Serve with rice.

Cut apricots into quarters. Remove stems and pit halves. Add apricots to a small saucepan with water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until apricots are very soft, about 15 minutes. Remove from heatdrain. In a food processor or blender, purée apricots until smooth (do not purée seeds). Measure out 1 cup of apricot purée. In a small saucepan, combine 1 cup of the apricot purée, sugar, water and lemon juice. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heatadd almond extract and stir until blended. Pour through a fine mesh strainer into a bowl to remove seeds (do not strain through a coffee filter). Refrigerate until thoroughly chilled before serving. In a clean small saucepan, combine 1/2 cup of apricot purée and sugar. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heatstir in remaining apric

Mix dry ingredients. Add raisins and mix well. Add applesauce and mix well. Mix in oatmeal and cinnamon. Form into 18 balls and place 2 inches apart onto greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until firm. Cool on pans 2 minutes then remove from pans and cool completely.

Combine sweet onion and garlic cloves in small bowlmix well. Combine beef base, worcestershire sauce, chili powder, cumin and hickory liquid smokemix well. Combine beer and bottled chili saucemix well. Place beef brisket in large Ziploc bagpour beef base mixture over beef brisketseal bag. Refrigerate at least 4 hours or up to 24 hours before barbecuing. Remove beef brisket from refrigerator 15 to 30 minutes before cooking. Place beef brisket on grill over medium heatcook 1-1/2 hours or until meat thermometer registers 145f (medium rare). Let beef rest 5 to 10 minutes before slicing. Serve warm with remaining barbecue sauce on side. Serve with Texas toast, sliced onions or steamed vegetables.

Cream butter and water together in saucepan. Gradually stir flour into butter mixture until smooth. Stir in salt. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Cook until mixture just begins to pull away from the sides of the pan. Add the flour mixture to the milk mixture all at once. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir constantly for 1 minute. Stir until the mixture thickens. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheets. Place the cookies into the oven. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until the cookies are lightly browned. Cool slightly before eating.

Cook red potatoes until tender. Drain and let cool. Dice potatoes and mix with the onions and celery. Drizzle with oil and vinegar and mix thoroughly. Stir in mayonnaise and yogurt and season with salt and pepper and mix thoroughly. Allow salad to stand for at least 1 hour before serving. Serves about 8-10.

Cut pie crust into 6 even slices (2 pieces of crust). Place 1/3 of a slice of crust into each of 6 greased 2-cup muffin tins. Place 1/2 teaspoon of butter into each of 6 greased 2-cup muffin tins. Place 2 strips of bacon into each of 6 greased 2-cup muffin tins. Place 1 tablespoon of sliced breakfast sausage into each of 6 greased 2-cup muffin tins. Place 1/4 teaspoon of sour cream into each of 6 greased 2-cup muffin tins. Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon of cheese into each of 6 greased 2-cup muffin tins. Crack 1 egg into each of 6 greased 2-cup muffin tins. Repeat layers to fill 6 greased 2-cup muffin tins. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into a center

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Unroll pie crusts. Fill with 1/2 cup spaghetti sauce. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup shredded Mozzarella cheese. Add 1/4 cup sautéed mushrooms. Add 1/4 cup cooked chicken. Fold the sides up and crimp. Bake for 10 minutes. Let cool for 2 minutes. Serve.
Cream butter and sugar together. Beat in egg and lemon juice. Mix in flour and soda. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Remove and cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 375f. Toast hamburger buns. Layer them with tomato slices, celery and onion slices. Layer on tuna fish in water. Top with mayonnaise and shredded cheese. Place in preheated 375f oven for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Add cardamom. Reduce the heat and simmer for five minutes, stirring occasionally. Add coffee and saffron. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for five minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in the rose water. Pour the coffee into cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix the macaroni and cheese mix with the milk and butter until smooth. Mix in the broccoli cheese soup. Fill a greased 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. (You can also microwave this at 100% for 6 minutes.) Let sit for about 5 minutes. Top with the cooked hamburger meat and broccoli.

Rinse shrimp under cold water. Pat dry with paper towels. Season with salt and pepper. Combine remaining ingredients except tomato paste. Heat oil in large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and saute until opaque and just cooked through, about 2 minutes per side. Remove from heat. Stir tomato paste into reserved liquid. Spoon over shrimp and serve.

Boil water with rice in a 4-cup measuring cup until rice is tender. Drain. Return rice to the measuring cup. Stir in butter until melted. Add milk. Stir in vanilla. Stir in salt. Whisk together eggs & cream. Stir eggs mixture into rice mixture. Transfer to a buttered 2-quart baking dish. Bake at 325 degrees for 20 minutes or until set. Sprinkle with cinnamon.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and celerysaute 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in carrotsaute 1 minute longer. Add stewed tomatoes and brothbring to a boil. Add thymeseason with salt and cayenne. Cook 4 minutes or until tender. Add chickenreturn to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer 10 minutes or until chicken is tender. Drain and discard vegetables in saucepankeep warm. Stir in remaining brothpour into 6 individual bowls. Top each bowl of chicken with 1/2 cup vegetable mixture. Serve with rice or biscuits.

To prepare this recipe you will need a 1-quart jar (or other similar sized container). Chop the garlic clove into tiny pieces. Place the tomatoes in the jar. Add the chopped garlic clove. In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice, sugar, extra virgin olive oil, savory, red pepper flakes and salt. Stir well to mix. Pour the marinade over the tomatoes. Cap the jar tightly. Store in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. Remove from the refrigerator 30 minutes prior to serving. Enjoy!

Combine the first 3 ingredients, mix well, spread in bottom of 8 x 8 x 2 glass baking dish. Combine the cheese and brandy, stir well, mix with the cream cheese spread and spread over the pineapple mixture. Sprinkle with the ginger and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a medium sized bowl combine sour cream, flour and sugar until well blended. In another bowl combine corn, beef, onions and cheese. Pour sour cream mixture into corn mixture until well blended. Pour into a lightly sprayed 2 quart casserole dish. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until casserole is bubbly and topping is browned.

Trim broccoli florets and cut into small florets. Chop onion and separate florets and slices into small pieces. Combine all salad dressing ingredients and mix well. Pour dressing over broccoli and onion and mix well. Refrigerate several hours to allow flavors to blend. Serve on a bed of lettuce with seedless raisins and sunflower seeds on top.

Stir together oil, warm water, honey, maple-flavor syrup and salt in large bowl. Add yeast and stir to dissolve. Add oatmeal, flour and raisins. Mix well. Turn dough out onto floured surface. Knead 15-20 minutes. Add more flour as needed. Place in greased bowl. Cover with plastic wrap or towel. Let rise in warm place free from drafts until doubled in bulk. Punch down. Divide dough into 2 pieces. Shape each piece into round loaf. Place in greased 9 x 5 inch loaf pans. Cover with plastic wrap or towel. Let rise until doubled. Bake at 375 degrees for 35-40 minutes. Remove from pans. Cool before slicing.

Brown sausage in a large saucepan. Add zucchini and squash and saute until soft. Stir in the water and beef broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add in the garbanzo beans and the tubettini pasta. Cook until the pasta is tender. Stir in the jar of pasta sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Soften the gluten in a large pot with the water. Drain it well. Add the vegetable oil. Add the nutritional yeast. Stir well. Add the cumin powder. Continue to stir well. Add the onion powder. Add the garlic powder. Add the mushroom stock. Add the soy sauce. Add the worcestershire sauce. Mix well. Add the salt. Mix well. Spoon the mixture into a greased loaf pan. Cover with foil. Bake in a 350-degree oven for 40-45 minutes. Allow the loaf to cool. Use a sharp knife to slice the loaf into logs. Serve.

In a large soup pot melt olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic cloves to the soup pot when it is hot. Cook garlic cloves for 3 minutes until garlic is very fragrant, do not allow the garlic to turn brown. Add chicken broth to the soup potbring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer soup for 20 minutes or until garlic cloves are softened. Add salt and pepper to taste. In a small bowl, crack an egg into the mixture, using a spoon to stir it into the soup. Remove garlic cloves from the soup pot. Using a fork, crumble the bread into the soup potstir to combine bread cubes with broth mixture. Cook for an additional 10 minutes or until bread cubes are very softened. Serve soup in large bowls with crusty bread.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Place potato cubes into a bowl. Add sour cream, cream, salt, pepper, Parmesan and cheddar. Mix well. Pour into a greased baking dish. Sprinkle with chives. Bake for 45 minutes.

Place the chicken in a large bowl and cover with cold wateradd the lemon juice and saltrefrigerate for at least an hour and up to overnight. Drain the chicken, reserving the juices in a small bowl. Finely chop the celery and onion and add them to the chicken with the juices and the remaining ingredientsmix well. Taste and season with more lemon juice and salt if desired. Serve on lettuce leaves or over a bed of rice and garnish with the almonds and mandarin oranges, if desired.

Preheat the oven to 180c. In a large bowl using a hand held whisk cream butter with brown sugar and vanilla essence. Add egg and mix well. Sift in self raising flour. Add chocolate chips and mix well. Place tablespoons of dough onto a greased baking tray. Cook for approximately 10 minutes. Remove from tray to cool. Serve warm.
Blend together all ingredients. Pour into glasses and serve.

Cut each log into 6 to 8 slices. Place one slice of marshmallow creme on each slice. Place 3-4 caramels on each slice. Roll each slice in powdered sugar. Place one slice on top of the other and roll together. Melt margarine. Dip the roll in the melted margarine and place on wax paper. Repeat with the remaining logs.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cook spinach according to package directions. Drain well. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine the eggs and cottage cheese. Add the flour until combined. Add the cooked spinach, onion mixture and the shredded cheese. Mix until combined. Pour into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until set. Let stand for about 10 minutes before cutting. Serve warm.

Trim the leaves of the spinach and place the spinach leaves in a large bowl. Place the beans and garlic cloves on top of the spinach. In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice and balsamic vinegar. Drizzle the olive oil over the beans and spinach. Add the lemon mixture and season to taste with salt and black pepper. Transfer to a serving dish and serve with toasted baguette.
Boil salt cod fish in a pot of water for 10 minutes. Remove and drain. Slice and add to scrambled eggs. Season with bacon, green peppers, and tomato. Serve with toast.

Prepare a medium size baking dish by lining with foil or parchment paper. Place the cut side of the eggplant directly into the baking dish. Drizzle about two teaspoons of oil over the eggplant. Sprinkle with a tablespoon of soy sauce, half the chili paste, a pinch of salt and a pinch of pepper. Roast for about 40 minutes or until soft. Remove from oven. Place a large bowl atop the oven so it will stay warm. Stir the roasted eggplant with a fork to loosen the flesh. Add the remaining chili paste, lime juice, palm sugar, soy sauce and a pinch of pepper. Mash the mixture with the back of a fork to break down the flesh. Garnish with the chopped green onions. Serve with fresh cilantro leaves.

Remove tough ends of asparagus. Remove woody ends of shiitake mushrooms. Toss asparagus and shiitake mushrooms with coarse salt. In a large bowl toss asparagus with extra virgin olive oil and balsamic vinegar to coat well. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Arrange asparagus on baking sheet with shiitake mushrooms. Roast for 15 minutes or until tender, turning once halfway through. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper to taste.
Mix all ingredients together. Cook on stove top for about 5 minutes. Or microwave on high for 5 minutes. Serves about 4.

Bring 1 inch of water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add rice and boil for 1 minute. Drain rice in a colander and return to the saucepan. Add 1 cup stock and return rice to the pan. Cover the pan and cook over low heat for 15 minutes. Add 1 cup more stock and cook for 10 minutes. Add 1 cup more stock and cook until all the stock has been absorbed. Continue cooking over low heat until the rice is tender. Add leek and cook for 5 minutes. Add saffron strands and cook for 5 more minutes. Stir in peas and cook for 5 more minutes. Add lemon zest and lemon juice. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Add butter and toss with a rubber spatula. Serve.

Heat the olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until soft. Add the rice and sauté for 3-4 minutes. Stir in the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cover partially with a lid. Cook for about 15 minutes. Remove the lid. Add the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cover partially with a lid. Cook for about 15 minutes. Remove the lid. Add the rice. Add the cream of chicken soup and stir well. Stir in the cheese and continue to simmer for 1-2 minutes. Place in a greased 2 quart casserole dish. Top with a little more cheese. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20-25 minutes. Remove from the oven. Let stand for 5 minutes. Remove the pie from the dish. Cut into slices. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C. Grease and line a 20cm square cake tin with baking paper. Beat together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time and beat after each addition. Add the self-raising flour and beat until just combined. Add the lemon juice and lemon zest and beat until just combined. Pour the batter into the cake tin and bake for 15-20 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the cake comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Sift icing sugar over the top and decorate with a lemon slice.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Meanwhile brown beef with onion and green pepper. Add tomatoes and tomato paste. Bring to boil. Add noodles and cook 5-7 minutes. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese.

Boil 4 cups of water in the pot. Add salt to taste. When the water is boiling, add the noodles. Cook until tender. When the noodles are cooked, drain the water and set aside. Remove the leaves from the thyme, basil and parsley. Chop them up with scissors. Place the noodles on a serving plate. Add the herb leaves to the noodles. Add the butter to the noodles. Mix the noodles together.

Mix flax seed meal and splenda together in a bowl and blend. Stir in almond flour and cinnamon. Mix well and put mixture on wax paper. Press mixture firmly with your fingers or a rolling pin. Let dry at least 4 hours or overnight. Cut into squares and enjoy!
Place chicken in a plastic bag or bowl with marinade and let marinate for at least an hour. Grill or bake until cooked through. Serve with your favorite baked potato and green beans.

Cook onion in butter until tender. Add broccoli and cook until crisp tender. Add rice and cook stirring for about 3 minutes. Stir soup into rice. Add milk. Cook until heated through. Stir cheese into rice. Broil until heated through.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch pieces. Toss with mayonnaise. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use. Just before serving, mix in sour cream. Add dill, celery, onion, salt and pepper. Toss gently to blend. Serve.

In a pan over medium heat melt butter and saute shallots until softened add garlic and cook for 1 min. Add beans and parsley and cook for about 3 min., stirring constantly until beans are warm. In a small bowl whisk together vinegar and mustard and add to beans. Cook for another 10 min until liquid has reduced slightly and beans are warmed through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. To serve drizzle with olive oil and garnish with chopped parsley if desired.

Remove stems from shiitake mushrooms. Slice mushrooms thinly and set aside. In a large saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Sauté mushrooms until they are tender. Sprinkle with soy sauce to taste. Transfer shiitake mushrooms to a large bowl. Pour broth into the same saucepan with oil left over from mushrooms. Bring broth to a boil over medium heat. Cook until broth is reduced to 1 cup. Remove from heat. Dissolve cornstarch with 1 tablespoon water over low heat until smooth. Stir into hot broth mixture until thickened slightly. Stir in sliced mushrooms and reserved broth. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Cook 1-2 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly. Remove from heat and stir in spinach until wilted. Serve with soba noodles or rice noodles.

Clean and slice squash. Heat a pan with olive oil. Add sausage and brown on both sides. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Add squash and oregano. Cover and cook until squash is tender. Add italian salad dressing and cook until heated through. Serve on slices of italian bread. Top with cheese.

Boil butter in a saucepan. Add rice. Cook covered for 10 min. Uncover and cook for 20 min more. Add water and seasonings. Cook for another 15 min or until all the water has been absorbed. Fold in peas and parsley. Serve and enjoy.

Preheat the broiler. Cut the squash in half lengthwise. Brush the cut sides of the squash with cooking spray. Broil the squash halves cut side down. Broil until the squash is tender. Remove from the broiler. Place the squash halves in a large bowl. Add the rice, onion, rosemary and garlic. Combine. Melt the butter. Add the rice mixture. Stir in the stock. Cook over medium heat stirring frequently until the rice is tender. Add the cream cheese. Cook until the cheese is melted. Stir in the balsamic vinegar. Serve.

Make pie crusts according to package directions. Set aside. In a medium bowl beat eggs and sweetened condensed milk together. Stir in melted butter and pecans. Pour mixture evenly into two pie crusts. Top each with a piece of chocolate. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes or until filling is set. Let cool slightly. Top with ice cream topping and pecan halves. Store in refrigerator.

Soak dry lentils in water for several hours. Drain and set aside. Brown ground beef. Add onion soup mix and brown. Stir in salt. Drain. Stir in water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cook for about 20 minutes. Stir in lentils. Add vinegar, prepared mustard, garlic clove and ketchup. Cook until tender. Serves four to six.

Wash potatoes well. Cut potatoes in half. Place potatoes in a large sauce pan. Fill with cold water until water covers potatoes by 1/2 inch. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low simmer. Cook 15-20 minutes. Drain potatoes. In a large bowl, mix potatoes with condensed soup. Add sour cream. Add half the shredded Cheddar cheese. Add remaining potatoes. Add remaining shredded cheese. Combine butter with 2 Tbsp. of flour. Stir into potato mixture. Bake 40 minutes at 400 degrees. Top with remaining 1/2 Tbsp. of flour and remaining 1/2 cup of shredded Cheddar. Bake 5-10 minutes more or until golden brown.

Wash and dry tuna steaks and season with salt and pepper to taste. Spray an outdoor grill with vegetable oil spray and place tuna steaks on grill. Cook over medium heat for about 4 minutes on each sideturning only once. Meanwhile mix the lime juice and olive oil together and pour over tuna steaks after the second turn over on the grill. Cook for another few minutes and serve. Serve with rice and peas and green salad if desired. This tastes great with homemade jerk sauce as well.

Drain the navy beans. Place the beans in the bottom of a 2 quart baking dish. Mix the brown sugar, catsup and barbecue sauce together. Spoon this mixture over the beans. Mix the dry mustard and water together and pour this over the beans. Add the bacon on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 45-50 minutes or until the beans are tender. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

1. In a small bowl, toss orange and avocado with 2 tablespoons of white balsamic vinegar.2. In a large bowl, combine red leaf lettuce with remaining 1 tablespoon of white balsamic vinegar.3. Divide salad into 2 bowls and top with avocado orange mixture. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place chicken breasts in the bottom of a 4 quart slow cooker. Top with 1 slice of ham and 1 slice of cheese. In a mixing bowl, combine the soup and milk. Pour mixture over the ham and cheese. Sprinkle with garlic powder and onion powder. Top with the remaining ham and cheese. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Cover and cook on low setting for 6 hours or until tender. Serve with rice or potatoes.

Trim broccoli of leaves, stalks, and tough ends. Break broccoli into small pieces. Chop almonds coarsely. Peel oranges. Thinly slice the orange segments. Mince green onion. Whisk together orange juice and zest in a small bowladd to broccoli. Add nuts, orange slices, and minced onion to broccoli. Toss with vinegar mixture and olive oil to coat. Sprinkle with salt and freshly ground pepper to taste. Let stand for about 30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to develop.

Preheat oven to 170c. Grease three loaf pans with butter or cooking spray. In the bowl of an electric mixer (or with a hand mixer) cream butter until pale and fluffy. Gradually add brown sugar and continue beating until light and fluffy. Add white chocolate and golden syrup - beat until completely incorporated. Beat in eggs one at a time - do not overbeat. Sift flour, baking powder and cocoa powder together - fold into mixture with cream. Divide between prepared loaf pans - place one loaf in each pan - smooth the surface with the back of a spoon - place loaf pans on middle shelf of oven - cook for approximately 1 hour or until loaf springs back when lightly pressed - cool for 10 minutes before transferring to wire rack to cool completely. Once cool slice into slices using serrated knife - serve with thickened cream - store any remaining mud cake loafs wrapped in plastic wrap in the refrigerator for up to one week - to store cake uncut, wrap

Drain chick-peas and place in a bowl. Add garlic cloves and coriander and grinder. Mix well. Add salt and pepper. Then mix in the chives. Form into patties and fry in a hot frying pan in oil for about 5 minutes on each side until golden. Serve.

Wash and dry apples, cut them into slices and put them on a plate. Put butter and brown sugar on top of each slice of apple and place on a plate. Sprinkle cinnamon and cardamom on top of each apple and drizzle with raisins and more cinnamon and cardamom. Bake for about 15 minutes until apples are soft and golden and serve immediately with ice cream.
Butter bread and place in toaster. Remove and add chutney and ham and cheese. Add butter to the toaster and toast until golden. Serve immediately.

Clean asparagus and cut into 1 inch pieces. Place in a shallow glass dish and add ham and salt and pepper to taste. Cover dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. The next day remove plastic wrap and cook asparagus over a medium heat on grill until tender. Meanwhile beat eggs and add a little butter. Place asparagus on a serving platter and top with eggs and butter. Serve hot.

Mix yeast to water in one cup of flour. Stir in remaining flour. Mix in oil. Add sugar. Stir in eggs. Turn onto floured board. Knead until smooth. Add more flour as needed to make dough stick together. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled. Punch down. Shape dough into rolls. Let rise until doubled. Bake at 375 degrees about 15 minutes.
In a medium bowl combine the tomatoes, yogurt and capers. In another medium bowl combine the remaining ingredients and whisk well. Pour over tomatoes. Toss to coat. Serve.

Cream butter with sugar until fluffy. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Combine all-purpose flour with cocoa, amaretto and almonds. Stir into butter mixture until combined well. Spread batter evenly in ungreased 10-x-15-in. jelly-roll pan. Bake at 350f for 20-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool completely on wire rack. Cut in squares while still warm or store in tightly covered container in refrigerator for up to a week or freeze for up to two months.

Brown the meat and onion together. Drain the excess fat. Add the zucchini. Mix together with seasonings. Pour into greased pie pan. Mix bisquick with water and pour over meat mixture. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until set. Serve with catsup or ketchup. Great with salad.

Peel potatoes and slice into thin rounds (about 1/8 inch thick). Place potato slices in a bowl and add milk and saltmix well and set aside for at least an hour (up to overnight). Drain potatoes and pat dry with paper towels. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large bowl add flour and dried breadcrumbsseason with salt and pepperwhisk together until well blended. In another large bowl add eggs, milk and butterwhisk together until well combined. Add potatoestoss until well coated. Heat a large skillet with butteradd potato mixture and cook until browned on both sides (about 15-20 minutes). Add bacon and onioncook until bacon is crisp and onions are tender (about 10 minutes). Transfer potatoes from skillet onto a large cookie sheetspread out on a single layer onto cookie sheet (in a single layer) and sprinkle with cheese. Bake in preheated oven for about 20 minutesstir once half

Preheat oven to 425f. Whisk together all wet ingredients in a medium bowl. Whisk together all dry ingredients in another medium bowl. Dip chicken in wet mixture, then in dry mixture. Place chicken in a single layer in a 9x13 baking dish sprayed with cooking spray or brushed with olive oil. Bake 20 to 25 minutes until done (the chicken will not be completely done). Let cool before slicing. Serve with your choice of dipping sauce (sriracha sauce is a good choice).
Cut biscuits into quarters. Mix sugar and cinnamon. Roll each quarter in sugar mixture. Roll in nuts. Place in ungreased baking dish. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes.

In a large bowl beat egg white until soft peaks form. Fold in sour cream and brown sugar. Stir in the cocoa and coffee granules and vanilla extract. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or until firm. Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.

Stem the figs. Heat the marsala wine and 2 tablespoons of honey with the orange blossom water and creme fraiche. Dip the figs into the sauce and leave to marinate for 30 minutes. Arrange the figs with the orange slices. Sprinkle with mint leaves.

Bring 2 cups water to a boil in a saucepan. Stir in the rice, salt, onion soup mix and margarine. Bring back to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes or until all of the water is absorbed. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Place half of the cherry pie filling in the bottom of the pie pan. Place the other half of the cherry pie filling on top of the first half in the pie pan. Top with the quick-cooking oats. Sprinkle the brown sugar evenly over the oat mixture. Place the bisquick baking mix evenly over the brown sugar mixture. Arrange the nuts in rows over the bisquick mixture. Sprinkle with the cinnamon. Melt the butter in the microwave and brush the top of the crumble mixture with the melted butter. Bake at 350 for about 45 minutes or until the top crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly hot. Cool and serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Heat the clarified butter in a heavy bottomed pot over medium-low heat until melted and slightly foamy (about 30 seconds). Add the flour and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly. Gradually whisk in the chicken stock with a heavy whisk until blended and bubbly. Cook for 2 minutes until thickened. Add the whipping cream, sour cream, chicken base, jalapeno juice and the cheese blend. Heat to boiling stirring constantly. Simmer 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with chicken or fish.

Cream together butter and egg white. Add in almonds and mix well. In a separate bowl combine flour and baking powdergradually stir flour mixture into butter mixture. Stir in remaining egg white. Drop by teaspoon onto wax paper or buttered cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire rack. Roll in powdered sugar before serving.

In a large mixing bowl, combine all the vegetables and tempeh with the soy mayonnaise and mustard. Mix well. Add salt & pepper to taste. Serve on sandwiches or as a side dish. Serves 6 as a side dish or 4 as an entree.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Whisk together all dry ingredients in medium bowlset aside. Whisk together all wet ingredients in another medium bowl until combinedset aside. In small saucepan over medium heat melt the vegetable oil. Add the cocoa powder to the melted oil, whisking constantly until it turns from powdery to smooth and glossy, about 1 minute. Add the oil mixture to the wet mixture in 3 parts, whisking after each addition until blended. Fold in the chocolate chips. Line two 15x10x1-inch baking sheets with parchment paper, leaving overhang on two sides. Set aside. Using an electric mixer on low speed, beat the eggs until foamy. Add the oil mixture in two batches, beating until combined after each addition. With a rubber spatula, fold in the flour mixture until combined. Divide the batter evenly between the two prepared pans, smoothing the batter into the prepared pans. Bake until puffed and shiny, about 15 minutes for the first pan

Cook the sausages in a pan. Cut the sausages into pieces. Heat a little oil in a pan. Add the vegetables. Saute for a couple of minutes. Add the sausage pieces. Add flour and curry powder. Stir well. Add hot water to make a thick sauce. Cook for a few minutes. Serve with boiled rice.

Bring 4 quarts of water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add macaroni and cook for 7 to 9 minutes or until tender. Drain and reserve about 1/4 cup of pasta water. Return pasta to pot and stir to coat with butter. Stir in hot sauce and a pinch of salt and pepper. Add milk and stir until smooth. Stir in reserved water and cook until thickened. Stir in 2 cups of cheese until melted. Serve topped with remaining cheese.

Bring a large pot of well-salted water to a boil. Add snow peas, tiny peas and blanch for 3 minutes. Drain. In a medium bowl, combine butter, salt and pepper. Toss the peas into the butter mixture and toss again to coat evenly. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease an 8-by-8-inch square pan or line with a lightly greased piece of parchment or foil paper and grease the parchment or foil. Beat butter and sugar together with an electric mixer until fluffy and creamy. Beat in brown sugar and vanilla. Whisk eggs in a medium bowl and add to the butter mixture. Mix in flour and baking powder. Fold in mini chocolate chips and then pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely in pan and then refrigerate for 45 minutes to 1 hour before cutting into 16 brownies. Makes 16 brownies.

Mix dry ingredients. Cream butter and sugars. Add eggs and vanilla. Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture. Mix well. Stir in oatmeal. Form mixture into small balls and roll in nuts. Place balls on ungreased cookie sheet about 3 inches apart. Bake in 350 degree oven 8 to 10 minutes or until light brown.

In a large bowl combine cream cheese and cherry jell-o mix. Beat until light and fluffy. Spread into an 8x11 pan. Press pecans into mixture. Pour cola over mixture. Chill for 2 hours. Remove from mold. Store in refrigerator.

Bring broccoli soup to room temperature. In saucepan, melt butter over low heat. Stir in soup mixture. Increase heat until mixture is hot and bubbling. Stir in half-and-half. Add garlic powder. In a large mixing bowl, combine noodles with soup mixture. Stir until noodles are completely covered with soup mixture. Add more soup mixture if necessary. Transfer into lightly greased casserole dish. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over top. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for approximately 30 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve hot.

Heat olive oil in large saut pan. Add orange roughy fillets and saute until cooked through. Remove fish from pan. Add fresh chopped parsley, red pepper flakes, cherry tomatoes, kalamata olives and capers. Cook for 1 minute. Add fish back to pan. Pour white wine over fish. Cook for 1 minute. Serve fish over rice.

In a saut pan, melt the butter over medium heat until it foams. Add the garlic cloves to the pan and let them sizzle until golden. Meanwhile, peel the figs, removing the stems. When the garlic is golden brown, add the shrimp. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until the shrimp are opaque and the shells are just pink at the tips. When the shrimp is cooked, add the horseradish and the figs to the pan. Cook for about one minute until the figs have softened. Pour the oil into the pan and add the mustard. Toss until combined. Remove from the heat, add the shrimp mixture to the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Season the shrimp mixture with more salt and pepper to taste. Mix on medium-low speed until combined. Serve the shrimp over rice.

In large pot over high heat, cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. In same pot, heat olive oil. Add onion and cook until soft. Stir in black-eyed peas and cook until heated through. Stir in rice and tomatoes. Bring to simmer. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 20 minutes stirring occasionally. Stir in hot sauce and season with black pepper, garlic powder and salt. Cook until heated through. Serve over rice.
Boil potatoes until tender. Cool. Drain. Cut into medium dice. Add dressingtoss lightly. Add celery, green onions, and cooked hard boiled eggs. Chill 4 hours. Makes 6 cups.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Wash and scrub potatoes. Pierce each potato with a fork. Place potatoes in a large glass bowl and drizzle with 1 teaspoon olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Bake 20 minutes. Top each potato with 1 tablespoon low-fat yogurt. Top with sun-dried tomato, kalamata olives and feta. Sprinkle with herb seasoning and ground black pepper. Bake 20 minutes more until potatoes are tender. Serve.
Preheat broiler. Butter one side of each slice of bread. Top with cheeses. Broil for 1 minute to 1 1/2 minutes. Spread remaining butter on unbuttered sides. Top each sandwich with a basil leaf.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Put beans in a large saucepan and cover with water. Add onion and garlic to the water and bring to a boil. Boil for 10 minutes. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Drain and reserve bacon grease in pan. Increase heat to high and add bacon to the pan. Cook 2 minutes. Add butter and chicken broth to pan and bring to a boil. Add green beans to pan and cook 2 minutes. Add garlic and bacon and cook 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper to taste and add tabasco sauce to taste. Transfer to baking dish. Cook until green beans are tender and bacon is crisp. Serve hot.

Boil potatoes and cut into cubes. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet. Add the onions and potatoes. Stir frequently. Add the seasoned stuffing mix and the garlic salt. Add water. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the parsley flakes and pimento and stir well. Cook 5-7 minutes longer. Serve over steamed rice. Top with cheese.

Heat a large skillet over medium heatcook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan with a slotted spoondrain on paper towelsset aside. Add oil to panswirl to coat. Add onion and garliccook 3 minutes, stirring frequently. Add cabbagecook 1 minute, stirring frequently. Add waterbring to a boil over high heatcover panreduce heat to medium-lowcook 5 minutes or until cabbage is tender-crisp. Drain cabbage in a colander set in sinktransfer to a platecool completely. Peel 1 potatocut into 1/2-inch-thick slicesplace in a medium bowlset aside. Peel remaining 1/2 potatocut into 1/4-inch-thick slicesplace in a small bowlset aside. Boil pierogies in a large saucepan of water until tenderdrain welltransfer to a large bowlset aside. Add bacon to bowl with pierogiestoss to coat. Add onion mixture to bowl with pierogies

Sprinkle salt and pepper on each fillet and coat with flour. Heat olive oil in skillet until hotsaute fillets in hot oil for 3 minutes per sidetransfer to baking sheet and bake in 350 degree oven for 5 minutes or until flaky and hot in centerremove from baking sheet and top each fillet with lemon juice and soy sauceplace in warm oven for 5 minutesremove from oven and top each fillet with melted butter and parsley and egg yolkreturn to oven and bake for 3 minutes or until egg yolk is cooked and bubblesserve at once.

Cream together butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla extract. Mix in flour and baking soda. Add baby ruths. Roll the dough into 1-inch balls and place 12 balls into two lightly greased 8-inch round pans. Flatten the balls with your hands. Bake at 350 for about 18 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes before transferring to racks to cool completely. Yields about 24 cookies.

Cut oranges into sections and remove peels. In a large mixing bowl combine the water, sugar and oranges. Cover with plastic wrap and allow to rest in refrigerator for at least one hour or overnight. (The longer the orange stays in the mixture, the more flavorful the bread will be). Drain oranges from mixture and reserve the syrup for another use (see tip). In a large mixing bowl combine the egg, milk, salt and nuts and beat well. In a separate large mixing bowl combine the flour, baking powder, orange syrup and butter. Mix well with a wooden spoon until the batter is smooth. Fold in the egg-milk mixture and stir until incorporated. Pour the batter into two greased bread pans or one greased loaf pan. Bake at 400 degrees for approximately 45 minutes or until a tester inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean. (Allow the loaves to cool in the pans for about 5 minutes before removing). Serves 8. Note : the drier the oranges are the more flavorful the bread will be.

Season the chicken breast with the fish sauce and brown in a large pan. Remove the pan from the heat and set aside. Prepare the coconut milk mixture by heating the coconut milk with the curry paste and the sweet basil. Bring to a boil then reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Add the eggplant and simmer for a further 15 minutes. Return the pan to the heat and stir in the chicken. Add the spaghetti. Cook for 2 minutes. Toss the curry through the spaghetti and serve. Sprinkle with some fresh basil.

Cook potatoes in a saucepan of boiling salted water until tender. Drain. Let cool slightly. Smash potatoes with a potato masher. Mix together the light butter spread and nonfat milk. Stir in the nonfat sour cream. Add the bacon bits and fresh chives. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Stir.

Cook hamburger until no longer pink. Drain. Drain water from spaghetti noodles. Add broth to noodles. Cook according to package directions. Meanwhile, saute onion and mushrooms in butter. Stir in basil and seasonings. Add to hamburger. Stir in tomato paste. Add noodles to mixture. Cook according to package directions. Stir in water to thin to desired thickness. Serve with additional basil. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 325. In large bowl combine flour, baking powder and salt. Beat in milk until blended. Stir in egg and walnuts. Shape into balls. Roll in olive oil. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 10-12 min or until golden. Makes 6.

Crush oreos in a resealable plastic bag and crumble. Beat cream cheese in a large bowl until fluffy. Add sugar and beat well. Add milk and vanilla. Fold in oreo crumbs. Pour into a 2 quart baking dish. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour or until set. Beat Cool Whip and add vanilla pudding. Mix well. Spread over pudding and refrigerate at least 3 hours. Before serving, sprinkle with crushed oreos.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees. Grease a 1.5 ltr baking dish. Cut bread into 2 inch cubes. Place in a shallow dish. In a bowl beat eggs. Add caster sugar and vanilla essence. Whisk until light and fluffy. Add bread cubes and fold in gently. Spoon mixture into prepared dish. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and bake for 45 minutes. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg. Serve warm with cream.

Cook penne according to package directionsdrain and set aside. Meanwhile, heat sauce in large skillet over medium heatbring to simmering. Add sun-dried tomatoes and baconcook 4 minutes or until bacon is crisp. Stir in pennecook 5 minutes or until hot. Sprinkle with basilseason with pepper.

Cream margarine with golden syrup over low heat until lightly brown. Pour over desiccated coconut. Add glace cherries & chocolate chips. Stir until evenly coated with golden syrup mix. Place on a tray & press down firmly with your hands or roll into balls. Roll in desiccated coconut then press into rice bubbles (cornflakes) & coat with more desiccated coconut. Keep refrigerated. Makes about 35 crackles.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Dust work surface with flour and kneed flour into a soft ball. Make a well in middle of ball of dough and add ricotta cheese. Kneed until smooth. Add 2 beaten eggs and kneed until smooth and elastic. On a floured surface, roll out dough to about 1/4 inch thickness. Cut into 1 inch pieces and roll gently in flour. Boil in salted water for 2 minutes or until they float to the top. Drain and place in a bowl of ice water and let stand 5 minutes. In a large pan heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Saute garlic and add 2 cups of marinara sauce. Add gnocchi and toss until coated in sauce. Remove from heat and add 2 cups of mozzarella and parmesan cheese. Serve.

Sift dry ingredients. Mix with half of the half-and-half in a bowl. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in remaining half-and-half, butter and vanilla. Pour into pie shell and sprinkle with ground cinnamon.

In a small bowl combine the brown sugar, salt and 1 cup of the ice cream. Stir until well blended. Drizzle the vanilla ice cream into 6- to 8-ounce serving bowls. Spoon the peach mixture over the ice cream. Add remaining ice cream. Serve immediately.

In a mixing bowl combine braunschweiger sausage, cream cheese, green onions, milk and worcestershire sauce. Use an electric mixer to blend until smooth. Mix in garlic powder. Serve with crackers. This will keep for several days in the refrigerator. Just warm up and serve. You will find yourself making this time after time.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onions, garlic powder, paprika and bacon. Cook, stirring occasionally for about 5 minutes. Add potato. Cook for another 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low. Stir in cream. Simmer for 10 minutes or until slightly thickened. Remove from heat. Add eggs. Stir. Pour mixture into 8 x 8 baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool for 10 minutes. Serve warm.
Stir Bisquick, granulated sugar, egg, milk together. Mix in the walnuts. Drop by spoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine oil and onion. Cook and stir for 3 minutes or until tender. Add carrot and oregano. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Add quinoa and chicken broth. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Simmer uncovered for about 12 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat. Add peas. Stir in lemon juice and black pepper. Serve warm.

Mix breadcrumbs and beef together. Add egg and mushroom soup. Mix well and add mushrooms and season with salt and pepper. Make into patties and brown in hot greased pan on each side. Mix cheese into gravy and pour over patties.

Soak pigeon peas overnight. Add to pot and cover with water and cook until peas are soft. Remove from pot. Add meat to pot. Cook until meat is tender. Add pigeon peas back to pot. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook for another 30 minutes. Add thyme, marjoram and cornflour to pot. Cook for 15 more minutes or until cornflour is cooked. Remove pot from heat. Add butter to pot. Serve hot with a slice of bread or salt bread.

Cut 2 eggs in half. Put in a baking dish. Mix the other eggs with the curry powder. Dip the eggs into the mixture. Put them into a baking dish. Put butter into a sauce pan. Add onions to the pan and cook until soft. Add the flour and salt. Stir with a whisk. Add the vinegar. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the water and the curry mixture. Cook for 2 minutes. Pour over the eggs. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes or until the liquid is bubbly. Serve hot or cold.
Sauté scallions in extra virgin olive oil. Remove from heat and stir in egg yolk and egg whites. Fold in bay shrimp. Cook on low heat until just set. Top with low-fat Swiss cheese.

Preheat oven to 350F. Cut butternut squash in half lengthwise and then scoop out the insides. Place squash halves cut-side down on an ungreased 13 x 9-inch baking pan. In a large saucepan, cook the onions and carrots in the oil until tender. Stir in the broth. Add the squash and bring to boilingreduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add baking soda and cinnamon. Transfer the squash halves to bowlsscoop out the flesh and discard the skins. Add the squash flesh and half-and-half to the broth. Season to taste. Transfer to a blender and blend until smooth. Serve hot.

Rinse sea bass fillet with cold water. Pat dry with paper towel. In a small bowl combine orange juice, tomato paste and vegetable oil. Mix well then pour over fillet. In a small bowl combine brown sugar, garlic cloves, orange zest and gingermix well then sprinkle over fillet. Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add hot red pepper flakes to olive oilcook for 1 minute stirring constantly. Pour oil mixture over filletcover and marinate for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine vinegar and waterstir well. In a small bowl combine brown sugar, garlic cloves, orange zest and gingermix well then sprinkle over fillet. Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add hot red pepper flakes to olive oilcook for 1 minute stirring constantly. Pour oil mixture over filletcover and marinate for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine vinegar and waterstir well. Drizzle marinade over filletcover

Wash and peel potatoes. Cut into bite size pieces and place in a plastic bag with the olive oil and garlic. Seal and marinate for at least one hour. Grill over medium heat for 10 to 15 minutes or until tender.

Mix tomatoes, garlic cloves, hot sauce, butter and basil leaves in food processor bowl. Pulse until mixture is blended but still somewhat chunky in consistency. Season with salt and pepper. Place salmon fillets in baking dish. Top with tomato mixture. Sprinkle with bay leaf. Bake in preheated oven for about 18 minutes. Drain tomato mixture on paper towels before serving. Serve salmon with tomato mixture.

Preheat oven to 350deg. Place pecans into a large shallow dish. Add egg white and whisk until foamy and almost white. Add enough water to make mixture about 1 cup thick. Add brown and white sugars and salt to pecans and stir to coat well. Spread pecans into a single layer on a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until a light golden brown. Immediately stir pecans around with a fork. Place back on cookie sheet and sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake an additional 10 minutes.

In a medium saucepan melt butter over medium heat. Stir in brown sugar. Whisk in heavy cream until combined. Add salt. Bring mixture to a boil while stirring constantly. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat. Stir in chopped almonds. Pour mixture into a greased 9x13 pan. Allow fudge to set up for at least 4 hours. Cut into squares.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add mushrooms and cook until mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes. Add broth and cook for 1 minute. Add tomatoes and wine and bring to a boil. Add beans and herbs. Reduce heat and simmer until beans are tender about 20 minutes. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. In large skillet or pot, cook bacon over medium heat until crispy. Drain on paper towel. In large bowl combine cooked bacon, spinach and cheese. Add fresh ground black pepper to taste. Transfer mixture to prepared pizza crust. Spread mixture evenly. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until cheese is bubbly. Let pizza cool for 1 minute. Cut into wedges. Serve. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 9x13-inch pan. Mix cake mix and pudding mix together according to directions on box of cake mix. Spread batter into pan and bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 25 minutes. Cool completely and frost with chocolate sprinkles.

Saute the onion and ginger and garlic in the oil in a large skillet over medium heat for about 5 minutes until the onions are translucent. Add the curry powder, ginger and garlic, turmeric, cayenne, garam masala and saute for another minute. Add the frozen spinach and stir and cook until the spinach is fully thawed and tender. Add the yogurt and stir. Serve over rice.

Make a mixture of potatoes, cheese and egg. Add a little flour to bind mixture. Roll out mixture as thin as possible. Put one slice of butter in the pan for each cake. Put the cake in the pan. Put a slice of cheese in the middle of each cake. Put another slice of butter in the pan. Put a small piece of butter in the middle of the cake. Put a slice of cheese in the middle. Put another slice of butter in the pan. Put a small piece of butter in the middle of the cake. Put a slice of cheese in the middle. Put another slice of butter in the pan. Put a small piece of butter in the middle of the cake. Put a slice of cheese in the middle. Put another slice of butter in the pan. Put a small piece of butter in the middle of the cake. Put a slice of cheese in the middle. Put another slice of butter in the pan. Put a small piece of butter in the middle of the cake. Put a slice of cheese in the middle. Put another slice of butter in the pan. Put a small piece of but

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the scallions and saute 30 seconds. Add the veal and saute until lightly browned. Sprinkle the flour over the veal and cook until the flour is light brown. Add the wine and cook for 2 minutes. Add the cream and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer and add salt and pepper. Cook until sauce thickens. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Grease an 8 inch square baking pan with butter or cooking spray. In the bowl of an electric mixer, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add in the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Beat in the vanilla extract and maple syrup until blended. Stir in the brown sugar and cinnamon. In another bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder and saltstir into the wet ingredients just until blended. Fold in the pecans. Pour batter into the prepared pan and bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven, until the top is golden brown and the cake is set. Serve warm, at room temperature or chilled.

Place new potatoes in a saucepan with cold water to cover by an inch or two. Bring to a boil over high heat. Boil until potatoes are tender but still firm to the touch (about 10 to 15 minutes). Drain. Cool slightly. Place potatoes in a large bowldrizzle with olive oil and toss to coat well. Set aside. Meanwhile, in a large saucepan of boiling water cook broccoli florets for 1 minutedrain well. Place in a large bowldrizzle with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and toss to coat well. Add green beanstoss to coat. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine lemon juice with remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oilwhisk until blended. Toss dressing with potatoes, broccoli and green beansseason with dill, salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Transfer to a large platter or individual platestop with goat cheese slices and pine nuts. Serve immediately.

Brown sausage in a large skillet until cooked through. Drain off any excess grease. Stir in onions, bell peppers and saute for 5 minutes until soft. Stir in poblano and cook for another 5 minutes. Stir in tomatillos. Add in wine and simmer for 20 minutes. Serve over cooked brown rice.
