Preheat oven to 400. Wash and dry the squash. In a large bowl beat the eggs. Mix in the onions and the breadcrumbs. Add the black eyed peas. Season with the salt and the pepper. Place the squash in the bottom of the pan. Add the egg mixture. Pour the butter over the top. Bake for about 45 minutes.

Season fish and zucchini lightly with salt and pepper. Heat oil and sautee the fish and zucchini for 4 minutes. Add garlic and continue cooking until opaque. Add tomatoes and parsley and cook for an additional minute. Add lemon juice and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 425f. In a large bowl, beat butter and sugar until fluffy. Beat in egg yolks. In another large bowl, combine almond extract and flour. Stir into butter mixture. Divide batter between 6 ramekins. Top each with 1/3 cup pecans. Bake for 10 minutes or until edges are brown. Cool for 15 minutes. Spoon 2 tablespoons dark corn syrup onto bottom of each tartlet. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon powdered sugar. Top with 1 pecan half. Repeat with remaining tartlets and syrup.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Rinse duck under cold water. Pat duck dry with paper towels. Place duck breasts skin side down on the counter. Rub lemon pepper and garlic onto each side of the duck breasts. In a large bowl, mix olive oil with fresh lemon juice. Pour this mixture onto the duck breasts evenly and season with salt and pepper. Place duck breasts into oven-safe skillet (cast iron) and cook for about 18 minutes on one side or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the breast registers 160 degrees F. Transfer pan from oven to stove-top burner and cook duck breasts for an additional five minutes until duck breasts are browned and crispy on top. Remove from oven and let the duck breasts rest for five minutes before serving.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Sauté the onion until it begins to soften. Stir in the flour and cook for 2 minutes more. Whisk in the chicken stock until smooth. Bring the mixture to a simmer. Cover the saucepan and cook for 30 minutes or until the mixture thickens slightly. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let cool for about 30 minutes until it is slightly thickened. Remove the cooked chilis from their cans and add them to the saucepan with the onion mixture. Cook over medium heat until the sauce thickens slightly and the onion has softened. Stir in the garlic cloves and cook for 1 minute more. Serve with enchiladas or as a sauce for tacos.

Preheat oven to 375. Combine apples and brown sugar in a 9 by 12 inch baking dish. Drizzle margarine over apples. Cover dish with foil. Bake for 15 minutes. Uncover dish. Cook for another 10-15 minutes or until apples are tender. Place slices of bread around the edge of the baking dish to absorb some of the juice.

Cover bottom of 9 x 13 glass baking dish with sauce. Mix together all the bread pudding ingredients except the whipped topping. Spoon into prepared baking dishcover with foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until set. Cool before cutting into squares for serving.

Combine eggs, milk and all-purpose flour in medium bowlwhisk until smooth. Place brie cheese in bowl of food processorpulse until chunky. Add brie cheese to egg mixturestir until blended. Heat butter in skillet over medium heat until foam rises to surface of butter and sizzling begins. Pour pancake batter into skilletcook until bottom of pancake is golden brown and top begins to brown (about 3 minutes). Flip pancake and cook until brown (about 1 minute). Transfer pancake to platecut into wedges and serve with chives and cayenne pepper.

Boil water in saucepan. Add potato. Cook for about 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Put potato back in saucepan. Add in the soup. Bring to a boil. Add in the sour cream. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour soup over potato and cooked chops. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Serve over cooked rice.

Cook the pasta according to directions on the package. Drain well and transfer to a serving bowl. Heat the olive oil in a saute pan and add the garlic and the red pepper flakes. Cook until fragrant and softened for about 1 minute. Stir in the anchovies and cook for another minute or two. Pour the crushed tomatoes and capers into the saute pan and bring to a simmer. Cook for about 5 minutes and then season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour the sauce over the pasta and sprinkle it with fresh parsley and the tuna. Enjoy!

Prepare one pie crust as directed on box for 9-inch pie. Spread hash brown potatoes over bottom of pie crust. Cover with ground beef. Layer with cheese, onions, salt and pepper. Cover with top pie crust. Bake at 375 degrees for about 1 hour or until golden brown and bubbly. Let stand for about 10 minutes before cutting into wedges or squares for serving.
Mix all ingredients together. Pour into a greased and floured 9x13-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Bring chicken broth, water to a boil. Add rice and cook stirring until rice is tender and water is absorbed. Mix in cream of chicken soup. Cook for another minute stirring constantly. Add onion powder and vegetables. Stir in chicken and stir until well mixed. Spoon mixture into a lightly greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with reduced fat cheddar cheese. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Serve with extra cheddar if desired.

In a small bowl, mix together the boiling water and brown sugar. Cream the brown sugar with the butter until smooth. Add the egg and beat well. Sift the flour with the cocoa powder and fold into the wet mixture. Divide the mixture in two and roll each half into a log. Wrap each log in cling film and freeze until solid. Remove from the freezer and slice into 5-cm pieces. Place each slice on a greased baking sheet and bake for about 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and immediately dust with icing sugar. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. Store in an airtight container.
Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl cream brown sugar, eggs and oil. Add vanilla. Stir in flour and pecans. Fold in chocolate morsels. Pour into a greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake 20-25 minutes.

Boil 1 cup white rice for 15 minutes with the lid off and the rice should be just tender not hard. Heat olive oil in frying pan. Add chopped garlic clove, onions and green capsicum for 2 minutes on low heat then add tomatoes and pepper for 5 minutes more then add 1 cup boiling water with 1 cup margarine then add rice to the pan, put lid on the pan and cook for 15 minutes more then stir in salt to taste then put lid off the pan and cook for 5 minutes then serve hot with toasted bread or crackers.

In a large mixing bowl, combine the avocados with the juice of the limes. Add the cilantro and the corn kernels. Finely chop the red bell pepper and add it and the red onion to the avocados. Add the cheese and the hot sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. Refrigerate leftovers. Makes about 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In large bowl stir together cream cheese, sour cream, milk, eggs, corn kernels and corn muffin mix until combined. In a large baking dish layer corn mixture over muffin mixture. Sprinkle cheddar cheese over corn mixture. Bake uncovered in preheated oven about 45 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand about five minutes before serving.

Mix all ingredients except for raisins in a food processor. Add raisins last and pulse until mixture is well combined. Put mixture in a 9x13 pan greased with cooking spray and press down so that mixture fills the pan. Let cool. Cut into squares or bars to serve.

Heat olive oil over medium heat in large soup potadd onion and garlic. Cook onion for 4 minutesadd curry powder stirring to coat all the onions. Cook for about another minute. Add zucchini and potatocook for about 1 minute more. Stir in broth and saltbring to boil. Reduce heat to medium lowcover potcook for about 12 minutes.

In a food processor, finely chop fennel seed, garlic cloves and horseradish together. Add mustard, salt and pepperblend until smooth. In a shallow dish, combine panko breadcrumbs with the horseradish mixture. In another shallow dish, combine flour with 2 tablespoons waterstir until smooth. Dip fish fillets in flour mixtureshake off excesscoat in panko mixture. In an 11 x 7 baking dish, melt 2 tablespoons butter with oil over moderate heatadd fish filletscook for 4 minutes per side or until browned. To serve, top each fillet with 2 tablespoons lemon juice and 2 tablespoons horseradish mixturesprinkle with parsley. Serve with steamed rice pilaf or potatoes.

Boil carrots in water until tender. Drain. Combine brown sugar and water in a small saucepan. Cook and stir until sugar dissolves. Stir in carrots and cook until carrots are tender. Drain and mix with butter and vinegar.
Dice the mushrooms and place in a large bowl. Add all other ingredients except the fresh parley to the bowl. Stir well to coat. Let stand for 10 minutes. Serve on top of salad greens.

Melt peanut butter and margarine in a large saucepan over medium heatcool slightly. Add egg, vanilla, and bananabeat with an electric mixer on medium speed for 2 minutes. Combine flour, baking soda and salt in a medium bowlgradually beat into banana mixture. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour or until firm. Shape dough into ballsplace on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375°F for 12 minutes or until set. Yield: about 4 dozen.

Cut tomatoes into 1/2-inch cubes, then place them on a cookie sheet for 45-60 minutes to dry out. Remove from the oven and transfer the tomatoes to a mixing bowl. Add all of the other ingredients, including the olive oil, to the mixing bowl. Stir together with a wooden spoon until the tomatoes are evenly coated with the marinade mixture. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Combine sugar and eggs in a large bowl using an electric mixer. Mix on medium speed until light and fluffy. Add kahlua. Mix for 2 minutes more. Fold in pecans and flour until just mixed in. Pour into pie shell and bake until set in center and browned on top, about 45 minutes. Cool on a wire rack before serving. Makes 1 (9 inch) pie.

Preheat oven to 375. Grease an 8x8-inch baking dish. Beat the flour and 3/4 cup of the sugar together. Stir in the remaining 1/4 cup of sugar and the oil and beat until smooth. Stir the milk and vanilla into the egg mixture and fold into the flour mixture. Stir in the apples and cinnamon. Pour the batter into the prepared dish and bake for 35 minutes. Allow to cool for 15 minutes before serving.

Combine butterscotch and brown sugar. Add flour and cinnamon. Mix well. Pour into 8x11-inch pan. Arrange tart apples in pan. Dot with butter. Sprinkle oats and pecans over apples. Bake in preheated 350f oven for about 25 minutes. Serve with ice cream.

Heat the sunflower oil in a large pan and add the sausages. Cook until browned and crisp. Meanwhile, melt the butter with the chopped tomatoes and oregano in a small pan. Pour into the pan with the sausages when they are cooked. Add the beef stock and bring to the boil. Stir in the mushrooms and cook gently for 5 minutes. Add the olives and cook for a further 2 minutes. Serve with crusty bread.

Combine pork chops, red wine and salt in 8-quart slow cooker. Cook, covered, on low heat setting for 8 hours or until tender. Meanwhile, in food processor, puree onions, 1/3 cup water and flour. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup water. Add cornstarch. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup water. Whisk mixture into slow cooker. Cook for 30 minutes. Whisk cornstarch mixture in small bowl. Whisk into slow cooker. Cook 10 minutes more. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup water. Cook 10 minutes more. Serve pork chops with gravy over rice. Makes 8 servings.

Saute onion in oil until lightly browned. Add celery, garlic cloves, peppers, carrots, mushrooms, tomatoes, parsley and cumin. Cover pan with lid and cook for 20 minutes on medium heat. Remove lid and cook for additional 20 minutes until liquid is absorbed and the mixture is tender. Makes 2 servings.

Soak fish in water for about 1 hour or until just opaque. Drain fish. Pat fish dry with paper towels and season with salt and pepper. Preheat grill. In a small saucepan combine the vermouth and white wine and bring to a boil over high heat. Pour over fish and set aside for 15-20 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine the almonds, water and salt. Place fish on a lightly greased grill rack over medium heat and cook about 15 minutes or until fish flakes with a fork. Remove from grill and let stand for a few minutes before serving with parsley sprinkled over top and lemon wedge for garnish.

Wash and cut beets into cubes. Place on foil-lined cookie sheet. Drizzle with margarine. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Cover with foil. Bake at 375 degrees f. for 45 minutes. Let cool. Mash until almost smooth. Squeeze lemon juice over mashed beets. Stir in maple syrup. Mix well. Spread on foil-lined cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees f. for 30 minutes or until brown. Let cool. Store in airtight container.

In a medium skillet, saute the onion and apple in the butter over medium heat for 2 minutes or until onion is softened. In a large bowl, combine the pork with the onion and apple and season with garlic powder and parsley. Add the eggs, breadcrumbs, and barbecue sauce and mix well. Divide the meat mixture between the greased muffin cups. Bake at 375 until meat is cooked through and brown. Serve warm with barbecue sauce for dipping.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 9x13-inch baking dish with aluminum foil. Spray the foil lightly with cooking spray. Drain and press the tofu with a paper towel, and cut it into 1-inch cubes. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the cubes in 2 tablespoons of the oil until golden brown. Remove the cubes and set aside. Heat the remaining oil in the same pan over medium heat until it is hot. Add the curry powder and stir it in for about 1 minute. Add the orange juice concentrate and lime juice and stir well. Add the cubed tofu and the carrot. Pour the mixture into the baking dish and bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, stirring once during the cooking time. Remove the pan from the oven and top the baked mixture with the cherry tomatoes and pineapple chunks and bake for 10 more minutes or until the pineapple is tender and the vegetables are done.

Preheat oven to 425 F. Cut the brussels sprouts in half. Toss them with the olive oil. Place in a rimmed baking pan. Sprinkle with nutmeg, salt and pepper. Place the pan in the oven. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the brussels sprouts are tender and browned in places. Serve hot.

Cut beans into 2-inch lengths. Place beans in a large pot or kettle of boiling salted water. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes or until beans are tender but still crisp. Drain and rinse under cold water. Toss beans with bacon bits and seasonings. Transfer to a casserole dish. Bake for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Drizzle olive oil on both sides of chicken. Sprinkle with seasoned bread crumbs. In a small bowl, beat egg with shallot. Dip each chicken breast into the egg mixture. In a large skillet, place a tablespoon or so of olive oil. Add chicken. Cook chicken on each side until golden brown. Place cooked chicken in a 9x13 inch pan. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top with fresh parsley.

Combine cream and 3 cups of cranberries. Whip until soft peaks form. Fold in remaining cranberries. Transfer to a serving platter. Drizzle with walnut oil and dust with powdered sugar. Sprinkle walnuts over top.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and green bell peppersauté for 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in garlicsauté for 1 minute. Stir in potatoes, salt and black peppercover and cook for 5 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Uncoversprinkle with ham and cheese. Cook and stir over medium heat for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and mixture is heated through.

Crack tuna open and flake into pieces. In a medium mixing bowl, combine mayonnaise and pickle relish. Add tuna and stir to combine. Spread tuna mixture over 1 piece of bread. Place another slice of bread on top. Place sandwich between two sheets of wax paper and press down with a rolling pin until sandwich is about 1/4 inch thick. Cut sandwich in half. Serve with honey mustard.

Peel, core, and chop the apples. In a skillet over medium heat cook the apples until they are tender. Add the onion and cook until soft. In another skillet over medium heat melt the butter. Add the flour to the melted butter. Cook and stir until the flour is golden brown. Add the curry powder, apple mixture, and salt and cook until the apples are tender. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 180c degrees. Grease a 20 x 20cm square cake tin with butter. Place the chopped dark chocolate in a bowl. Melt the butter over a pan of simmering water. Dip the heatproof electric beater into the hot water and whisk until the butter is melted. Remove the bowl from the water bath and add the caster sugar to the bowl. Beat until the mixture is pale and creamy. Whisk the eggs into the butter mixture. Stir in the espresso. Sift the flour and salt into the mixture. Pour the mixture into the prepared cake tin. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until the mixture is just set. Leave to cool completely. To serve, cut into squares.

In a large skillet cook the onions, carrots, garlic, celery rib, apple in the oil until tender. Pour in the wine and port and stir until the wine is completely evaporated. Add broth. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are tender. Add parsley, salt and pepper. Serve with chicken.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Lightly grease a 9x13 pan. In a large bowl, combine the sugar and eggs. In a separate bowl combine the dry ingredients. Mix together. Add wet to dry mixture and mix well. Add carrots and walnuts. Pour mixture into greased pan. Bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for 45 to 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool completely.
